shadow: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token from the current quest.

name: Makeshift Passage
text: Forced: After you travel to Makeshift Passage, place 2 progress tokens on the current quest card, bypassing any active location.

name: Stagnant Creek
text: When Revealed: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Tentacle enemy, add that card to the staging area and raise each player's threat by 5.

name: Ill Purpose
text: When Revealed: All enemies in the staging area engage the player with the highest threat. Then, each player raises his threat by the total [threat] of all cards in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+3 [attack] instead if it is a Tentacle.)

name: The Watcher
text: While there is another Tentacle enemy in play, The Watcher cannot be optionally engaged.  If The Watcher is in the staging area at the end of the combat phase, each player must deal 3 damage to 1 character he controls.

name: Grasping Tentacle
text: Forced: When Grasping Tentacle is attacked, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has a shadow effect or is a Tentacle enemy, attach this card to an attacking character as a Tentacle attachment with the text: "Attached character's [attack] and [defense] are reduced to 0."

name: Striking Tentacle
text: Forced: When Striking Tentacle attacks, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has a shadow effect or is a Tentacle enemy, this attack is considered undefended.

name: Thrashing Tentacle
text: Forced: When Thrashing Tentacle is attacked, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has a shadow effect or is a Tentacle enemy, deal the damage from the attack to 1 character an attacking player controls (ignoring defense).

name: Wrapped!
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Wrapped! to a hero he controls. (Counts as a Tentacle attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot exhaust or ready. At the end of the round, discard attached hero from play. Combat Action: Exhaust a hero you control without a Tentacle attachment to discard Wrapped!.")

name: Hama
text: Response: After Hama is declared as an attacker, return a [tactics] event from your discard pile to your hand. Then, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Erestor
text: Action: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand to draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Fresh Tracks
text: Response: After an enemy is added to the staging area, deal 1 damage to that enemy. Players ignore that enemy while making engagement checks this round.

name: Erebor Battle Master
text: Erebor Battle Master gets +1 [attack] for each other Dwarf ally you control.

name: Ring Mail
keywords: Attach to a Dwarf or Hobbit character. Restricted.
text: Attached character gets +1 hit point and +1 [defense].

name: Out of Sight
text: Action: Enemies engaged with you cannot attack you this phase.

name: Ever My Heart Rises
text: Response: After you travel to a Mountain or Underground location, ready attached character and reduce your threat by 1.

name: Warden of Healing
text: Action: Exhaust Warden of Healing to heal 1 damage on up to 2 different characters. Then, you may pay 2 [lore] resources to ready Warden of Healing.

name: Word of Command
text: Action: Exhaust an Istari character to search your deck for 1 card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Love of Tales
keywords: Attach to a [lore] hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Response: After a Song card is played, add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Journey in the Black Pit
text: Setup: The first player attaches Cave Torch to a hero of his choice.

name: Journey in the Black Pit
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until you discard X locations, where X is one less than the number of players in the game (minimum of 1). Add those locations to the staging area, and shuffle the other discarded cards back into the encounter deck.  Each location gets +1 [threat]. If the players quest unsuccessfully, trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Continuing Eastward
text: When Revealed: The first player makes a locate test. If this test is failed, reveal cards from the encounter deck equal to the number of players in the game and add them to the staging area. Then, trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.  If the players quest unsuccessfully, trigger all "Lost:" effects in play. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Durin's Greaves
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Durin's Greaves to a hero of his choice as an attachment.  Attached hero gets +1 [defense].

name: Abandoned Mine
text: Lost: Return the top 2 Goblin enemies in the encounter discard pile to the staging area, if able.

name: Dwarven Forge
text: Lost: Each player must choose and discard 1 card from his hand.

name: Silent Caverns
text: Lost: Exhaust all characters.

name: Twisting Passage
text: Forced: Before placing progress tokens on Twisting Passage, the first player must make a locate test. If this test is failed, do not place any progress tokens on Twisting Passage and trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Fatigue
text: When Revealed: Each player must exhaust 1 character he controls, if able. Then, if any player controls no unexhausted characters, Fatigue gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: The defending player must exhaust 1 character he controls, if able.

name: Foul Air
text: When Revealed: The first player makes a locate test. If this test is failed, deal 2 damage to all characters and trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Gathering Ground
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to a location in the staging area with the highest combined threat and remaining quest points. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Each enemy revealed from the encounter deck gains surge.")

name: Vast and Intricate
text: When Revealed: The first player makes a locate test. If this test is failed, raise each player's threat by 7, remove all progress tokens from play, and trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Cave Spider
text: When Revealed: The first player draws 1 card. Then, that player must choose and discard 4 cards from his hand, if able.  Forced: After Cave Spider engages a player, that player must choose and discard 1 card from his hand, if able.

name: Goblin Sneak
text: Forced: After Goblin Sneak engages a player, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a treachery card, Goblin Sneak engages the next player, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Add Goblin Sneak to the staging area.

name: Goblin Warlord
text: Lost: Each player must choose and discard 1 ally he controls from play, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Trigger all "Lost:" effects in play.

name: Rock Adder
text: Rock Adder cannot be attacked unless it has dealt at least 1 damage this round.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, the defending player must discard 1 character he controls from play.

name: Glorfindel
text: Forced: After Glorfindel exhausts to commit to a quest, raise your threat by 1.

name: Longbeard Elder
text: Response: After Longbeard Elder commits to a quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a location, place 1 progress token on the current quest. Otherwise, Longbeard Elder gets -1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Path of Need
keywords: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a location.
text: Heroes do not exhaust to attack, defend, or commit to a quest while attached location is the active location.

name: Trollshaw Scout
text: Trollshaw Scout does not exhaust to attack.  Forced: After Trollshaw Scout attacks, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Heavy Stroke
text: Response: After a Dwarf deals X damage to an enemy during combat, deal an additional X damage to that enemy. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Imladris Stargazer
text: Action: Exhaust Imladris Stargazer to choose a player. That player looks at the top 5 cards of his deck and then returns them to the top of his deck in any order.

name: Light of Valinor
keywords: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero.
text: Attached hero does not exhaust to commit to a quest.

name: Daeron's Runes
text: Action: Draw 2 cards. Then, discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Healing Herbs
text: Action: Discard Healing Herbs and exhaust attached hero to heal all damage on 1 character.

name: Asfaloth
keywords: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero.
text: Action: Exhaust Asfaloth to place 1 progress token on any location. (2 tokens instead if attached hero is Glorfindel.)

name: The Dripping Walls
text: Setup: Place the Foundations of Stone encounter set aside, out of play. The first player attaches Cave Torch to a hero of his choice.

name: The Dripping Walls
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.

name: The Water's Edge
text: Forced: After a player commits characters to the quest, he must discard the top 2 cards of his deck.

name: Washed Away!
text: When Revealed: Discard all Item, Armor, Weapon, Light cards and all encounter deck cards from play. Shuffle all enemy and treachery cards in the encounter discard pile together with the Foundations of Stone encounter set. This deck becomes the new encounter deck. remove all other encounter deck cards from the game. Then, starting with the first player, each player draws a random stage 4 quest card. Remove all other stage 4 quest cards from the game.

name: Sheltered Rocks
text: When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Reveal 2 cards from the encounter deck and add them to your staging area.  Forced: After the 11th progress token is placed on Sheltered Rocks, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: The Endless Caves
text: When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Discard all resources from your heroes.  Forced: After the 17th progress token is placed on The Endless Caves, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: The Shivering Bank
text: When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Discard your hand. Reveal 2 cards from the encounter deck and add them to your staging area.  Forced: After the 7th progress token is placed on The Shivering Bank, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: Old One Lair
text: When Revealed: Create your own staging area. Reveal 4 cards from the encounter deck and add them to your staging area.  Forced: After the 5th progress token is placed on Old One Lair, join another player at the beginning of the travel phase. If you cannot join another player, all players continue on to stage 5 together.

name: Out of the Depths
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player, and add it to the staging area.  Each player cannot commit more allies to the quest than the number of heroes he is also committing to the quest.  If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Durin's Axe
text: Attached hero gets +3 [attack]. If attached hero is a Dwarf, it gets +1 [willpower].  Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective. Then, attach Durin's Axe to that hero as an attachment.

name: Durin's Helm
text: Attached hero gets +1 [defense]. If attached hero is a Dwarf, it gets +2 hit points.  Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective. Then, attach Durin's Helm to that hero as an attachment.

name: Drowned Treasury
text: If Drowned Treasury is the active location at the end of the quest phase, each player must discard 1 character he controls.  Response: After Drowned Treasury leaves play as an explored location, each player may draw 2 cards or claim 1 objective in play.

name: Mithril Lode
text: While Mithril Lode is the active location, it gains: "Refresh Action: Exhaust a character you control to place X progress tokens on the current quest card, bypassing any active location. X is the exhausted character's [willpower]. (Limit once per round.)"

name: Deep Deep Dark
text: When Revealed: Attach 1 card from the top of the first player's deck to each Nameless enemy in play, if able.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Nameless, the defending player must discard his hand.

name: Lost and Alone
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses and shuffles a hero he controls into his deck. When he draws that hero, he puts it into play.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Nameless, the defending player must discard his hand.

name: Nameless Thing
text: Forced: After Nameless Thing engages a player, attach the top 2 cards of that player's deck to it.  X is the printed cost of all attached cards on this card. If there are no cards attached, X is 3.

name: Elder Nameless Thing
text: Forced: After Elder Nameless Thing engages a player, attach the top 3 cards of that player's deck to it.  X is the printed cost of all attached cards on this card. If there are no cards attached, X is 4.

name: Moria Bats
text: Only characters with ranged can attack or defend against Moria Bats.  While Moria Bats is engaged with a player, it gets +1 [attack] for each other enemy engaged with that player.

name: Elrond
text: You may spend resources from Elrond's resource pool to pay for [spirit], [leadership], and [tactics] allies.  Response: After a character is healed by another card effect, heal 1 damage on it.

name: We Are Not Idle
text: Action: Exhaust X Dwarf characters to add X resources to a hero's resource pool and draw 1 card.

name: Hardy Leadership
text: Each Dwarf character gets +1 hit point.

name: Hands Upon the Bow
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with ranged to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against an enemy in the staging area. It gets +1 [attack] during this attack.

name: A Elbereth! Gilthonial!
text: Response: After an enemy attacks you, put that enemy on the bottom of the encounter deck. If your threat is lower than that enemy's engagement cost, set your threat equal to the engagement cost of that enemy.

name: Miruvor
text: Action: Discard Miruvor to (choose two): ready attached hero, add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool, attached hero gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round, or put Miruvor on the top of your deck.

name: Master of the Forge
text: Action: Exhaust Master of the Forge to search the top 5 cards of your deck for any 1 attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Peace, and Thought
text: Refresh Action: Exhaust 2 heroes to draw 5 cards.

name: Risk Some Light
text: Action: Look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. You may select 1 card and move it to the bottom of the encounter deck. Return any unselected cards to the top of the encounter deck, in any order.

name: Vilya
keywords: Attach to Elrond. He gains a [spirit] resource icon.
text: Action: Exhaust Elrond and Vilya to reveal the top card of your deck. You can immediately play or put into play the revealed card for no cost, if able. Otherwise, move the revealed card to the bottom of your deck.

name: Nearing the Gate
text: Setup: Remove Dark Pit from the encounter deck and place it aside, out of play. Add Durin's Bane to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Nearing the Gate
text: When Revealed: Reduce each player's threat to 0. Reveal X cards from the encounter deck, where X is one less than the number of players in the game, and add them to the staging area.

name: The Rear Guard
text: Forced: If at least 1 hero committed to the quest this round, place 4 progress tokens on The Rear Guard (bypassing any active location) at the end of the quest phase.  If Durin's Bane has 0 hit points, advance to the next stage of the scenario immediately.

name: Last Lord of Moria
text: When Revealed: Durin's Bane makes an immediate attack on the first player. Add Dark Pit to the staging area.  Players cannot win the game while Durin's Bane is in play. If Durin's Bane leaves play by the effect on Dark Pit, the players have won the game.

name: Dark Pit
text: While Dark Pit is the active location it gains: "Refresh Action: Exhaust X characters (maximum 3) you control to discard the top X cards of your deck. If all discarded cards have a higher combined printed cost than the remaining hit points of Durin's Bane, discard Durin's Bane from play."

name: Second Hall
text: While Second Hall is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After a character leaves play, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area."

name: Second Deep
text: While Durin's Bane has no damage on it, progress tokens cannot be placed on Second Deep.

name: Fires in the Deep
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 ally he controls, if able. If Fires in the Deep discarded no allies, it gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: The defending player discards 1 ally he controls, if able.

name: Counter-Spell
text: When Revealed: Attach Counter-spell to Durin's Bane. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: When a player plays an event, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a treachery card, cancel the effects of the event, discard the event player's hand, and discard Counter-spell from play.")

name: Inner Flame
text: When Revealed: Durin's Bane gets +3 [attack] until the end of the round. The first player may remove 1 questing hero he controls from the quest to cancel this effect.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Durin's Bane, it gets +3 [attack].

name: Inner Shadow
text: When Revealed: Heal 5 damage from Durin's Bane, if able. The first player may remove 1 questing hero he controls from the quest to cancel this effect.

name: Whip Lash
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 attachment he controls, if able.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Durin's Bane, the defending player discards all attachments he controls.

name: Leaping Flame
text: When Revealed: Durin's Bane makes an immediate attack against the first player (deal and resolve a shadow card).
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Durin's Bane, it gets +3 [attack].

name: Durin's Bane
text: Players cannot play attachments on Durin's Bane.  Durin's Bane cannot leave the staging area, is considered to be engaged with each player whose threat is 1 or greater, and attacks each of those players in turn during the combat phase (deal and discard a new shadow card each attack).

name: Ranging Goblin
text: When Revealed: Each player must deal 1 damage to a hero he controls.  Forced: After a character leaves play, shuffle Ranging Goblin and the top card in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Fiery Sword
text: When Revealed: Attach Fiery Sword to Durin's Bane as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Attached enemy gets +3 [attack]."

name: Many Thonged Whip
text: When Revealed: Attach Many Thonged Whip to Durin's Bane as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Forced: When Durin's Bane attacks, the defending player must discard 1 card at random from his hand."

name: Beregond
text: Lower the cost to play Weapon and Armor attachments on Beregond by 2.

name: Boromir
text: While Boromir has at least 1 resource in his resource pool, Gondor allies get +1 [attack].

name: Errand-rider
text: Action: Exhaust Errand-rider to move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Citadel Custodian
text: Lower the cost to play Citadel Custodian by 1 for each Gondor ally in play.

name: Mutual Accord
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Gondor card in play gains the Rohan trait, and each Rohan card in play gains the Gondor trait.

name: Wealth of Gondor
text: Action: Choose a Gondor hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Behind Strong Walls
text: Action: Ready a defending Gondor character. That character gets +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Spear of the Citadel
text: Limit 1 per character.  Response: After attached character is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Damrod
text: Action: Discard Damrod from play to lower your threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area.

name: Light the Beacons
text: Action: All characters get +2 [defense] and do not exhaust to defend until the end of the round.

name: A Watchful Peace
text: Response: After a location leaves play as an explored location, return it to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Blood of Númenor
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Dunedain hero.
text: Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [defense] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Hunter of Lamedon
text: Response: After you play Hunter of Lamedon from your hand, reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Outlands card, add it to your hand. Otherwise, discard it.

name: Ithilien Tracker
text: Action: Exhaust Ithilien Tracker to lower the [threat] of the next enemy added to the staging area to 0 until the end of the phase.

name: Master of Lore
text: Action: Exhaust Master of Lore to name a card type. Lower the cost for you to play the next [lore] card of that type by 1 until the end of the phase (to a minimum of 1).

name: Ranger Spikes
text: Play Ranger Spikes into the staging area unattached.  If unattached, attach Ranger Spikes to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.  Players do not make engagement checks against attached enemy. Attached enemy gets -2 [threat].

name: Envoy of Pelargir
text: Response: After Envoy of Pelargir enters play, add 1 resource to a Gondor or Noble hero's resource pool.

name: Alcaron's Scroll
text: If unattached, return Alcaron's Scroll to the staging area and it gains: "Action: Exhaust a hero to attach Alcaron's Scroll to that hero."  Forced: When the hero with Alcaron's Scroll attached is damaged by an enemy attack, attach Alcaron's Scroll to that enemy.

name: Harbor Thug
text: Forced: When the player whose hero has Alcaron's Scroll attached raises his threat, Harbor Thug engages that player.
shadow: Shadow: Any damage dealt by this attack is dealt to the hero with Alcaron's Scroll attached, if able.

name: The Leaping Fish
text: If Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero, The Leaping Fish gains: "Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck where X is the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area."

name: Pelargir Docks
text: While Pelargir Docks is the active location, enemies get +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].

name: Harbor Storehouse
text: Forced: Each time a location is discarded from the top of the encounter deck, raise each player's threat by 1.
shadow: Shadow: Deal attacking enemy an additional shadow card for each Thug enemy in play.

name: Collateral Damage
text: When Revealed: Discard 2 cards from the top of the encounter deck. Discard an additional 2 cards for each copy of Collateral Damage in the discard pile. Then, raise each player's threat by 2 for each location discarded by this effect.
shadow: Shadow: Any damage dealt by this attack is dealt to the hero with Alcaron's Scroll attached, if able.

name: Celador
text: While Celador is in the staging area, he is committed to the current quest.  Forced: After players quest unsuccessfully or a character leaves play, deal 1 damage to Celador.  If Celador leaves play, remove him from the game.

name: Ithilien Guardian
text: While Ithilien Guardian is in the staging area, he is committed to the current quest.  When Revealed: Add Ithilien Guardian to the staging area and Ithilien Guardian gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Southron Company
text: Southron Company gets +2 [threat] and +2 [attack] while the current quest card has the battle or siege keyword.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if the current quest card has a keyword.)

name: Ithilien Road
text: While Ithilien Road is the active location, the engagement cost of each enemy in the staging area is 0.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Blocking Wargs
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each character committed to the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Orc Scramblers
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each Battleground location in play, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to The Citadel if it is in play. Otherwise, attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Battering Ram
text: When Revealed: If the active location is a Battleground, deal 3 damage to it.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to The Approach if it is in play. Otherwise, attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Siege Raft
text: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to the lowest [threat] Battleground location in play, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to The Banks if it is in play. Otherwise, attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: The Citadel
text: If The Citadel has 11 or more damage, remove it from the game (do not collect its victory points).  Response: After The Citadel leaves play as an explored location, remove stage 4 from the quest deck, if able.

name: The Approach
text: If the Approach has 7 or more damage, remove it from the game (do not collect its victory points).  Response: After The Approach leaves play as an explored location, remove stage 3 from the quest deck, if able.

name: The Banks
text: If The Banks has 3 or more damage, remove it from the game (do not collect its victory points).  Response: After The Banks leaves play as an explored location, remove stage 2 from the quest deck, if able.

name: Orc Assault
text: When Revealed: Each character gets -2 [attack] and -2 [defense] until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to all Battleground locations in play.

name: Pickpocket
text: Forced: When Pickpocket attacks, the defending player discards 1 resource from one of his heroes' resource pools and 1 card at random from his hand.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards 1 of his attachments. (Discard all of his attachments instead if undefended.)

name: City Street
text: While City Street is in the staging area, players cannot travel to a location that does not have the title City Street.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Market Square
text: Travel: Each player must spend 1 resource from one of his heroes' resource pools to travel here.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards all resources in his heroes' resource pools.

name: Lost in the City
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 City location and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards his hand.

name: Local Trouble
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the highest threat cost without a copy of Local Trouble attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "When attached hero exhausts, readies, or triggers an ability, raise its controller's threat by 1.")

name: Zealous Traitor
text: Forced: When Zealous Traitor engages a player, that player must deal 1 damage to each ally he controls. (2 damage instead if Zealous Traitor was not optionally engaged.)

name: Lossarnach Bandit
text: Forced: When Lossarnach Bandit engages a player, that player discards 1 resource from each of his heroes' resource pools. (2 resources instead if Lossarnach Bandit was not optionally engaged.)

name: Umbar Assassin
text: Forced: When Umbar Assassin engages a player, that player must deal 3 damage to a hero he controls. (Discard that hero instead if Umbar Assassin was not optionally engaged.)

name: Lurking in Shadows
text: When Revealed: Return all Brigand enemies engaged with players to the staging area. If this effect returned no Brigand enemies to the staging area, Lurking in Shadows gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Overgrown Trail
text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger character to place 3 progress tokens on Overgrown Trail.
shadow: Shadow: Remove X progress tokens from the current quest, where X is the attacking enemy's [threat].

name: Secluded Glade
text: Immune to player card effects.
shadow: Shadow: Remove X progress tokens from the current quest, where X is the attacking enemy's [threat].

name: Lost Companion
text: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 character he controls from the quest, if able. Then, if any player has no characters committed to the quest, remove all characters from the quest.

name: Morgul Spider
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, Morgul Spider gets +1 [attack] for each character not currently committed to a quest.

name: Forest Bat
text: When Revealed: The first player deals 2 damage to a questing hero and removes that hero from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by X where X is the attacking enemy's [threat].

name: Watcher in the Wood
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of questing characters. (If the current quest has the battle or siege keyword, Watcher in the Wood gains surge.)
shadow: Shadow: Each player raises his threat by the number of enemies engaged with him.

name: Southron Mercenaries
text: X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+3 [attack] instead if it has the Harad trait.)

name: Haradrim Elite
text: Forced: When Haradrim Elite enters play, it makes an immediate attack from the staging area against the first player.
shadow: Shadow: This enemy attacks again after this attack resolves. (Deal a new shadow card for that attack.)

name: Mumak
text: No attachments can be attached to Mumak.  Mumak cannot take more than 3 damage each round.

name: Southron Support
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 Harad enemy and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Lieutenant of Mordor
text: Allies cannot defend against Lieutenant of Mordor.  When Revealed: Resolve the "when revealed" effect on the topmost treachery card in the encounter discard pile, if able. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Arbalesters
text: X is the number of different resource icons ([leadership], [tactics], [spirit], or [lore]) on heroes in play.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Orc Vanguard
text: While Orc Vanguard is in the staging area, resources cannot be spent from the resource pools of heroes who have a [leadership], [spirit], or [lore] resource icon.
shadow: Shadow: Deal the attacking enemy two additional shadow cards.

name: Orc War Camp
text: If an Orc enemy is in play, progress tokens cannot be placed on Orc War Camp while it is in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each shadow card dealt to it.

name: The Master's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses 1 sphere of influence ([leadership], [tactics], [spirit], or [lore]). Each character a player controls that does not belong to his chosen sphere takes 3 damage.

name: The Power of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Count the number of encounter cards in the staging area and shuffle them into the encounter deck. Then, reveal an equal number of cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Rabble
text: Forced: When Orc Rabble is dealt a shadow card, it gets +2 [attack] until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: Deal the attacking enemy an additional shadow card for each player in the game.

name: Orc Arsonist
text: Forced: When Orc Arsonist engages a player, deal 1 shadow card to each enemy engaged with that player.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. Deal it another shadow card.

name: Scourge of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Each player discards the top card of his deck. Until the end of the phase, raise the total [threat] in the staging area by X, where X is the total cost of all cards discarded by this effect.
shadow: Shadow: attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. Deal it another shadow card.

name: The Leaping Fish
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for The Leaping Fish and Alcaron's Scroll. Make The Leaping Fish the active location and attach Alcaron's Scroll to a hero.

name: The Leaping Fish
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Harbor Thug and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Fighting in the Streets
text: The players cannot advance to the next stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero.  When Revealed: Attach Alcaron's Scroll to the highest engagement cost enemy in play, if able. Otherwise, add Alcaron's Scroll to the staging area.

name: Escape to the Quays
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy and adds it to the staging area.

name: Escape to the Quays
text: Enemies cannot be optionally engaged.  Forced: The first enemy revealed from the encounter deck each round makes an immediate attack against the player who controls Alcaron's Scroll from the staging area.  The players cannot defeat this stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Ambush in Ithilien
text: Setup: Add Celador to the staging area. Search the encounter deck for a copy of Ithilien Road and make it the active location. Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Southron Company and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Ambush in Ithilien
text: If the players complete this stage with Celador in the staging area, advance to stage 3A (bypassing stage 2).

name: Southron Counter-attack
text: X is the number of players in the game.  After this stage is completed, advance to stage 4A (bypassing stage 3).

name: The Hidden Way
text: When Revealed: The first player takes control of all Ranger objectives in the staging area.  Enemies do not make engagement checks and cannot be optionally engaged.

name: Approaching Cair Andros
text: If any player's threat is 37 or higher, Approaching Cair Andros gains siege.  Forced: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.  If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: The Defense
text: Setup: Add The Approach, The Citadel, and The Banks to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: The Defense
text: Players must deal damage from undefended attacks to the lowest [threat] Battleground location in play. If there are no Battleground locations in play, immediately advance to the next stage.

name: Reinforcing the Banks
text: Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.

name: Breakthrough at the Approach
text: Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, instead of raising threat, each player must choose and discard 1 character he controls.

name: Breakthrough at the Citadel
text: Breakthrough at the Citadel adds 5 [threat] to the staging area.

name: The Last Battle
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.  If the players have collected 4 or more victory points, The Last Battle gains battle and loses siege.  If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Hirluin the Fair
text: You may use resources from Hirluin the Fair's resource pool to pay for Outlands ally cards of any sphere.

name: Warrior of Lossarnach
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [defense].

name: Gaining Strength
text: Action: Discard 2 resources from your hero's resource pool to add 3 resources to that hero's resource pool.

name: Knights of the Swan
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [attack].

name: Gondorian Shield
keywords: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Attached hero gains +1 [defense]. (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)

name: Ethir Swordsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Ring of Barahir
text: Attached hero gets +1 hit point for each Artifact attachment attached to it.  If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [lore] resource icon.

name: Anfalas Herdsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 hit point.

name: Mithrandir's Advice
text: Action: Draw 1 card for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon.

name: A Good Harvest
text: Action: Name a sphere. Until the end of the phase, you can spend resources of any sphere when paying for cards that belong to the named sphere.

name: Conspiracy
text: Setup: Create the underworld deck. Remove Roots of Mindolluin from the encounter deck and set it aside, out of play. Shuffle all Villain cards and randomly set one aside, out of play, without looking at it. Remove the others from the game. Repeat this with all Plot cards.

name: Conspiracy
text: When revealed: Search the encounter deck for The Fourth Star and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.  Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location, place 1 resource token on this quest.  If there are 4 or more resource tokens on Conspiracy, advance to the next stage.

name: The Grand Design
text: When Revealed: Reveal the set aside Plot card and add it to the staging area.

name: The Grand Design
text: When Revealed: Make Roots of Mindolluin the active location, returning any other active location to the staging area.  Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location place 1 resource token on this quest.  If there are 4 or more resource tokens on The Grand Design, advance to the next stage.

name: The Confrontation
text: When Revealed: Reveal the set aside Villain card and add it to the staging area.

name: The Confrontation
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the underworld deck into the encounter deck. The players cannot defeat this stage while a Villain is in play.  If this stage is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: Underworld Dissident
text: Underworld Dissident gets +1 [attack] for each Underworld location in play.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, remove 1 token from the current quest.

name: Daughter of Berúthiel
text: Daughter of Beruthiel cannot be optionally engaged.  Forced: After Daughter of Beruthiel attacks, return her to the staging area. The engaged player may raise his threat by 4 to prevent this effect.

name: The Hand of Castamir
text: Forced: After The Hand of Castamir attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck, resolve its effects, and discard it.  Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, The Hand of Castamir makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Telemnar's Bane
text: Forced: When Telemnar's Bane attacks, discard the top 3 cards of each player's deck.  Forced: After a player plays an event card, Telemnar's Bane makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Sewers
text: When Revealed: Place the top card of the underworld deck facedown underneath the active location, if able.

name: Roots of Mindolluin
text: Each location in the staging area gets +2 quest points.

name: Storehouse
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if undefended.)

name: Houses of the Dead
text: Forced: After Houses of the Dead becomes the active location, exhaust all characters.

name: The Fourth Star
keywords: Underworld X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: Response: When The Fourth Star leaves play as an explored location, each player may draw 1 card.

name: Unwelcome Discovery
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the underworld deck and add it to the staging area. If it is a Clue card, discard it instead.

name: A Knife in the Back
text: When Revealed: Randomly select 1 ally controlled by the first player, if able. The first player deals X damage to one of his heroes, where X is that ally's [attack]. Then discard that ally. If no ally is discarded by this effect, A Knife in the Back gains surge.

name: False Lead
text: When Revealed: End the quest phase without resolving the quest.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove all tokens from the current quest.

name: A Scrap of History
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 1 resource token on the current quest.

name: Secret Map
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective and attach it to that hero.  Action: If attached to a hero, add Secret Map to the victory display to place 3 progress tokens on the active location.

name: A Prisoner
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 2 resource tokens on the current quest.

name: Unholy Alliance
text: Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.  If a hero is destroyed by an enemy attack, the players have lost the game.

name: Up in Flames
text: Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Up in Flames and discard the top X cards of each player's deck. X is the number of resource tokens on Up in Flames.  If any player has no cards in his deck, the players have lost the game.

name: Poisoned Counsels
text: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.

name: Mirlonde
text: Each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon gets -1 threat cost.

name: Forlong
text: While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, ready Forlong at the beginning of each phase.

name: Strength of Arms
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon.  Action: Ready each ally in play.

name: Mighty Prowess
keywords: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Limit 1 per hero.
text: Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the enemy just destroyed.

name: Trained for War
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [tactics] resource icon.  Action: Until the end of the phase, if the current quest has no keyword it gains battle. (Characters quest using [attack] instead of [willpower].)

name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.

name: Against the Shadow
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [spirit] resource icon.  Action: Until the end of the phase, [spirit] characters use their [willpower] instead of [defense].

name: Harbor Master
text: Response: After a card effect adds any number of resources to the resource pool of a hero you control, Harbor Master gains +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Advance Warning
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [lore] resource icon.  Action: Until the end of the phase, enemies do not make engagement checks

name: White Tower Watchman
text: If each hero you control belongs to the same sphere of influence, you may assign damage from undefended enemy attacks to White Tower Watchman instead of a hero you control.

name: The Pursuit
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for Dr[attack]-buri-Dr[attack] and set him aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: The Pursuit
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

name: An Untimely End
text: Archery damage must be assigned to allies, if able.

name: Dru-buri-Dru
text: Allies cannot defend against Dru-buri-Dru.  While Dru-buri-Dru is in the victory display, characters get +1 [willpower] and +1 [defense].  Unless Dr[attack]-buri-Dr[attack] is in the victory display, the players cannot win.

name: The Passage Out
text: When Revealed: Add Dr[attack]-buri-Dr[attack] to the staging area.

name: The Passage Out
text: Characters use their [willpower] instead of [attack] when attacking enemies. If an enemy would be damaged this way, place progress tokens on it instead of damage tokens. When an enemy has progress equal to its hit points, add it to the victory display and place those progress tokens on the quest.  If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Drúadan Drummer
text: Each Wose enemy in the staging area gets +2 [threat].
shadow: Shadow: Each Wose enemy engaged with the defending player gets +1 [attack].

name: Drúadan Elite
keywords: Archery 2. Prowl X.  X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks unless any player pays 1 resource.

name: Drúadan Hunter
keywords: Prowl 1. Archery X.  X is the number of heroes in play with no resources in their resource pool.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Drúadan Thief
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks unless any player pays 1 resource.

name: Ancestral Clearing
text: The cost to play each player card is increased by 1.  Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here.

name: Garden of Poisons
text: Heroes cannot gain resources from card effects.  Travel: Each player must pay 1 resource to travel here.

name: Glade of Cleansing
text: Each Wose enemy gains Archery 1.  X is equal to the total archery value of the highest archery Wose enemy in play.

name: Men in the Dark
text: When Revealed: Each hero must pay 1 resource or take 1 damage. If no hero takes damage from this effect, Men in the Dark gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each hero the defending player controls with no resources.

name: Stars in Sky
text: When Revealed: Each questing hero must pay 1 resource or it is removed from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Discard all resources from the defending character's resource pool.

name: Leaves on Tree
text: When Revealed: Each player must pay 1 resource for each attachment he controls or discard all attachments he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.

name: Pippin
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, Pippin gains: "Response: After an enemy engages you, raise your threat by 3 to return it to the staging area. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you."

name: Denethor
text: Denethor gets -1 [willpower] for each damaged hero you control.  Discard Denethor if his [willpower] is 0 or less.

name: Lord of Morthond
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Outlands hero.
text: If each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon, Lord of Morthond gains: "Response: After you play a [lore], [spirit], or [tactics] ally, draw 1 card."

name: Book of Eldacar
text: Reduce the cost to play Book of Eldacar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [tactics] resource icon.  Action: Discard Book of Eldacar to play any [tactics] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Gondorian Discipline
text: Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to a Gondor character.

name: Minas Tirith Lampwright
text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, discard Minas Tirith Lampwright to name enemy, location, or treachery. If the next encounter card revealed is the named type, discard it without resolving its effects.

name: Small Target
text: Response: After a Hobbit hero you control exhausts to defend an attack, choose another enemy engaged with you and reveal the attacking enemy's shadow card. If that shadow card has no shadow effect, resolve this enemy's attack against the chosen enemy. If that shadow card has a shadow effect, resolve this attack as normal.

name: Ithilien Archer
text: Response: After Ithilien Archer attacks and damages an enemy, return that enemy to the staging area.

name: Ithilien Pit
text: Play Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.  If unattached, attach Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.  Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

name: Hobbit-sense
keywords: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit.
text: Combat Action: Enemies engaged with you do not attack this round. You cannot declare attacks this round.

name: Savagery of the Orcs
text: Setup: Set Ghulat aside, out of play. Put Lord Alcaron into play. Make Burning Farmhouse the active location. Add the Rescued Villagers and Dead Villagers objectives to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player and add it to the staging area.

name: Savagery of the Orcs
text: When progress would be placed on Savagery of the Orcs, move an equal number of villager tokens from this quest onto Rescued Villagers instead.  If there are no villager tokens on Savagery of the Orcs, advance to the next stage.

name: Protect the Villagers
text: When Revealed: Add Ghulat to the staging area.

name: Protect the Villagers
text: If an attack goes undefended, discard X villager tokens from Rescued Villagers instead of damaging a hero. X is the amount of damage that would have been dealt.  When the players defeat this stage, end the game. Compare the number of tokens on Rescued Villagers to the number of tokens on Dead Villagers.

name: Rescued Villagers
text: If a location leaves play as an explored location, move any villager tokens from that location to Rescued Villagers.  At the end of the game, if there are more villager tokens here than damage tokens on Dead Vilagers, the players have won.

name: Dead Villagers
text: If a villager token is discarded from a location, objective or quest stage, place a damage token on Dead Villagers.  At the end of the game, if there are more damage tokens here than villager tokens on Rescued Villagers, the players have lost.

name: Lord Alcaron
keywords: The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
text: Response: After a villager token is discarded, exhaust Lord Alcaron to place that villager token on a location instead.  If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Ghulat
keywords: X is the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
text: Forced: When Ghulat attacks, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.  While Ghulat is in play, the game cannot end.

name: Marauding Orc
text: Forced: After Marauding Orc attacks and destroys a character, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.

name: Orc Ravager
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location. If no villager token is discarded by this effect, Orc Ravager gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if undefended.)

name: Craven Eagle
text: When Revealed: Discard the character with the fewest remaining hit points. That character's controller may discard 3 cards at random from his hand to prevent this effect.

name: Burning Farmhouse
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard 1 villager token from Burning Farmhouse.

name: Gondorian Hamlet
text: While Gondorian Hamlet is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, discard 1 villager token from Gondorian Hamlet."

name: Secluded Farmhouse
text: Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

name: Burnt Homestead
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each damage token on Dead Villagers.

name: Trapped Inside
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location for each player in the game. If no villager tokens were removed by this effect, Trapped Inside gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.

name: Panicked!
text: When Revealed: Each player must take a villager token from Rescued Villagers and place it on a location in the staging area, if able. If no villager tokens were placed on a location by this effect, Panicked! gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each damage token on Dead Villagers.

name: Faramir
text: Faramir gets +1 [attack] for each enemy in the staging area.

name: Sword of Morthond
text: Attached ally gains the Outlands trait.

name: Men of the West
text: Action: Return X Outlands allies from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Knight of Minas Tirith
text: If each of your heroes has a printed [tactics] resource icon, Knight of Minas Tirith gains:  "Response: After Knight of Minas Tirith enters play, choose an enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and exhaust Knight of Minas Tirith to declare it as attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy."

name: Gondorian Fire
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Dunedain hero.
text: Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [attack] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Pelargir Shipwright
text: Pelargir Shipwright gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon.

name: Map of Earnil
text: Reduce the cost to play Map of Earnil by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon.   Action: Discard Map of Earnil to play any [spirit] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Ranger Bow
keywords: Attach to a Ranger character. Restricted.
text: Action: Exhaust Ranger Bow and attached character to deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

name: Forest Patrol
keywords: Play only if you control at least 1 Ranger character.
text: Action: Deal 3 damage to an enemy with at least 1 Trap card attached to it.

name: Palantir
text: Planning Action: Exhaust Palantir and attached hero to name a card type and look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that matches the named type, draw a card. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, raise your threat by 2.

name: Retake the City
text: Setup: Each player chooses 1 enemy and 1 unique location and add them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Retake the City
text: Forced: When an Osgiliath location leaves play as an explored location, the first player takes control of that location.  If the players control all Osgiliath locations in play at the end of the round, they have won the game.

name: Uruk Lieutenant
text: When Revealed: Add the topmost Orc enemy from the encounter discard pile to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls. (All attachments he controls instead if undefended.)

name: Uruk Soldier
text: Forced: After Uruk Soldier attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller returns a location he controls to the staging area, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each location he controls.

name: Southron Phalanx
text: While engaged with a player, Southron Phalanx gets +1 [attack] for each location that player controls.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each location the defending player controls.

name: Southron Commander
text: When Revealed: Southron Commander makes an immediate attack from the staging area against each player who controls at least 1 location.

name: West Gate
text: Action: If there is no active location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Osgiliath location, reveal it and add it to the staging area. Then, make West Gate the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.  Forced: After the player who controls West Gate lets an attack go undefended, return West Gate to the staging area.

name: The King's Library
text: Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.  Forced: After the player who controls The King's Library lets an attack go undefended, return The King's Library to the staging area.

name: Ancient Harbor
text: Combat Action: Exhaust a hero to place 1 progress token on Ancient Harbor.  Forced: After the player who controls Ancient Harbor lets an attack go undefended, return Ancient Harbor to the staging area.

name: The Old Bridge
text: Planning Action: Spend 2 resources to place 1 progress token on The Old Bridge. (1 resource instead if there is another Osgiliath location in the staging area.)  Forced: After the player who controls The Old Bridge lets an attack go undefended, return The Old Bridge to the staging area.

name: West Quarter
text: While West Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains siege. (Characters quest using [defense] instead of [willpower].)
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest [threat] to the staging area.

name: East Quarter
text: While East Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains battle. (Characters quest using [attack] instead of [willpower].)
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest [threat] to the staging area.

name: Ruined Square
text: Response: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 progress token on Ruined Square.  Forced: If a player controls Ruined Square when a character leaves play, return Ruined Square to the staging area.

name: Ruined Tower
text: Travel: If there is 1 active location, exhaust a character to travel here. (There are now 2 active locations.)  Forced: After the player who controls Ruined Tower loses control of a location, return Ruined Tower to the staging area.

name: Pinned Down
text: When Revealed: Add X to the archery total this round. X is the number of locations the players control. If the players control less than 4 locations, Pinned Down gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest [threat] to the staging area.

name: Street Fighting
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an Osgiliath location is discarded. The first player may exhaust a hero to take control of that location. Otherwise, add that location to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Counter-attack
text: When Revealed: Each player must return the location he controls with the highest [threat] to the staging area, or raise his threat by the total [threat] of all locations he controls.

name: Caldara
text: Action: Discard Caldara to put 1 Spirit ally from your discard pile into play for each other hero you control with a printed Spirit resource icon.

name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

name: Tome of Atanatar
text: Reduce the cost to play Tome of Atanatar by 1 for each you control with the printed Leadership resource icon. Action: Discard Tome of Atanatar to play any Leadership event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

name: The Hammer-stroke
text: Encounter Action: Engage each enemy in play.

name: Emery
text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the Tactics, Lore or Leadership sphere, discard Emery.

name: Children of the Sea
text: Action: Choose a Silvan or Noldor ally you control. That ally gets +2 Willpower until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, shuffle that ally into its owner's deck if it is still in play.

name: Anborn
text: Action: Exhaust Anborn to return 1 Trap card from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Poisoned Stakes
text: Play Poisoned Stakes into the staging area unattached. If unattached, attach Poisoned Stakes to the next eligble enemy that enters the staging area. At the end of each round, deal 2 damage to attached enemy.

name: Well-Equipped
text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. You may attach 1 attachment card discarded by this effect to an eligible Dwarf character in play.

name: The Ambush
text: Setup: Add the Crossroads and Black Numenorean to the staging area. Put the Faramir and Lord Alcaron objective allies into play. Shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

name: The Ambush
text: At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card. At the beginning of the combat phase, each player must either turn each of his hidden cards faceup or take 1 hidden card.

name: Captured!
text: When Revealed: Place Faramir and Lord Alcaron under Captured! (they are in play but players cannot gain control of them). Each player turns each of his hudden cards faceup.

name: Captured!
text: At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card. If a player has 5 hidden cards, he must turn them faceup. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Black Númenorean
text: X is the total number of hidden cards in the game. Forced: At the end of the round, each player must raise his threat by 1 for each hiddien card in his play area.

name: Orc Ambusher
text: Forced: After Orc Ambusher engages you, discard 1 non-objective ally you control, if able.
shadow: Attack enemy gets +1 [attack] (+3 [attack] instead if undefended).

name: Brutal Uruk
text: Forced: After Brutual Uruk attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller turns all hidden cards in his play area faceup. Deal a shadow card to each enemy turned faceup by this effect and resolve their attacks as normal.

name: Evil Crow
text: Forced: When Evil Crow engages a player, that player takes 1 hidden card.
shadow: Take 1 hidden card.

name: The Cross-roads
keywords: The current quest card gains siege (and loses battle).
text: X is the number of players in the game. Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Southern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Western Road
text: Western Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area. Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Northern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

name: Eastern Road
text: Eastern Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area. Travel: The first player must take 2 hidden cards to travel here.

name: The Dark Woods
text: X is the number of players in the game. Forced: After The Dark Woods leaves play as an explored location, the first player discards 1 hidden card.

name: Lying in Wait
text: When Revealed: The first player turns each hidden card in his play area faceup. Resolve the "When Revealed" effects of each encounter cards turned faceup by this effect. If a location is turned faceup, add it to the staging area.

name: Mordor Looms
text: When Revealed: Each player takes 1 hidden card.
shadow: If this attack destoys a characters, that character's controller turns each of his hidden cards faceup.

name: Conflict at the Crossroads
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, Orc enemies engaged with players add their Threat to the staging area. If no Orc enemies are engaged with players, Conflict at the Crossroads gains surge.
shadow: Take 1 hidden card.

name: Faramir
keywords: The first player gains control of Faramir.
text: Combat Action: Exhaust Faramir to turn 1 hidden card faceup. If that card is an enemy, deal 3 damage to it. If Faramir leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Lord Alcaron
keywords: The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
text: Action: Exhaust Lord Alcaron to return an enemy engaged with you to the staging area. If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Théoden
text: Each hero with a printed [tactics] resource icon gets +1 [willpower].

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Visionary Leadership
text: While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 [willpower].

name: Spear of the Mark
keywords: Attach to a Rohan character. Restricted.
text: Attached character gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area.)

name: Forth Eorlingas!
text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.

name: Steed of the Mark
keywords: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan character.
text: Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.

name: Lay of Nimrodel
text: Action: Choose a [spirit] hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +1 [willpower] for each resource in its resource pool.

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Scroll of Isildur
text: Reduce the cost to play Scroll of Isildur by 1 for each hero you control with a printed resource [lore] icon.  Action: Discard Scroll of Isildur to play any [lore] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Hidden Cache
text: Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control.  Action: Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.

name: The Rearguard
text: Setup: Set aside Lord Alcaron, Nazgul of Minas Morgul, and The White Bridge. Add To the Tower, Murzag, and 1 copy of Morgul Vale to the staging area.

name: The Rearguard
text: Murzag cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Murzag is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: The Betrayal
text: When Revealed: Add Lord Alcaron to the staging area.

name: The Betrayal
text: Lord Alcaron cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Lord Alcaron is defeated, advance to the next stage.

name: The Morgul Rider
text: When Revealed: Add Nazgul of Minas Morgul and The White Bridge to the staging area.

name: The Morgul Rider
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.  Nazgul of Minas Morgul cannot leave play unless destroyed.  If Nazgul of Minas Morgul is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: To the Tower
text: To the Tower cannot leave the staging area.  Remove Faramir from the game.  If 10 or more progress tokens are on To the Tower, the players have lost the game.

name: Morgul Bodyguard
text: Any damage that would be dealt to a Captain is dealt to 1 Morgul Bodyguard instead.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy engages the next player and makes an immediate attack, if able.

name: Morgul Sorcerer
text: Forced: After any number of progress tokens are placed on To the Tower, deal Morgul Sorcerer a shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player must place 1 progress token on To the Tower or treat this attack as undefended.

name: Morgul Tracker
text: Forced: When Morgul Tracker is optionally engaged, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. If undefended, place 1 progress token on To the Tower as well.

name: Murzag
text: Forced: After Murzag attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, put it into play engaged with the defending player.

name: Lord Alcaron
text: Forced: When Lord Alcaron attacks, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.  Forced: When Lord Alcaron is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, he makes an additional attack after this one (deal and resolve another shadow card).

name: Nazgûl of Minas Morgul
text: Nazgul of Minas Morgul cannot have attachments.  Reduce any amount of damage dealt to Nazgul of Minas Morgul to 1.

name: Morgul Road
text: Response: After Morgul Road leaves play as an explored location, the first player may remove 1 progress token from To the Tower or deal 1 damage to an enemy in play.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Morgul Vale
text: Forced: At the end of the round, each player returns 1 enemy engaged with him to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

name: The White Bridge
text: X is the number of progress tokens on To the Tower.

name: Impenetrable Fog
text: When Revealed: The first player places 3 progress tokens on To the Tower or reveals X additional cards from the encounter deck and adds them to the staging area. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Sleepless Malice
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 3 random cards from his hand or place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

name: Terror Drives Them
text: When Revealed: Place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each progress token on To the Tower.

name: The Dead City Looms
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of progress tokens on To the Tower. If there are no progress tokens on To the Tower, The Dead City Looms gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each progress token on To the Tower.

name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Eomer gets +2 [attack] attack until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Gríma
text: Action: Lower the cost of the next card you play from your hand this round by 1. That card gains Doomed 1. (Limit once per round.)

name: Saruman
keywords: Doomed 3. At the end of the round, discard Saruman from play.
text: Response: After Saruman enters play, choose a non-unique enemy or location in the staging area. While Saruman is in play, the chosen enemy or location is considered to be out of play.

name: Orthanc Guard
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, ready Orthanc Guard.

name: Isengard Messenger
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, Isengard Messenger gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.

name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Rohan Warhorse
keywords: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted.
text: Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.

name: Silver Lamp
text: While attached hero is ready, shadow cards dealt to enemies engaged with you are dealt face up. (Shadow card effects are still resolved when resolving enemy attacks.)

name: Keys of Orthanc
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, exhaust Keys of Othanc to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Legacy of Númenor
text: Action: Add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.

name: Deep Knowledge
text: Action: Each player draws 2 cards.

name: The Wizard's Voice
text: Action: Each player chooses 1 enemy engaged with him. Until the end of the phase, each chosen enemy cannot attack the player that chose it.

name: Power of Orthanc
text: Action: Each player may choose and discard a Condition attachment from play.

name: The Seeing-stone
text: Action: Search your deck for a card with the Doomed keyword and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Gríma
text: If free of encounters, the first player gains control of Grima.  Action: Exhaust Grima to draw a card.  If Grima leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The Islet
text: While The Islet is the active location, each Dunland enemy in play gets +1 [threat]

name: Fords of Isen
text: While Fords of Isen is in the staging area, players cannot gain resources from card effects.  Forced: After Fords of Isen becomes the active location, each player with fewer than 5 cards in his hand draws cards until he has 5 in his hand

name: The King's Road
text: While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, The King's Road gets +3 quest points.  While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, the King's Road gains: 'When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to The King's Road, if able.'

name: Gap of Rohan
text: While Gap of Rohan is in the staging area, Dunland enemies get +1 [attack]
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack].  If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Pillaging and Burning
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player raises his threat by 1 for each card in his hand.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls (each attachment he controls instead if this attack is undefended.

name: Down From The Hills
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either remove 1 time counter from the current quest, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. If any player has 5 or more cards in hand, this effect cannot be canceled.

name: Ill Tidings
text: When Revealed: The first player draws this card into his hand.  Ill tidings cannot leave that player's hand. Then, if the first player has 5 or more cards in his hand, Ill Tidings gains surge.

name: Mugash
text: Forced: After Mugash is defeated, the first player attaches him to a hero he controls and exhausts that hero.  (Counts as a Captive attachment with the text: 'Attached hero cannot ready. If attached hero leaves play, the players lose the game.')

name: Mugash's Guard
text: While a player controls a hero with Mugash attached, Mugash's Guard engages that player.  Forced: After Mugash's Guard destroys a character, if Mugash is attached to a hero, return Mugash to the staging area.

name: Methedras Orc
text: Forced: When Methedras Orc attacks, the defending player shuffles 1 random card from his hand into his out-of-play deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Methedras
text: While Methedras is the active location, each location in the staging area gets +1 [threat].  Forced: When Methedras leaves play as an explored location, each player Searches 3.

name: Orc Cave
text: Forced: After Orc Cave leaves play as an explored location, the first player Searches 5.  Travel: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck to travel here.  X is the number of players in the game. Add each Orc enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: Mugash's Lair
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, reveal the top card of each player's out-of-play deck.  Add each revealed enemy to the staging area and discard the rest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls.

name: Orc Territory
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a location and adds it to the staging area.  If the total [threat] in the staging area is less than the total [willpower] of all characters committed to the quest, each Orc enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack.

name: Mugash
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. Attach Mugash to that hero.  Forced: After attached hero takes damage, return Mugash to the top of the encounter deck.

name: Edge of Fangorn
text: Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and add it to the staging area to travel here (2 Huorn enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).

name: Dark-Hearted Huorn
text: Forced:  At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must raise his threat by 2.

name: Angry Huorn
text: Forced:  At the beginning of each resource phase, Angry Huorn attacks the engaged player.

name: Deadly Huorn
text: Forced:  At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must deal 3 damage to a character he controls.

name: Heart of Fangorn
text: While Heart of Fangorn is in the staging area, each player cannot refresh more than 5 characters during the refresh phase
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: The Forest's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each Huorn enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack.  If no attack was made as a result of this effect, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and put it into play engaged with him.  This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Skirmisher
text: Forced: After Orc Skirmisher engages a player, that player must either deal 3 damage to a character he controls, or remove 1 time counter form the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]

name: Orc Hunter
text: When Revealed:  Either reveal an additional encounter card, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes and additional attack after this one.

name: Orc Hound
text: Forced:  After Orc Hound engages a player, that player must exhaust a character he controls.

name: Orc Hunting Party
text: When Revealed: Deal each Orc enemy in play a shadow card.  Each Orc enemy gets -15 engagement cost until the end of the round.  If there are no Orc enemies in the staging area, Orc Hunting Party gains surge.

name: Dunland Prowler
text: While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, Dunland Prowler gains surge.  While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, Dunland Prowler gets +1 [threat]

name: Dunlending Bandit
text: While engaged with a player, Dunlending Bandit gets +1 [attack] for each card in that player's hand
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if the defending player has at least 3 cards in his hand).

name: Dunland Raider
text: Forced: After Dunland Raider engages a player, that player must deal X damage divided among characters he controls where X equals the number of cards in his hand.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control

name: Old Hatreds
text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, raise his threat by 1.')

name: Dunland Tribesman
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card.  Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, Dunland Tribesman gets +1 [threat] until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]

name: Dunland Chieftain
text: Forced: After Dunland Cheieftain engages a player, discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck where X is the number of cards in the engaged player's hand.  Put the topmost Dunland enemy discarded this way into play engaged with that player

name: Dunland Berserker
text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, Dunland Berserker makes an attack.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Wild Men of Dunland
