text: Forced: After Mirkwood Olog-hai attacks and destroys a character, remove 1 progress from the main quest for each excess point of damage.
shadow: Shadow: Either remove 2 progress from the main quest, or return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: Beast of Taur-nu-Fuin
text: Beast of Taur-nu-Fuin cannot have attachments and its shadow cards cannot be canceled. Forced: When Beast of Taur-nu-Fuin attacks, either remove 2 progress from the main quest or deal it an additional shadow card.

name: Amon Lanc Archer
text: Forced: After Amon Lanc Archer engages you, either remove 2 progress from the main quest, or deal 2 damage to an ally you control.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: Dol Guldur Marauder
text: Dol Guldur Marauder gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] for each resource on it. Forced: When Dol Guldur Marauder attacks, either remove 1 progress from the main quest or place 1 resource on Dol Guldur Marauder.

name: Battle Warg
text: Forced: After Battle Warg engages you, either remove 1 progress from the main quest or discard an attachment you control.

name: Gate of Dol Guldur
text: While Gate of Dol Guldur is in the staging area, it gains: "The player cannot travel or place progress here unless they are at stage 3B. Each player's threat cannot be reduced by more than 1 each round by player card effects."

name: The Sorcerer's Tower
text: While The Sorcerer's Tower is in the staging area, it gains: "The players cannot travel or place progress here unless they are at stage 3D. Forced: After a 'when revealed' effect is canceled, reveal the top card of the encounter deck."

name: The Shadow Road
text: The Shadow Road gets +2 [threat] for each facedown card attached to it.While The Shadow Road is in the staging area, it gains: "The players cannot travel or place progress here unless they are at stage 3F. Forced: After an event is played during the quest phase, attach it facedown to The Shadow Road."

name: Dungeon Door
text: While Dungeon Door is in the staging area, it gains: "The players cannot travel or place progress here unless they are at stage 3H. No more than 1 damage can be healed from each character each round."

name: Forest Battleground
text: Forest Battleground gets +1 [threat] for each ally controlled by the player with the most allies. Forced: When Forest Battleground is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Blackened Woods
text: Forced: When Blackened Woods is explored, discard the top card of the encounter deck and raise each player's threat by X, where X is that card's printed [threat].
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack. If this attack destroys a character, remove 3 progress from the main quest.

name: Servant of Sauron
text: When Revealed: The enemy in the staging area with the highest engagement cost makes an immediate attack against the first player.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Power Sevenfold
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dol Guldur location and add it to the staging area, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc enemy and put it into play engaged with him.

name: The Necromancer's Rage
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. Until the end of the phase, each damaged character gets -1 [willpower].
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character. Until the end of the phase, the defending character gets -1 [defense] for each damage on it.

name: Fear and Despair
text: When Revealed: Each player exhausts a character he controls. Until the end of the round, characters cannot be readied by player card effects.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

name: Fastness of Mirkwood
text: When Revealed: No more than 5 progress can be placed on the current quest this round. If Dol Guldur's city strength is 5 or lower, Fastness of Mirkwood gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack and +1 Defense until the end of the phase (+2 Attack and +2 Defense instead if at least 5 progress is on the quest).

name: Standard Game Mode
text: Setup: Add Dol Guldur to the staging area, attach a threat dial to it, and set its value to 5. Then, increase it's value by 5 for each player. For the rest of the game, that threat dial is the siege tracker and it displays the city strength of Dol Guldur. Flip this card over.

name: Standard Game Mode
text: While Dol Guldur's city strength is 0, each Lieutenant enemy loses indestructible. While the players are at stage 3, this card gains: "Forced: After resolving the Forced effect on Dol Guldur, randomly select a stage 3 that was not in play this round and resolve its Forced effect. Then, discard all progress from the current stage 3 and advance to a new stage 3 of your choice." At the end of the round, if Dol Guldur's city strength is 0 and there are no Lieutenant enemies in play, Dol Guldur is captured and the players win the game.

name: Epic Multiplayer Mode
text: Setup: Create 3 separate staging area, each with its own quest deck and encounter deck. Divide the players into 3 teams, one for each staging area. One team puts Dol Guldur into play in their staging area, attaches a threat dial to it, and sets its value to 5. Then, increase its value by 5 for each player at each stage. For the rest of the game, that threat dial is the siege tracker and it displays the city strength of Dol Guldur. Each other team removes their copy of Dol Guldur. Each other team removes their copy of Dol Guldur from the game. Flip this card over.

name: Epic Multiplayer Mode
text: While Dol Guldur's city strength is 0, each Lieutenant enemy loses indestructible. While the players are at stage 3, this card gains: "Forced: After resolving the Forced effect on Dol Guldur, the team with Dol Guldur in their staging area resolves the forced effect on the stage 3 that was not in play at any stage this round. Then, each team discards all progress from their stage 3 and advances to a new stage 3 of their choice. Each team must choose a different stage." Response: At the end of the round, a player who controls Host of Lorien or Power of Lorien may give control of that card to another player at any stage. If the last player at a stage is eliminated, the siege falls and the entire group loses the game. At the end of the round, if Dol Guldur's city strength is 0 and there are no Lieutenant enemies in play at each stage, Dol Guldur is captured and the players win the game.

name: Radagast's Request
text: Setup: Add Rhosgobel to the staging area. The opposing team searches the encounter deck for one different 0 cost enemy or 0 cost location per player and adds them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Radagast's Request
text: Forced: When Rhosgobel is explored, flip it over and add Rider of Mirkwood to the staging area. This stage cannot be defeated while Rhosgobel is in play.

name: Mirkwood Forest
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 1 or less (cost 2 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shufles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: A Fork in the Road
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a location with cost 2 or less, adds it to the staging area, and places a resource on it. Shuffle the encounter deck. The location with a resource on it is immune to player card effects and the players cannot travel to it while this stage has any quest points remaining. This stage cannot be defeated while the location with a resource on it is in play.

name: Mirkwood Forest
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 1 or less (cost 2 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shufles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Carried Away
text: When Revealed: The opposing team chooses an ally controlled by each player and places them faceup under this stge as guarded objectives with blank text boxes. Players cannot play or put into play any ally that shares a title with an ally guarded by this stage. When this stage is defeated, return each guarded ally to its owner's hand.

name: Mirkwood Forest
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 1 or less (cost 2 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shufles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: A New Terror Abroad
text: This stage gets +5 quest points per player. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, Rider of Mirkwood makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: The Necromancer's Tower
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 2 or less (3 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: The Tower of Sorcery
text: Forced: After the players have committed characters to the quest, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a treachery is discarded. Reveal that treachery. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: The Necromancer's Tower
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 2 or less (3 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Dungeons of the Necromancer
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards an enemy, adds that enemy to the staging area, and attached a hero he controls to it as a guarded objective (discard all tokens from the chosen hero).If there is an unguarded hero in the staging area, return it to its owner's control, exhausted. This stage cannot be defeated while there is a guarded objective in play. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: The Necromancer's Tower
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 2 or less (3 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Return to Rhosgobel
text: Rider of Mirkwood's engagement cost is considered to be 0. The number of damage tokens on Rider of Mirkwood cannot exceed the number of progress tokens on this stage.Players cannot defeat this stage while Rider of Mirkwood is in play. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Rhosgobel
text: Immune to player card effects.Response: After the players travel to Rhosgobel, add 1 resource to each hero's pool and each player draws 1 card.

name: Rider of Mirkwood
text: Immune to player card effects.X is 1 more than the stage number of the main quest. Cannot leave the staging area unless the players are at stage 3B.

name: Nazgûl of Dol Guldur
text: Cannot have non-objective player card attachments or take non-combat damage. Forced: After Nazgul of Dol Guldur attacks you, eithe return it to the staging area or raise your threat by 3.

name: Necromancer's Pass
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a card in his hand. The opposing team looks at the first player's hand and chooses a different card to place faceup under Necromancer's Pass as a guarded objective. While Necromancer's Pass is guarding a card, copies of that card cannot be played. When Necromancer's Pass is explored, return the guarded card to its owner's hand.

name: Pursued by Shadow
text: When Revealed: The highest [attack] enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player. If no attack is made this way, Pursued by Shadow gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is unique, it makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Bane of Amon Lanc
text: Cannot have non-objective player card attachments. Forced: After Bane of Amon Lanc attacks and destroys an ally, the defending player discards 1 card from his hand for each excess point of damage dealt by this attack.

name: Oak-wood Grove
text: While Oak-wood Grove is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on other locations in the staging area. Travel: Each player exhausts a character.

name: Smoking Blood
text: When Revealed: The opposing team attached Smoking Blood to a Troll enemy. If they cannot, Smoking Blood gains surge.(Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy. Forced: When attached enemy is dealt enough damage to destroy it, cancel the damage and discard Smoking Blood instead.")

name: Forest Flies
text: Forced: When Forest Flies attacks, raise the defending player's threat by 1.
shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Twilight Hall
text: Cannot have attachments. Twilight Hall gets +1 [threat] for each character controlled by the first player. Forced: When Twilight Hall is explored, reveal 1 encounter card per player.

name: Swarming Mosquitoes
text: When Revealed: Each player deals X damage to a character he controls, where X is more than the stage number of the main quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack (+2 Attack instead if the defending character has an attachment).

name: Goblin Sniper
text: Cannot be optionally engaged. Forced: At the end of the combat phase, easy player deals 1 damage to a hero he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character does not count it's Defense.

name: Pine Slopes
text: When Revealed: Each Pine Slopes +2 [threat] until the end of the phase. Travel: Raise your threat by 1 for each Pine Slopes in the staging area.

name: Under the Shadow
text: When Revealed: Attach to the main quest. (Counts as a condition attachment with the text: "Each player cannot play more than 1 card each phase.")

name: Necromancer's Warg
text: Forced: After Necromancer's Warg engages you, deal 1 damage to a character you control.
shadow: Shadow: If you are engaged with an Orc enemy and a Warg enemy, discard a character you control.

name: Dol Guldur Beastmaster
text: Forced: After Dol Guldur Beastmaster engages you, the opposing team searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Necromancer's Warg and puts it into play engaged with you. Shuffle the enconter deck.

name: Watched Path
text: Forced: When Watched Path is explored, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is an enemy, add it to the staging area.

name: Evil Storm
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a questing character he controls. Until the end of the phase, each damaged character gets -1 A' and cannot be healed.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Spider of Dol Guldur
text: Forced: After Spider of Dol Guldur attacks and destroys an ally, return it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Patch of Midnight
text: Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, discard Patch of Midnight and reveal the top card of the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Eyes in the Dark
text: When Revealed: The opposing team chooses a questing character controlled by each player. Ready each chosen character and remove them from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack. If this attack destroys a character, raise each player's threat by 1.

name: Eastern Crows
text: While there is a copy of Eastern Crows in the discard pile, Eastern Crows gains surge.

name: The Sorcerer's Tower
text: While The Sorcerer's Tower is in the staging area, each treachery gains Doomed 1. Forced: When the Sorcerer's Tower is explored, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until a treachery is discarded. Resolve the 'when revealed' effects on that treachery.

name: Power Sevenfold
text: When Revealed: The opposing team chooses any number of non-unique encounter cards in play. Discard the chosen cards and reveal an equal number of cards from the top of the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: Either reveal an encounter card, or treat this attack as undefended.

name: Hill Troll
text: Cannot have non-objective palyer card attachments.

name: Troll Cave
text: Response: After the players travel to Troll Cave, each player draws 1 card. Travel: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a Hill Troll and adds it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Befouled Equipment
text: When Revealed: [attack] to the character with the most attachments without Befouled Equipment attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: At the end of the round, discard an attachment from attached character. Befouled Equipment cannot be discarded this way unless it is the only attachment on attached character.")

name: Hunting Warg
text: Forced: After Hunting Warg engages a player, it makes an immediate attack. If Hunting Warg is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect for this attack, it gets +2 [attack] until the end of the phase.

name: Hunter's Lookout
text: While Hunter's Lookout is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: At the end of the round, raise each player's threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area."Travel: The highest [attack] enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Restless Hunters
text: When Revealed: Return each engaged enemy to the staging area. If no enemies were returned this way, Restless Hunters gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack. If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: Dol Guldur Orcs
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character gets -1 Defense for each damage on it.

name: The Shadow Road
text: While The Shadow Road is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After a player optionally engages an enemy, he deals 1 damage to a character he controls."Travel: Each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.

name: The Necromancer's Reach
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack (+2 Attack instead if the defending character is damaged).

name: Ravenous Spider
text: Forced: After Ravenous Spider attacks and destroys a character, the defending player exhausts a character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, exhaust a character you control.

name: Forest Gate
text: Forest Gate gets +1 [threat] for each enemy in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Nightfall
text: When Revealed: Attach to the first player's threat dial. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: Raise your threat by an additional point during the refresh phase.")

name: Venomous Spider
text: Forced: After Venomous Spider attacks and damages a character, that character cannot ready until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

name: Pitch-dark Thicket
text: While Pitch-dark Thicket is in the staging area, enemies in the staging area cannot take damage.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy was engaged this round, it cannot take damage until the end of the round.

name: Fastness of Mirkwood
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the encounter deck and discard pile for one different 0 cost location per player (limit 2) and adds them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, return the active location to the staging area.

name: Dark Bats
text: Forced: After Dark Bats attacks and damages a character, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. Then, discard Dark Bats.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack. Deal it an additional shadow card.

name: Forest Stream
text: While Forest Stream is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: At the end of the round, remove 2 progress from the main quest."Travel: Raise each player's threat by 2.

name: Treacherous Fog
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, each enemy and location in the staging area gets +2 [threat].
shadow: Shadow: Each enemy engaged with you gets +1 Attack and +1 Defense until the end of the phase.

name: Howling Warg
text: When Revealed: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card has the Warg trait, reveal it and add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack (+2 Attack instead if it has the the Warg trait).

name: The Wargs' Glade
text: While The Warg's Glade is in the staging area, the first Warg enemy revealed each round gains surge. Forced: When The Warg's Glade is explored, the opposing team searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique Warg enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Weighed Down
text: When Revealed: Exhaust each character with an attachment. If no character is exhausted this way, Weighed Down gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.

name: Captured by Spiders
text: Setup: Add Spider Den to the staging area. The opposing team searches the encounter deck for one different 0 cost enemy or 0 cost location per player and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Captured by Spiders
text: Setup: Add Spider Den to the staging area. The opposing team searches the encounter deck for one different 0 cost enemy or 0 cost location per player and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Forced: When Spider Den is explored, flip it over and put Mendor into play under the first player's control, ready. This stage cannot be defeated unless the first player controls Mendor.

name: A Chosen Path
text: When Revealed: The opposing teach searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 1 or less (2 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Lost in the Dark
text: The first treachery revealed each round gains Doomed 1 and its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled. Forced: After characters are committed to the quest, no more than 5 progress can be placed here this round (10 progress instead if Mendor is committed to the quest).

name: A Chosen Path
text: When Revealed: The opposing teach searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 1 or less (2 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Don't Leave the Path
text: Progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.During the travel phase, the players must travel to a location, if able. Forced: After characters are committed to the quest, no more than 5 progress can be placed here this round (10 progress instead if Mendor is committed to the quest).

name: A Chosen Path
text: When Revealed: The opposing teach searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 1 or less (2 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. Its 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Ambushed at Night
text: Each enemy in the staging area gets -10 engagement cost, cannot be optionally engaged and cannot take damage. Forced: After characters are committed to the quest, no more than 5 progress can be placed here this round (10 progress instead if Mendor is committed to the quest).

name: On the Trail
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 2 or less (3 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. It's 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: The Forest of Great Fear
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy, adds it to the staging area, the places a resource on an enemy in play with cost 2 or higher. While this stage is in play, the enemy with a resource gets +2 [attack], +2 [defense], and is immune to player card effects. This stage cannot be defeated while the enemy witha resource is in play. When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

name: On the Trail
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 2 or less (3 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. It's 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: To the Elvenking's Halls
text: X is equal to the threat level of the player with the highest threat level.Each player's threat cannot be reduced by more than 1 each round. Forced: After the players quest successfully, if 10 or more progress was placed here this phase, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: On the Trail
text: When Revealed: The opposing team searches the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card with cost 2 or less (3 or less if there are two or more players), sets it aside, and shuffles the encounter deck. Reveal the set aside card. It's 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled.

name: Escape from Taur-Nu-Fuin
text: Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Add that location to the staging area.If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

name: Spider Den
text: Immune to player card effects. Travel: The opposing team searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a 0 cost enemy and adds it to the staging area, if able (1 cost or less if there are two or more players). Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Mendor
text: The first player gains control of Mendor. If Mendor leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Ungoliant's Spawn
text: Cannot have non-objective player card attachments or take non-combat damage.While Ungoliant's Spawn is in the staging area, characters cannot be readied by player card effects.

name: Forest Grove
text: X is 1 more than the stage number of the main quest. Travel: Each player deals X damage to a character he controls.

name: Despair
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, treat each character's printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).

name: Chieftain Ufthak

name: Abandoned Camp
text: Forced: When Abandoned Camp leaves play as an explored location, the opposing team chooses a card in the encounter discard pile and shuffles it into the encounter deck.

name: Black Forest Bats
text: When Revealed: The opposing team chooses a questing character. Remove that character from the quest.

name: Enchanted Steam
text: While Enchanted Steam is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on the main quest. Travel: Each player exhausts a hero he controls. Those heroes cannot ready while Enchanted Stream is the active location.

name: Exhaustion

text: Forced: After Spiders of Mirkwood engages you, exhaust a character you control.

name: Wolf Rider

text: When Revealed: Raise each player`s threat by X, where X is the threat of the active location. If there is no active location, Dark Places gains surge.

name: Orc Horn Blower
text: Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, deal each engaged enemy an additional shadow card.

name: Goblin Dungeon
text: When Revealed: The opposing team chooses an ally, discards all tokens from it, and places it faceup as a guarded objective. When Goblin Dungeon is explored, return that ally to its owner`s control exhausted.

name: Deep Fissure
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a questing character he controls and removes that character from the quest.

name: Black Uruks
text: While Black Uruks is attacking, it gets +1 [attack] for each shadow card dealt for this attack.

name: Dreadful Gap
text: While Dreadful Gap is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on other locations in the staging area.Travel: The opposing team chooses a card in the encounter discard pile and shuffles it into the encounter deck.

name: Orcish Howls
text: When Revealed: Exhaust X characters, where X is the number of Uruk enemies in play. If there are no Uruk enemies in play, Orcish Howls gains surge.

name: Orc Raiders
text: Forced: After Orc Raider engages a player, deal it a shadow card.

name: The Great Bridge
text: While The Great Bridge is in the staging area, no more than 1 character can be declared as an attacker against each enemy.Forced: When The Great Bridge is explored, reveal 1 encounter card per player.

name: Vast and Intricate
text: When Revealed: The opposing team attaches Vast and Intricate to a non-unique location in the staging area. If there are no non-unique locations in the staging area, Vast and Intricate gains surge. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Attached location gets +2 [threat] and is immune to player card effects.`)

name: Chieftain of the Pit
text: Cannot have non-objective player card attachments or take non-combat damage.Shadow effects cannot be canceled.Forced: When Chieftain of the Pit attacks, deal it an additional shadow card.

name: Forked Passage
text: While Forked Passage is in the staging area, raise each player`s threat by 1 additional point during the refresh phase.Travel: Raise each player`s threat by 1.

name: Chance Encounter
text: When Revealed: The highest [attack] enemy in the staging area makes an attack against the first player. If no attack is made this way, Chance Encounter gains surge.

name: Nameless Thing
text: Forced: After Nameless Thing enters play, the first player attaches the top card of his deck to it faceup as a guarded attached. Nameless Thing gets +X [threat], +X [attack], and +X [defense], where X is that card`s printed cost. When Nameless Thing leaves play, discard that card.

name: Mithril Lode
text: While Mitril Lode is the active location, it gains: `Response: When Mithril Lode is explored, each player adds 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero he controls.

name: A Foe Beyond
text: When Revealed: The opposing team chooses an attachment controlled by a player and discards it. If no attachment is discarded this way, A Foe Beyond gains surge.

name: Easy Mode
text: Setup: Players prepare their fleet. Prepare the Corsair deck. Set the following enemies aside: all 7 unique enemies (including the Dreadnaught), 2 copies of Black Sails, and 1 copy of Corsair Warship. Add the Cobas Haven loction to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Add 1 resource to each hero`s resource pool. Flip this card over and place it next to the quest deck.

name: Easy Mode
text: Each player draws 1 additional card during the resource phase. Quest Action: Deal 10 damage to a non-unique enemy engaged with a player in any group. (Group limit once per game.) If a player controls no ship-objective, that player is eliminated from the game.

name: Standard Mode
text: Setup: Players prepare their fleet. Prepare the Corsair deck. Set the following enemies aside: all 7 unique enemies (including the Dreadnaught). Shuffle the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until 2 locations are discarded (3 locations instead if there are 3 or more players). Add those locations to the staging area. Flip this card over and place it next to the quest deck.

name: Standard Mode
text: Quest Action: Deal 10 damage to a non-unique enemy engaged with a player in any group. (Group limit once per game.) If a player controls no ship-objective, that player is eliminated from the game.

name: Hard Mode
text: Setup: Players prepare their fleet. Prepare the Corsair deck. Set the following enemies aside: all 7 unique enemies (including the Dreadnaught). Add 3 Tolfalas Landing locations to the staging area (3 Tolfalas Landing locations and 2 Wicked Cove locations if there are 3 or more players). Shuffle the encounter deck. Flip this card over and place it next to the quest deck.

name: Hard Mode
text: Each player's threat cannot be reduced by more than 1 each round. Forced: After a character is healed or readied by a player card effect, its controller raises their threat by 1. If a player controls no ship-objective, that player is eliminated from the game.

name: Searching the High Seas
text: *This stage has a global quest point value of 8 per player among all groups.No more than 5 progress per player can be placed on this stage each round.The players can only advance at the end of the quest phase.

name: Destroy the Dreadnaught
text: When Revealed: Add the set-aside Dreadnaught enemy to the staging area, Elite side faceup.

name: Destroy the Dreadnaught
text: No more than 5 progress per player can be placed on this stage each round.Action: Remove 5 progress per player from this stage to choose any group to shuffle 1 set aside Gondorian Warship card into their encounter deck.Response: When the Dreadnaught attacks you, raise your threat by 4 to cancel the attack.When the Dreadnaught is destroyed, the players win the game.

name: Eithiliant
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Each hero you control gets +1 [willpower].Setup: Choose a hero you control. Until the end of the game, that hero gains the printed Traits of another hero you control.

name: Eithiliant
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Each hero you control gets +2 [willpower].Response: After Eithiliant flips, shuffle up to 6 cards from your discard pile into your deck. Place 6 progress on a location in any group.

name: Golden Wing
text: Immune to player card effects. Ranged. Sentinel.Each hero you control gets +1 hit point.Reduce your threat by 3. Choose a hero you control. Until the end of the game, that hero gains ranged.

name: Golden Wing
text: Immune to player card effects. Ranged. Sentinel.Each hero you control gains +2 hit points and gains ranged.Response: After Golden Wing flips, deal 6 damage to an enemy in any group.

name: Pride of Lebennin
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Each hero you control gets +1 [defense].Forced: When you draw your starting hand, draw 5 additional cards, then shuffle 5 cards from your hand into your deck. You cannot take a mulligan.

name: Pride of Lebennin
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Each hero you control gets +2 [defense].Response: After Pride of Lebennin flips, heal 2 damage from a character. Choose up to 2 cards from the encounter discard pile and add them to the victory display.

name: Silent Mist
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Your starting hand size is 8 cards.Action: Play an event from your hand with a cost 3 or more, reducing its cost by 1.

name: Silent Mist
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Response: After Silent Mist flips, choose up to 2 events from your discard pile and/or your collection and add them to your hand (following deckbuilding rules).Action: Play an event from your hand with cost 3 or more, reducing its cost by 2.

name: Swan Ship of Dol Amroth
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Setup: Add 1 resource to each of your heroes` resource pools.Action: Spend 2 resources to ready a character. (Limit once per round.)

name: Swan Ship of Dol Amroth
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Response: After Swan Ship of Dol Amroth flips, add 2 resources to a hero`s resource pool. Ready a card.Action: Spend 1 resource to ready a card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Twilight's Call
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.The first card you play each round does not require a resource match.Action: Play an ally or attachment from your hand. (Limit once per round.)

name: Twilight's Call
text: Immune to player card effects. Sentinel.Each card you play does not require a resource match.Response: After Twilight`s Call flips, draw 3 cards.Action: Play an ally or attachment from your hand.

name: Gondorian Warship
text: Immune to player card effects. Ranged. Sentinel.When Revealed: Choose a player. That player gains control of Gondorian Warship.Forced: When Gondorian Warship is destroyed, set it aside, out of play.

name: Dreadnaught
text: Archery 1 Per Player. Immune to player card effects. Cannot take more than 5 damage per player each round.*The Dreadnaught has global hit point value (15 hit points for each player among all groups).Forced: At the end of the round if the Dreadnaught has less than half of its starting hit pints, flip it over.

name: Dreadnaught
text: Massive. Immune to player card effects. Cannot take more than 5 damage per player each round.*The Dreadnaught has a global hit point value of 15 per player among all groups.Forced: After the Dreadnaught flips, each player puts 1 set-aside unique Corsair enemy into play at random engaged with them.

name: Captain of the Haven
text: Immune to player card effects. Pillage 8.Engaged player cannot attack the Dreadnaught.Forced: At the end of the combat phase, if engaged player has no cards in their deck, that player is eliminated from the game.

name: Commander of the Dreadnaught
text: Immune to player card effects.Engaged player cannot attack the Dreadnaught.Forced: After Commander of the Dreadnaught attacks you, the Dreadnaught attacks you.

name: Descendant of Castamir
text: Immune to player card effects.Engaged player cannot attack the Dreadnaught.Forced: After Descendant of Castamir engages you, put the top 2 cards of the Corsair deck into play engaged with you and deal each of them 1 shadow card.

name: Hydraken
text: Immune to player cards effects.Engaged player cannot attack the Dreadnaught.Forced: After Hydraken attacks, he makes an additional attack. Deal him 2 additional shadow cards for this attack and engaged player raises their threat by 4. (Limit once per round.)

name: Ophidian
text: Immune to player card effects. No more than 1 character can attack Ophidian each round.Engaged player cannot attack the Dreadnaught.Forced: When a character defends against Ophidian, deal 2 damage to that character.

name: Varjax
text: Archery 3. Immune to player card effects.Engaged player cannot attack the Dreadnaught.For each point of excess combat damage dealt by Varjax, defending player deals 1 damage to a Ship they control.

name: Brash Corsair
text: Forced: When engaged player exhausts a Ship objective, Brash Corsair attacks that player.

name: Corsair Plunderer
text: Pillage 2. (After this enemy attacks you, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.)Forced: After an event card is discarded from your deck by Corsair Plunderer`s Pillage keyword, discard an attachment you control.

name: Daring Buccaneer
text: Pillage 3. (After this enemy attacks you, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.)Forced: After an event card is discarded from your deck by Daring Buccaneer`s Pillage keyword, deal 1 damage to a character you control.

name: Fierce Marauder
text: Pillage 3. (After this enemy attacks you, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.)Forced: After an event card is discarded from your deck by Fierce Marauder`s Pillage keyword, discard 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control.

name: Southron Sailor
text: While Southron Sailor is engaged with you, each Ship enemy engaged with you contributes its [threat] to the total [threat] in the staging area.

name: Umbar Captain
text: Engaged player cannot attack Ship enemies.

name: Black Sails
text: Boarding 2. Cannot have attachments.While Black Sails is in the staging area, it gains Archery 3.

name: Corsair Skiff
text: Surge. Cannot have attachments.Forced: When Corsair Skiff engages you from the staging area, eithe raise your threat by 3 or it gains Bording 1.

name: Corsair Skirmisher
text: Boarding 1. Immune to player card effects.Response: After Corsair Skirmisher is destroyed as an enemy, the engaged player may discard allies they control with a total of at least 3 [willpower] to take control of Corsair Skirmisher as a ship-objective with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. (It loses the ship-enemy card type and gaines the ship-objective card type).

name: Corsair Warship
text: Boarding 3. Cannot have attachments.While Corsair Warship is in the staging area, it cannot be damaged and gains Archery 4.

name: Ramming Ship
text: Cannot have attachments.Forced: After Ramming Ship engages you, it gets +4 [attack] until the end of the round.

name: Slave Ship
text: Boarding 1. Cannot have attachments.For each point of damage that is dealt to a Ship objective by Slave Ship`s attack, deal 1 point of damage to a non-Ship character controlled by the defending player, as well.

name: War Galley
text: Archery 2. Boarding 1. Cannot have attachments.Forced: When War Galley engages you from the staging area, either raise your threat by 4 or it gains Boarding 1.

name: Sea Monster
text: Ship objectives may attack and defend against Sea Monster.When Revealed: Deal 4 damage to the Ship enemy or Ship objective with the fewest remaining hit points.

name: Belfalas Shipyard
text: Response: After Belfalas Shipyard is explored as the active location, the players as a group spend 5 resources to heal 5 damage from a Ship objective in any group. Ready that Ship and flip it to its Upgraded side.

name: Cobas Haven
text: While Cobas Haven is the active location, reduce the Boading value on each Ship enemy by 1.

name: Isle of Fortune
text: Isle of Fortune enters play with 1 resource per player on it.Forced: After a Ship enemy enters play, discard 1 resource from Isle of Fortune.Response: When Isle of Fortune is explored as the active location, move each resource on it to a hero`s resource pool.

name: Mouths of Anduin
text: While Mouths of Anduin is in the staging area, is gains: `Forced: After a `when revealed` effect is canceled, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.`

name: Tolfalas Landing
text: While Tofalas Landing is in the staging area, it gains: `Forced: After a player draws any number of cards from a player card effect, that player raises their threat by that number.`

name: Wicked Cove
text: Each location in the staging area is immune to player card effects.

name: Ballista Barrage
text: Doomed 1. (Raise each players threat by 1.)When Revealed: Until the end of the round, each Ship enemy gains Archery 2.

name: Boarding Party
text: When Revealed: Each player puts the top card of the Corsair deck into play engaged with them.

name: Grappled!
text: When Revealed: Attach to a Ship objective. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Attached objective cannot ready. Action: Exhaust 3 characters to discard Grappled!`)

name: Out of the Mist
text: When Revealed: The enemy with the highest engagement cost engages the first player and attacks them. If no attack is made this way, Out of the Mist gains surge.

name: Overworked
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, treat the text box of each non-Ship ally as blank, except for Traits. If a player controls 7 or more allies, Overworked gains surge.

name: Taking on Water
text: When Revealed: Attach to a Ship objective. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Forced: When attached objective exhausts, deal 2 damage to it. Action: Exhaust 3 characters to discard Taking on Water.`)

name: Violent Tempest
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each enemy. Each player assigns X among characters they control. X is the number of exhausted characters they control.

name: A Perilous Voyage
text: Your minimum deck size is 100 cards.Your threat cannot be reduced by player card effects.Action: Exhaust this card and raise your threat by 1 to look at the top 2 cards of your deck, draw 1, and place the other on the bottom of your deck.Forced: When you would be eliminated by reaching your threat elimination level, flip this card over instead.

name: A Perilous Voyage
text: Your threat cannot be reduced by non-contract player card effects. Heroes you control do not exhaust to quest. Forced: When this card is flipped to this side, reduce your threat by 10. Search your deck for a card and either add it to your hand or play it, reducing its cost by 3. Shuffle your deck.

name: Passage Through Mirkwood
text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

name: Passage Through Mirkwood
text: You are playing Nightmare mode.   Forced: During setup, each player reveals 1 card from the encounter deck and adds it to the staging area.

name: Ungoliant's Spawn
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, each character currently committed to the quest gets -2 [willpower] and is discarded if its [willpower] is 0.
shadow: Shadow: Raise the defending player's theat by 5. (Raise the defending player's threat by 10 instead if undefended.)

name: Ungoliant's Brood
text: Forced: After you engage Ungoliant's Brood, your cards cannot ready for the remainder of the round.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, exhaust all characters you control.

name: Forest Flies
text: Forced: After you engage Forest Flies, deal 1 damage to each exhausted character you control.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is an Insect, deal it 2 additional Shadow cards.

name: Spiders of Mirkwood
text: While it is engaged with you, Spiders of Mirkwood gets +1 [attack] for each exhausted character you control.
shadow: Shadow: Choose and exhaust 1 character you control. If this attack was undefended, also deal that character 2 damage.

name: The Spider's Web
text: When Revealed: The player with the highest threat exhausts all heroes he controls. Then, attach this card to one of that player's heroes. (Counts as a condition attachment with the text, "Each time attached hero readies, deal it 1 damage.")

name: Backtrack!
text: When Revealed: The topmost enemy or location card in the encounter discard pile is returned to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Deal and resolve the topmost Shadow effect in the encounter discard pile for this attack.

name: Abandoned Camp
text: Forced: After Abandoned Camp leaves play, each player must deal 2 damage to each exhausted character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, discard all attachment cards players control.

name: Glade of the Spawn
text: When Glade of the Spawn is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After a Spider enemy enters play, each player must choose and exhaust 1 character he controls."

name: Journey Along the Anduin
text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

name: Journey Along the Anduin
text: You are playing Nightmare mode.   All Troll enemies gain the text: "Cannot have attachments."  If the encounter deck is empty (at any time), shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

name: Marshland Outlaws
text: If you are engaged with this enemy, you cannot attack or deal damage (through effects) to enemies with a title other than Marshland Outlaws.
shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by X. X is the amount of damage dealt by this attack.

name: Anduin Troll Spawn
text: If there is no Hill Troll in play, Anduin Troll Spawn gains surge.  Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, Anduin Troll Spawn engages a player engaged with a Hill Troll.

name: Brown Water Rats
keywords: Brown Water Rats cannot be damaged.
text: Forced: If the players are on stage 3 and all remaining enemies have the printed Rat trait, discard Brown Water Rats from play.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy cannot be damaged this round.

name: A Flooded Ford
text: Each card revealed by the encounter deck gains doomed X. X is the number of progress tokens on this card.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, put A Flooded Ford into the staging area with 1 progress token on it.

name: Gladden Marshlands
text: Action: Deal 1 damage to a hero you control to reduce Gladden Marshlands' [threat] by 1 until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this effect.
shadow: Shadow: Each enemy engaged with the defending character gets +1 [attack] until the end of the phase. (+2 [attack] instead if this attack is undefended.)

name: Pursuit on the Shore
text: When Revealed: Search the victory display and encounter discard pile for the enemy with the most hit points. Return that enemy to the staging area. If no enemy is returned by this effect, Pursuit on the Shore gains surge. (Cannot be canceled.)

name: Troll Attack
text: When Revealed: All engaged Troll enemies attack. If no Troll enemies are engaged, Troll Attack gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, resolve this attack against each player. (Attack is undefended against each player not engaged with this enemy.)

name: Smoking Blood
text: When Revealed: Remove all damage from all enemies. Then, each player raises his threat by the amount of damage just removed from his engaged enemies. If no damage is removed by this effect, Smoking Blood gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Move all damage on this enemy to the defending character. (If undefended, move the damage to the hero damaged by this attack.)

name: Escape from Dol Guldur
text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

name: Escape from Dol Guldur
text: You are playing Nightmare mode.   Forced: When stage 1B is revealed, the number of random heroes captured is determined by the number of players, as follows: 1-2 players = 1 hero captured, 3 players = 2 heroes captured, 4 players = 3 heroes captured. All captured heroes are turned face down and considered "the prisoner," cannot be used, cannot be damaged, and do not collect resources until they are rescued. (A single player cannot have more than 1 hero captured by this effect.)

name: Torture Master
text: When Revealed: Add 1 resource token to each Dol Guldur location in play.
shadow: Shadow: Any hero damaged (but not defeated) by this attack is turned face down, as a "prisoner." Then, if the players are on stage 3, return to stage 2B of the quest.

name: Crazed Captive
text: Forced: If Crazed Captive is defeated, raise each player's threat by 7.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is not defeated this phase, raise defending player's threat by 7 at the end of the phase.

name: Spider of Dol Guldur
text: If there are any unclaimed objectives in play, Spider of Dol Guldur gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +3 [attack] for each unclaimed objective in play.

name: Torture Chamber
text: If Torture Chamber has 4 or more resource tokens on it, all "prisoners" were killed, and the players have lost the game.  Forced: At the end of each round, place 1 resource on each Dol Guldur location in play.

name: Dungeon Labyrinth
text: Dungeon Labyrinth gets +1 [threat] and +1 quest point for each resource token on it.  Forced: At the end of each round, place 1 resource token on Dungeon Labyrinth for each player in the game.

name: Sentinel of Shadow
text: When Revealed: The staging area gets +X [threat] until the end of the phase, where X is twice the number of players in the game. If the players quest unsuccessfully this phase, put the Nazul of Dol Guldur into play (from any out of play area), engaged with the first player. (Cannot be canceled.)

name: Catacomb Inspection
text: When Revealed: Add 1 resource token to each Dol Guldur location in play.
shadow: Shadow: If there is a Dol Guldur location in the staging area, move 1 resource token from each of your heroes' resource pools to that location. (Resolve this effect for each Dol Guldur location.

name: Dark Interrogation
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose and discard cards from hand until he has only 2 cards in hand. (Each player with 2 or fewer cards in hand must instead reveal 1 card from the encounter deck.)
shadow: Shadow: Discard each card you control that has at least 1 copy of itself in your discard pile. (If this attack is undefended, each player must resolve this effect.)

name: The Hunt for Gollum
text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

name: The Hunt for Gollum
text: You are playing Nightmare mode.  Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, choose an unclaimed Clue card not attached to a Mordor enemy and attach it to a Mordor enemy, if able. (If it was guarded, detach the encounter guarding if first. The newly attached Mordor enemy is now guarding it.)  If at any point there are four or more Clue cards attached to Mordor enemies, the players lose the game.

name: Ravenous Hawk
text: Forced: When a card effect instructs a player to "look" at cards in the encounter deck and Ravenous Hawk is among those cards, that player must put Ravenous Hawk into play engaged with him. (This does not satisfy the Forced effect of stage 1B or 2B).

name: Hunting Warg
text: Forced: At the beginning of the refresh phase, if Hunting Warg entered play this round, search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Hunters from Morder and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Watched Path
text: Each player who does not control at least 1 Clue card cannot draw cards through card effects.
shadow: Shadow: If you do not control at least 1 Clue card, discard all cards from your hand.

name: Hunter's Lookout
text: Each Mordor enemy with at least 1 Clue card attached gets +2 [defense].
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [defense] for each Clue card in play until the end of the round.

name: Dark Pools
text: Progress cannot be placed on Dark Pools while it is in the staging area.  Forced: After Dark Pools becomes the active location, each player must discard an ally with the highest printed cost among the allies he controls.

name: The Enemy's Trail
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter discard pile for a Clue card and attach it to a Mordor enemy in play, if able. If no card is attached by this effect, The Enemy's Trail gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Search the encounter discard pile for a Clue card and attach it to a Mordor enemy in play, if able.

name: Restless Hunters
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a Clue card attached to a hero and attaches it to a Mordor enemy in play, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Damage from this attack must be applied to a hero you control with a Clue card attached, if able.

name: The Trail Goes Cold
text: When Revealed: Attach to the active location and remove all progress from that location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per location. Attached location contributes its [threat] during the quest phase as if it were in the staging area.")  If The Trail Goes Cold does not attach to a location as a result of its effect, it gains surge.

name: Conflict at the Carrock
text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

name: Conflict at the Carrock
text: You are playing Nightmare mode.   Stage 1A should read, "Remove 5 unique Troll cards" instead of 4.  Stage 2B should read, "When Revealed: Place Louis, Morris, Rupert and Stuart into the staging area."  Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if no progress was placed on the current quest this phase, place 1 progress on the current quest (bypassing the active location).  Response: After defeating a unique Troll enemy, you may choose and discard 1 "Sacked!" card from play.

name: Savage Hill-troll
text: While Savage Hill-troll is in the victory display, each Troll enemy gets +1 hit point.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, defending character does not ready during the refresh phase this round.

name: Rob & Bob
text: Forced: After Rob & Bob makes its first attack each round, if there are two or more players, it engages the next player and makes an additional attack (discard and deal a new shadow card for this attack).

name: Louis
text: Forced: After Louis attacks, the defending player must raise his threat by 3.  While Louis is in the victory display, each Troll enemy gains, "Forced: After this enemy attacks, the defending player must raise his threat by 1."

name: Morris
text: Immune to player events.  While Morris is in the victory display, each Troll enemy gets +1 [attack] and gains "Immune to player events."

name: Rupert
text: Rupert's [defense] cannot be reduced.  While Rupert is in the victory display, the [defense] of each Troll enemy cannot be reduced.

name: Stuart
text: Cannot have player attachments.  While Stuart is in the victory display, each Troll enemy gets +1 [defense] and gains "Cannot have player attachments."

name: Troll Lair
text: While Troll Lair is in the staging area, players cannot reduce their threat.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Troll, remove 4 damage tokens from it.

name: Hives and Hives
text: Forced: After any amount of progress is placed on Hives and Hives, deal 1 damage to each character in play.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Time for Supper
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a hero in any player's discard pile and removes that hero from the game. Then, heal all damage from each Troll enemy in play. If no damage is removed from any Troll enemy as a result of this effect, Time for Supper gains surge.

name: Grimbeorn's Folly
text: When Revealed: Add Rob & Bob to the staging area. Then, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique Troll enemy and add it to the staging area, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Grimbeorn's Folly
text: When Rob & Bob have been defeated, the players have rescued Grimbeorn the Old from certain death, and have won the game.

name: A Journey to Rhosgobel
text: The Quest Deck has been modified for Nightmare Mode. Flip this card over and keep it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active throughout the game, which is now ready to begin.

name: A Journey to Rhosgobel
text: You are playing Nightmare mode.  Setup: Search the encounter deck for 1 copy of Goblin Eagle-hunter and add it to the staging area. Then shuffle the encounter deck.  Forced: The first Creature enemy revealed during each quest phase gains surge.  Response: After an Athelas card is placed in the discard pile, you may shuffle it into the encounter deck.

name: Goblin Eagle-hunter
text: Goblin Eagle-hunter gets +1 hit point per player.  Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to Wilyador.
shadow: Shadow: If Wilyador has 10 or less damage on him, deal 2 damage to Wilyador.
