text: Action: Exhaust Rosie Cotton to choose a Hobbit hero and an attribute ([willpower], [attack], or [defense]). Add Rosie Cotton's printed [willpower] to that hero's chosen attribute until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Elfhelm
text: Action: Spend 1 resource from a Rohan hero's pool to put Elfhelm into play from your hand under your control. At the end of the phase, discard Elfhelm if he is still in play.

name: Elladan
text: While Elrohir is in play, Elladan gets +2 [attack]. Response: After you optionally engage an Orc enemy, ready Elladan.

name: Elrohir
text: While Elladan is in play, Elrohir gets +2 [defense]. Response: After you optionally engage an Orc enemy, ready Elrohir.

name: Captains of the West
text: Quest Action: Until the end of the phase, each Noble hero gets +1 [willpower] and does not exhaust to commit to the quest.

name: Raise the Shire
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Hobbit ally and put it into play (search your entire deck instead if that enemy's engagement cost is higher than your threat). Shuffle your deck. At the end of the round, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.

name: Guthwinë
text: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker, exhaust Guthwine to give that hero +2 [attack] for this attack. If this attack destroys an enemy, return a Rohan ally from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Friend of Friends
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Limit 2 copies of Friend of Friends in play. While another hero has Friend of Friends attached, attached hero gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], +1 [defense] and +1 hit point.

name: Orc Disguise
text: Attach to the Ring-bearer. Limit 1 per hero. While an Orc is making an engagement check with you, it gets +5 engagement cost. Response: After an Orc enemy engages you, discard Orc Disguise. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.

name: Last of the Company
text: Attached hero gains the Ring-bearer trait and the [fellowship] sphere. You cannot lose control of the first player token. Action: Exhaust The One Ring and raise your threat by 1 to choose an Orc enemy. Until the end of the phase, that enemy gets -X [threat], where X is the attached hero's [willpower].

name: Topmost Chamber
text: Immune to player card effects.  The players cannot travel here unless there is at least 18 progress on stage 2B. Travel: Add Shagrat to the staging area to travel here.

name: Echoing Passage
text: Echoing Passage gets +1 [threat] for each enemy in the staging area. While Echoing Passage is the active location, each enemy gets +2 [defense].

name: Bloodied Courtyard
text: While Bloodied Courtyard is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After an enemy enters the staging area, deal 1 damage to it." Travel: Raise each player's threat by 1 to travel here.

name: Winding Stairs
text: While Winding Stairs is the active location, each enemy in the staging area gets +10 engagement cost. Travel: Each player exhausts a character he controls to travel here.

name: Torch-lit Hall
text: Forced: After the players travel to Torch-lit Hall, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. If there is a copy of that enemy in the staging area, discard that copy as well. If there is not, add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

name: Shagrat
text: Cannot have non-boon attachments. Cannot take non-combat damage.  Allies cannot attack or defend against Shagrat. Forced: After progress is placed on the quest, Shagrat gets -X engagement cost until the end of the round. X is the amount of progress just placed.

name: Gorbag
text: Cannot have attachments. Forced: After Gorbag engages you, it makes an immediate attack against you.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Wounded Uruk
text: Wounded Uruk enters play with 2 damage on it. Forced: After Wounded Uruk engages you, it gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each damage on it.

name: Orcish Howls
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, each enemy gets +1 [threat] for each damage on it. If there are no enemies in the staging area, Orcish Howls gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If you are engaged with another enemy, resolve this attack against that enemy.

name: The Black Gate
text: Immune to player card effects. The players cannot travel here. The Black Gate gets +1 [threat] for each resource on it. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, place 1 resource here and raise each player's threat by 1.

name: Towers of the Teeth
text: Immune to player card effects.  X is the number of characters controlled by the player with the most characters. While Towers of the Teeth is the active location, players cannot play allies.

name: Beleaguered Hills
text: While Beleaguered Hills is the active location, reduce the total [threat] in the staging area by X, where X is the total [threat] of each engaged enemy. Forced: After Beleaguered Hills becomes the active location, each player engages a non-unique enemy in the staging area.

name: Waste of Dagorlad
text: While Waste of Dagorlad is the active location, treat the text box of each ally as if it were blank (except for Traits).

name: Slopes of Cirith Gorgor
text: Forced: When Slopes of Cirith Gorgor leaves play, the first player shuffles the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discards cards from the top until an enemy is discarded. Then, he puts that enemy into play engaged with him.

name: Reeking Moat
text: Forced: After Reeking Moat becomes the active location, choose a non-unique, non-Nazgul enemy in the staging area and place it facedown under Reeking Moat. Forced: When Reeking Moat leaves play, put each enemy under it into play engaged with the first player.

name: Wall of Morannon
text: While Wall of Morannon is the active location, each enemy and location in the staging area is immune to player card effects. Forced: After Wall of Morannon becomes the active location, return each engaged enemy to the staging area.

name: The Mouth of Sauron
text: Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the staging area. Forced: After a player cancels a 'when revealed' effect, The Mouth of Sauron makes an immediate attack against that player.

name: Nazgul of Mordor
text: Cannot have non-Morgul attachments. Forced: After Nazgul of Mordor attacks, either raise your threat by 4, or return Nazgul of Mordor to the staging area.

name: Gorgoroth Hill-troll
text: Cannot have attachments. Forced: After Gorgoroth Hill-troll attacks and destroys a character, the defending player discards a random card from his hand and raises his threat by that card's printed cost.

name: Easterling Bowman
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to a questing character you control.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack, attacking enemy engages the next player then makes an attack.

name: Warrior of Rhun
text: When Revealed: Choose a questing character you control and remove it from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

name: Hell-hawk
text: When Revealed: Either search the encounter deck, discard pile, and victory display for a Nazgul enemy and add it to the staging area, or attach Hell-hawk to a Nazgul enemy in play. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets +2 [threat], +2 [attack], +2 [defense] and is immune to player card effects.")

name: The Hour of Doom
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1 for each character you control, or discard the highest cost ally you control.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Jaws of Steel
text: When Revealed: Each players assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of resources on The Black Gate.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each resource on The Black Gate.

name: Rage Filled Him
text: When Revealed: The Mouth of Sauron makes an immediate attack against you. If this attack destroys a character, raise your threat by 4.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+3 [attack] instead if it is The Mouth of Sauron).

name: Onslaught of Mordor
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a questing character he controls. Until the end of the phase, each damaged character gets -1 [willpower] and cannot be healed.
shadow: Shadow: Choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Engage it and deal it a shadow card.

name: Gwaihir
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose: either take control of Gwaihir, or spend 1 [fellowship] resource and discard Gwaihir to discard a non-unique enemy in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: This attack deals no damage.

name: The Tower of Barad-dur
text: Players do not raise their threat at the end of the refresh phase. Forced: At the end of the round, each player raises his threat by 1 for each non-[fellowship] character he controls.

name: Mount Doom
text: Immune to player card effects. X is the tens digit of the first player's threat dial. The players cannot travel here unless there is at least 20 progress on stage 3B. Travel: Each player makes a Fortitude test. If a player fails this test, he raises his threat by 9.

name: Orc-hold
text: While Orc-hold is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on other locations in the staging area. Forced: After Orc-hold becomes the active location, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top until an Orc enemy is discarded. Put that enemy into play engaged with the first player.

name: Mordor Road
text: Mordor Road gets +1 [threat] for each ally controlled by the player who controls the most allies. Forced: After Mordor Road becomes the active location, each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: Plain of Gorgoroth
text: If a player has failed a Fortitude test this round, Plain of Gorgoroth gets +2 [threat]. Travel: The first player makes a Fortitude test to travel here. If this test is unsuccessful, raise each player's threat by 4.

name: Brake of Thorns
text: While Brake of Thorns is in the staging area, add (S) to each Fortitude test.  Forced: After Brake of Thorns becomes the active location, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the tens digit of his threat dial.

name: Old Water-course
text: While Old Water-course is the active location, it gains: "Response: When Old Water-course is explored, reduce each player's threat by 5." Travel: Each player must exhaust a hero he controls to travel here.

name: Gollum
keywords: Surge. Immune to non-[fellowship] player card effects.
text: Gollum engages the first player. Forced: When Gollum is discarded during a Fortitude test, put him into play engaged with the first player. Then, choose an encounter card discarded for this test and ignore its (S) icons.

name: Ringwraith of Sauron
text: Cannot have non-Morgul attachments. While Ringwraith of Sauron is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After a player fails a Fortitude test, Ringwraith of Sauron engages that player and makes an immediate attack."

name: Orc Captain
text: Forced: After Orc Captain engages you, make a Fortitude test. If you fail this test, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: Big Uruk
text: Forced: After Big Uruk engages you, either raise your threat by 4, or Big Uruk makes an immediate attack against you.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each ally you control.

name: Little Snuffler
text: When Revealed: Either raise your threat by 1 for each ally you control, or discard an ally you control.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: “Wicked Master!”
text: When Revealed: Gollum makes an immediate attack against the first player. If Gollum is not in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Gollum and put him into play engaged with the first player.
shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is Gollum, he makes an additional attack after this one.

name: The Lidless Eye
text: When Revealed: Make a Fortitude test. If The One Ring is exhausted, add (SS) to the test. If you fail this test, raise your threat by 10.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if you failed a Fortitude test this round).

name: Foul Fumes
text: When Revealed: Each player makes a Fortitude test. If you fail this test, deal 1 damage to each character you control. Until the end of the round, treat the text box of each damaged character as if it were blank (except for Traits).
shadow: Shadow: If you failed a Fortitude test this round, this attack is considered undefended.

name: Heavy and Tired
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the most attachments and exhaust that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot commit to Fortitude tests. Forced: After you fail a Fortitude test, exhaust attached hero and discard each non-objective attachment on it.")

name: Orc of Mordor
text: Forced: After Orc of Mordor engages you, exhaust a character you control.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

name: Snaga Archer
text: Archery 2. Forced: After Snaga Archer engages you, deal 2 damage to a character you control.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if the defending character is damaged).

name: Uruk Soldier
text: Forced: After Uruk Soldier engages you, raise your threat by 2.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. If this attack destroys a character, return attacking enemy to the staging area.

name: Drawn to the Ring
text: When Revealed: The first player must choose: Either exhaust The One Ring and reveal an encounter card, or discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and put it into play engaged with him.
shadow: Shadow: Discard a non-objective attachment you control.

name: Deep Shadows
text: Doomed 2. When Revealed: Each player must choose: either discard your hand (with at least 3 cards in it), or he reveals an encounter card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Evil Vigilance
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either discard a questing character you control, or raise your threat by 1 for each questing character you control.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. If this attack destroys a character, reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

name: In Darkness Bind Them
text: When Revealed: Each player exhausts a character he controls. If The Eye of Sauron is in the staging area, characters cannot be readied by player card effects this round.
shadow: Shadow: If The Eye of Sauron is in the staging area, attacking enemy gets +2 [attack] and returns to the staging area after this attack.

name: The One Ring
text: Encounter Set:  Artifact. Item. Ring.  Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer. Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of attached hero. If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Pass the Two Watchers
text: Setup: Set Shagrat aside, out of play. Add The Two Watchers (location side faceup) and Topmost Chamber to the staging area. The first player loses control of the Ring-bearer, places it faceup under Topmost Chamber as a guarded objective. Then, the first player attaches Last of the Company to a hero he controls and attaches The One Ring to that hero.

name: Pass the Two Watchers
text: Each non-unique location gets -1 [threat] and cannot leave the staging area. While The Two Watchers is in the staging area (enemy side faceup), it is considered to be engaged with each player. This stage cannot be defeated while The Two Watchers is in play.

name: Fighting in the Tower
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area.

name: Fighting in the Tower
text: Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. If there is a copy of that enemy in the staging area, discard that copy as well. If there is not, add the discarded enemy to the staging area. This stage cannot be defeated unless Topmost Chamber is in the victory display. When the Ring-bearer is free of encounters, the first player gains control of it.

name: Escape from Cirith Ungol
text: When Revealed: Add Last of the Company to the victory display. Attach The One Ring to the Ring-bearer and exhaust the Ring-bearer. The first player moves The Two Watchers from the victory display to the staging area (location side faceup). Each other player reveals an encounter card.

name: Escape from Cirith Ungol
text: The players cannot travel to The Two Watchers unless there is at least 12 progress on this stage. While The Two Watchers is in the staging area (enemy side faceup), it gets +3 [Threat] and +3 [Defense] and is considered to be engaged with each player. This stage cannot be defeated while The Two Watchers is in play. If this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

name: The Tower of Cirith Ungol
text: Setup: Each player may change heroes he controls without incurring the +1 threat penalty. Attach A Heavy Burden to the hero with Last of the Company attached. Each player chooses an Item boon (excluding Anduril) from the campaign pool and sets it aside, out of play. Remove each burden with the following burden set icons from the encounter deck and flip this card over: HD, TRtI, TPotGC

name: The Tower of Cirith Ungol
text: Forced: When the players advance to stage 3A, attach A Heavy Burden to the Ring-bearer. Attach each set aside Item boon to Shagrat as a guarded objective. When Shagrat is defeated, return each guarded boon to its owner's hand. Resolution: If Shagrat is in play, remove each Item boon attached to it from the campaign pool. (The players have lost those boons.)

name: The Two Watchers
text: Immune to player card effects.  X is twice the stage number of the main quest. Forced: After the players travel here, flip The Two Watchers to its enemy side and move it to the staging area.

name: The Two Watchers
text: Immune to player card effects. Cannot be optionally engaged. Forced: When The Two Watchers deals any amount of damage, cancel the damage and raise the defending player's threat by X instead. X is the amount of damage just canceled.

name: Embassy from The Dark Tower
text: Setup: Add The Black Gate and The Mouth of Sauron to the staging area. Set Gwaihir aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Embassy from The Dark Tower
text: Dire. When Revealed: In player order, each player places the top card of his deck faceup in front of him until there are a total of 4 faceup player cards between the players. Place the top 4 cards of the encounter deck faceup. Starting with the highest cost player card, pair each player card with the highest threat encounter card remaining until there are 4 pairs. For each pair, the first player must choose: either discard both cards in that pair, or reveal the encounter card to play the player card at no cost.

name: The Battle of Morannon
text: Dire When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a different Orc, Troll, or Nazgul enemy to the staging area. Shuffle Gwaihir into the encounter deck.

name: The Battle of the Morannon
text: Dire. During the staging step, the first player does not reveal an encounter card as normal. Instead, he reveals 1 encounter card for each resource on The Black Gate. Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, discard the active location.  This stage cannot be defeated. Each round the players survive gives the Ring-bearer more time to fulfill the quest to Mount Doom.

name: The Black Gate Opens
text: Setup: Each player may change heroes he controls without incurring the +1 threat penalty. The first player may raise each player's threat by 1 to search his deck for Anduril and add it to his hand. Remove each burden with the following burden set icons from the encounter deck: ASotP, FtF, TRGS, TPofM, SL

name: The Black Gate Opens
text: Resolution: Record the number of resource tokens on The Black Gate in the notes section of the campaign log. If a Wraith on Wings is in the victory display, remove that copy from the campaign pool. If the first player controls Gwaihir, add him to the campaign pool. The players have earned that boon. If a hero is in its controller's discard pile, do not add that hero's name to the list of fallen heroes.

name: The Land of Mordor
text: Setup: Add Mount Doom and The Tower of Barad-dur to the staging area. Make Brake of Thorns the active location. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: The Land of Mordor
text: Dire. This stage gets +4 quest points for each player. The first treachery revealed each quest phase is immune to player card effects and gains surge.

name: The Road to Isenmouthe
text: Dire. When Revealed: Search the encounter deck, discard pile, and victory display for Mordor Road and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and travel to Mordor Road.

name: The Road to Isenmouthe
text: Dire. Forced: After placing progress here from questing successfully, each player makes a fortitude test. If a player passes this test, he places a resource here. If a player fails this test, he discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and puts that enemy into play engaged with him. At the end of the quest phase, if the number of resources here is equal to or greater than the number of players, advance to stage 3A.

name: The Last Gasp
text: Dire. When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X locations are discarded, where X is the number of players in the game. Add each location discarded this way to the staging area.

name: The Last Gasp
text: Dire. The first treachery revealed each quest phase is immune to player card effects and gains surge. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, the first player makes a Fortitude test. If the first player fails this test, no more than 5 progress can be placed here this round. This stage cannot be defeated unless Mount Doom is the active location.

name: The Crack of Doom
text: Dire. When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: The Crack of Doom
text: Dire. Allies cannot enter play and 'when revealed' effects cannot be canceled. Forced: When Mount Doom is explored, the first player makes a Fortitude test. Discard 1 extra encounter card for each player. If the first player fails this test, the Ring-bearer claims The One Ring for himself and the players lose the game. If the test is successful, the Ring-bearer completes his quest and the players win the game.

name: Mount Doom
text: Setup: Each player may change heroes he controls without incurring the +1 threat penalty. Place X resource tokens on this card, where X is the number or resource tokens on The Black Gate, as recorded in the campaign log. Remove each burden with the following burden set icons from the encounter deck: HD, TRtI, TPotGC Forced: At the end of the round, remove 1 resource token from this card. Then, if there are no resource tokens here, the players lose the game.

name: Mount Doom
text: Resolution: The first player must choose: - Keep The One Ring card and succumb to the power of Sauron. Then, the players lose the campaign. - Destroy The One Ring card and defeat the power of Sauron. Then, the players win the campaign.

name: Epic Multiplayer Mode
text: Setup: Create two separate staging areas: one for The Black Gate Opens and one for Mount Doom. Divide the players into 2 teams, one for each scenario. No more than 4 players can be assigned to each scenario and the number of players assigned to Mount Doom cannot be more than the number assigned to The Black Gate Opens. Shuffle 1 copy of In Darkness Bind Them into each encounter deck. Place The Eye of Sauron in the Mount Doom staging area with its corresponding side faceup. Flip this card over and set it next to the Mount Doom quest deck.

name: Epic Multiplayer Mode
text: Ignore the Forced effect on the Mount Doom campaign card if it is in play. Forced: At the end of the round, the first player chooses a scenario (The Black Gate Opens or Mount Doom). Each player at the chosen scenario draws 1 card. Each player at the other scenario reduces his threat by 3. Then, the player who controls the Gwaihir objective-ally may give control of it to another player (at either scenario). At the end of the round, if the last player at either scenario is defeated, both teams lose the game. If the Mount Doom scenario is defeated, both teams win the game.

name: The Eye of Sauron
text: Add (S) to each Fortitude test. Forced: At the end of the round, flip The Eye of Sauron, then move it and each Nazgul enemy in the staging area to The Black Gate Opens staging area. The first player may raise each player's threat by 3 to cancel this effect.

name: The Eye of Sauron
text: Each enemy in the staging area gets +1 [threat] and -10 engagement cost. Forced: At the end of the round, flip The Eye of Sauron, then move it and each Nazgul enemy in the staging area to the Mount Doom staging area. The first player may raise each player's threat by 3 to cancel this effect.

name: Nor
text: Action: Remove 1 resource token from Nor to give him a resource icon of your choice until the end of the phase.

name: Longbeard Cavern
text: While Longbeard Cavern is the active location Dwarf allies cost 1 less resource to play.  While Longbeard Cavern is in play Nor gains 'Action: Exhaust Nor to add 2 resource tokens to his resource pool (Limit once per round)'

name: Treacherous Slope
text: Action: If there are more than X enemies in play, exhaust a Hero to claim Treacherous Slope. X equals twice the number of players. Attach Treacherous Slope to that Hero.  Action: If claimed, place Treacherous Slope in the victory display to trigger an avalanche. Each player may reduce thier threat by 2 for each enemy engaged with them then discard all enemies from play.

name: The Mountain Pass
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for a Great Cave Troll. Set it aside for later use along with Nor, Longbeard Cavern and Treacherous Slope.

name: The Mountain Pass
text: When Revealed: Reveal 1 encounter card and add it to the staging area.

name: The Diversion
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose at least 1 of their heros and any number of their allies to join the diversion party. Flip over all the characters not in the diversion party along with thier attachments. Face down cards are considered to be out of play.

name: The Diversion
text: When Revealed: Put Treacherous Slope into the staging area.  You cannot complete this stage of the quest until the Treacherous Slope is in your victory display.

name: The Rescue
text: When Revealed: Discard all locations from play. Flip over all player cards (All cards involved in the diversion will now be face down and all other cards will be face up). Face down cards are considered to be out of play.

name: The Rescue
text: When revealed: Refresh all characters. Put the Greate Cave Troll and Longbeard Cavern into the staging area. The first player chooses a player, put Nor into play under control of that player.  Players cannot place progress tokens on this quest while Great Cave Troll is in play.  If players defeat this stage flip over all face down cards. Your allies return and the remaining Orcs flee, you have won the game.

name: Incatasi
text: X equals the number of attachments in play. Forced: If the first player controls 3 or more attachments Incatasi will always engage then irrespective of threat. Forced: At the start of combat, the player engaged with Incatasi must discard an attachment on a character they control. If they can't they may not declare a defender for Incatasi this round. Forced: During the refresh step return Incatasi to the staging area if the player engaged with Incatasi controls no attachments.

name: Anarchy
text: X equals the number of heroes with a [leadership] resource icon  Travel: Each players must discard 1 character to travel here.  Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on [leadership] cards nor may you play [leadership] cards.

name: Foolishness
text: X equals the number of heroes with a [tactics] resource icon  Travel: Deal 1 damage to each character to travel here.  Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on [tactics] cards nor may you play [tactics] cards.

name: Ignorance
text: X equals the number of heroes with a [lore] resource icon  Travel: Each players must discard 3 cards to travel here.  Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on [lore] cards nor may you play [lore] cards.

name: Repose
text: X equals the number of heroes with a [spirit] resource icon  Travel: The first player must exhaust a hero to travel here. Skip the refresh phase at the end of this round.  Forced: While this is the active location you may not activate action or response effects on [spirit] cards nor may you play [spirit] cards.

name: In One Day
text: Setup: Remove Wilyador and Rhosgobel from the deck. Put the 4 Enchanted Groves and Incatasi into the staging area.

name: In One Day
text: Forced: Progress tokens may not be placed on Enchanted Grove locations in the staging area nor may they be placed on this quest unless each player controls a hero with Athelas attached. Forced: If a card targets Wilyador, the first player chooses a hero to be the target of that card instead.  You cannot complete this quest until you have 4 Enchanted Groves in your victory display. When you complete this quest you wake up and have won.

name: Barrow Wight
text: Forced: Characters with 1 [willpower] or less cannot attack River Wight.

name: Old Man Willow
text: Forced: If Old Man Willow is dealt a shadow card with no effect, defending player must choose and discard a character they control.

name: Barrow Blade
text: Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective if it has no encounters attached. Then, attach Barrow Blade to that hero. (If detached return it to the staging area.)  Action: Exhaust Barrow Blade to give attached Hero +1 [willpower] or +1 [attack] or +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Setup: Form a 3x3 grid using the 9 quest cards. Put card 1A in the top left corner and card 3A in the bottom right corner. Shuffle the 2A cards and deal them out to fill the remaining 7 spaces, side A upwards. Put Old Man Willow in the staging area and set aside River Wight and Barrow Blade.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: When revealed: Place a resource token on this quest card to indicate that it is the active quest stage. When a quest stage is complete, players may move the resource token onto an adjacent quest card (not diagonally); it then becomes the active quest stage.  Forced: Quest cards remain in the 3x3 grid formation with side B face upwards once completed. The rules on all face up quest cards are considered active.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: Goldberry's Blessing
text: Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card they may also remove any number of damage tokens from thier characters. Then reveal 1 card from the encounterdeck per player and add to the staging area.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: The Old Barrow
text: When Revealed: Put Barrow Blade into the staging area.  Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card, remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: Pack of Wargs
text: When revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Wargs and add it to the staging area if possible.  Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card, remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: Blocked
text: Your way is blocked, you must head back and then find an alternative route.  Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card remove all progress tokens from it and then place the resource token on the quest stage they completed before this one.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: Ambush
text: When revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a goblin sniper and put it in the staging area.  Forced: When the players place a resource token on this card, reveal 1 encounter card per player and add to the staging area.  Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: Spiders
text: When revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a spider card and put it in the staging area. One of them must be Ungoliant Spawn.  Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 2B.

name: The Heart of the Forest
text: When revealed: If Old Man Willow is in the staging area it engages the first player, regardless of threat.  Forced: When the players remove the resource token on this card, remove all progress tokens from it.

name: Follow the Withywindle
text: Forced: Before the players place a resource token on this card, turn it over to side 3B.

name: Disturbed Grave
text: Up ahead you see a hooded figure on a small boat, slowly punting towards the river bank where a crumbling barrow has collapsed into the water.  When revealed: Put River Wight into the staging area. You cannot complete this stage of the quest while River Wight is in play.  When you complete this stage of the quest, you have won the game.

encounterSet: Custom Set - The Search for the Blue Wizard
