encounterSet: Custom Set - The Search for the Blue Wizard

name: We've been here already
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Search for the Blue Wizard

name: Dark Road
text: Setup: Put to one side Nazgul of Dol Guldur and 2 Dungeons Jailors from the Dol Guldur set and remove the Dol Guldur Objective cards from play. Unless stated otherwise, proceed to the next Stage in numerical order.

name: Dark Road
text: Each player must search the encounter deck and place the first location they find into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Sacred Shrine
text: After defeating this stage, each player may choose to heal all wounds from all their heroes. If so, proceed to Stage 3. If all player choose not to heal, then proceed to Stage 4.

name: Besieged
text: Each player must search the encounter deck and place the first orc they find into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. After defeating this stage, the players must decide if they want to try to free the prisoners. If so, proceed to Stage 5. Otherwise, proceed to Stage 6.

name: Take Flight
text: After defeating this stage, the players must decide if they want to try to free the prisoners. If so, proceed to Stage 5. If all players choose not to free the prisoners, proceed to Stage 6.

name: Liberation
text: Players cannot defeat this stge without at least one Clue, or whilst any Dungeon Jailor cards are in play. After defeating this stage, as a response each player may place one ally or attachment into play from his hand for free. Proceed to Stage 7.

name: Abandoned
text: For every 2 players in the game, place one Dungeon Jailor into the staging area. Players cannot defeat this stage without at least one Clue, or whilst any Dungeon Jailor cards are in play. Proceed to Stage 7.

name: Showdown
text: Place the Nazgul of Dol Guldur into the staging area. players cannot defeat this stage without at least one Clue, or whilst any nazgul cards are in play.

name: Ancient Path
text: Setup: Take out the Nazgul of Dol Guldur, Ungoliant's Spawn and Objective cards and set them to one side out of play.

name: Ancient Path
text: When 9 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play.

name: Deep Catacombs
text: Place the Shadow Key into play and attach one encounter card to it for EACH player

name: Deep Catacombs
text: Players cannot place Progress tokens on this stage unless a Hero controls the Shadow Key

name: Risen Nightmare
text: You may now remove the Shadow Key from play.

name: Risen Nightmare
text: When 6 Progres token have been placed on this card, put the Nazgul of Dol Guldur into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst the Nazgul of Dol Guldur is in play.

name: Goblin Gate
text: Each player searches the encounter deck and places the first Orc they find into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Goblin Gate
text: Each player immediately chooses and engages 1 Orc. Players cannot defeat this stage while any Orc cards in play.

name: Elf Path
text: Do not make any more engagement chechs whilst on this stage. Enemies already engaged with you remain engaged. You are niether allowed to engage nor be engaged by enemies unless you are already engaged with them.

name: The Veil of the Lonely Mountain
text: Each player searches the encounter deck and places the first Orc they find into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: The Veil of the Lonely Mountain
text: Each player may immediately place 1 Elf from their hand into play for free and any Elf character may also heal 1 Wound. Each player immediately chooses and engages 1 Orc. Players cannot defeat this stage while any Orc cards are in play.

name: Forgotten Path
text: SOLO PLAY: You may only choose ONE HERO (and thus one sphere deck) to perform this quest. Also, take out the Legolas Hero card (from the Tactics Sphere) and set it to one side out of play.

name: Forgotten Path
text: You only need to carry out the staging element of the Quest Phase every other turn after your first turn, for this stage only.

name: Tranquil Glade
text: You may place Legolas into play on your side. For this Adventure only, any resources he generates are treated as the same as your current sphere.

name: Goblin Mines
text: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Orc card and place it into the staging area. You may not defeat this stage whilst this Orc is in play.

name: Orc War Party
text: Setup: Take out 1 Hill Troll and the Chieftain Ufthak card and set them both to one side out of play.

name: Orc War Party
text: Each player searches the encounter deck for 1 Orc and places it into the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Players cannot defeat this stage while any Orc cards in play.

name: Dark Woods
text: Place Chieftan Ufthak into the staging area. Players cannot defeat this stage while Chieftan Ufthak is in play.

name: Daring Rescue
text: The 1st player may immediately place 1 Ally from their hand into play. Place the Hill Troll you put to one side into the staging area. Players cannot defeat this stage while are Hill Troll cards are in play.

name: Foul Tower
text: Setup: Take out th Nazgul of Dol Guldur, Ungoliant's Spawn and the Objective cards and set them to one side out of play. Then choose a hero and five that hero Gandalf's Map.

name: Foul Tower
text: Whe 5 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If Ungoliant's Spawn is defeated, place it to one side out of play.

name: Twisted Caverns
text: Allies may no longer enter play or be put into play.

name: Twisted Caverns
text: When 5 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If Ungoliant's Spawn is defeated, place it to one side out of play.

name: Final Stand
text: Allies or Attachments may no longer enter play or be put into play.

name: Final Stand
text: When 5 Progress tokens have been placed on this card, put Ungoliant's Spawn into play. Players cannot defeat this stage whilst Ungoliant's Spawn is in play. If Ungoliant's Spawn is defeated, shuffle it back into the encounter deck.

name: Sauron
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Cannot take damage.
text: Sauron cannot leave the staging area, and is considered to be engaged with each player. Forced: After Sauron attacks, the defending player must discard 2 characters if possible.

name: Elven Alliance
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: When revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero of his choice as an attachment. Action: If another player controls Narsil, exhaust Elven Alliance to attach Narsil to one of your Gondor heroes.

name: Human Alliance
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: When revealed: The first player attaches this card to a hero of his choice as an attachment. Attached hero gains Gondor trait.

name: Narsil
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
keywords: Narsil can only be attached to a Gondor hero.
text: Action: Discard X cards from hand to reduce Sauron's [defense] by X until the end of the phase. Action: If the players control Elven Alliance and Human Alliance add Narsil to the victory display to place 1 resource token on Sauron.

name: Preparing for Battle
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: Setup: Construct the encounter deck using all the cards from this scenario plus all the enemies with the Goblin or Orc trait from the indicated sets. Remove Sauron and Narsil from encounter deck and set them aside out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Preparing for Battle
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: When revealed: Each player may put an additional Noldor hero into play from his collection, who must match spheres with a hero he already controls. (The threat cost of the additional hero does not add to the starting threat level of his controller?. Forced: Skip the quest phase. At the end of the round, advance to stage 2.

name: Combat
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance

name: Combat
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, each player discards X cards from the encounter deck. Each enemy discarded engages the player that discarded it. Each objective discarded is considered revealed from encounter deck. X is equal to the current round number divided by two (rounding down).

name: Terrible and Unstoppable
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: When revealed: Discard all enemies from play then add Sauron to the staging area. Any player may discard a Noldor hero and put Narsil into play, attached to a Gondor hero they control. Advance to the refresh phase.

name: Terrible and Unstoppable
packName: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
encounterSet: Custom Set - War of the Last Alliance
text: Progress tokens cannot be placed on this quest. Forced: If the total [attack] of an attack against Sauron is higher than his [defense], place 1 resource token on Sauron. If the attacking player does not control Narsil, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card has a shadow effect, do not place the resource token on Sauron. If Sauron has X or more resource tokens on him, he is defeated and the players win the game. X is the number of players multiplied by 2.

name: Orc Forest Camp
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: X is the number of resource tokens on this card.  Forced: At the beginning of the travel phase place a resource token on this card if there is an objective card in the staging area. If there are 5 resource tokens on this card, the players lose the game.

name: Elrond's Message
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
keywords: Restricted. Guarded 2 (attach the top 2 encounter cards instead of 1)
text: Action: Claim Elrond's Message if it free of encounters. When claimed, attach Elrond's Message to a hero you control. (Counts as an attachment. If attached Hero takes damage or Elrond's message becomes detached, return Elrond's Message to the top of the Encounter Deck.)

name: Robbed
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: Setup: Search the encounter deck for Elrond's Message, Orc Forest Camp and Ungoliant Spawn. Add Elrond's Message and Orc Forest Camp to the staging area. Place Ungoliant Spawn face up but out of play, alongside the quest deck.

name: Robbed
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: When revealed: Select 1 hero, who receives 2 damage.  Players cannot advance to the next stage of the quest unless they have Elrond's Message in their possession.

name: Hide and Seek
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: When Revealed: Set aside Orc Forest Camp out of play.

name: Hide and Seek
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: Forced: If the players are not successful in the quest phase, every hero takes 1 damage and 1 progress token will be removed from the current quest card. Orcs remain in the staging area during the encounter phase unless they guard Elrond's Message. Players cannot advance to the next stage of the quest unless they have Elrond's Message in their possession.

name: Uninvited Guests
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: When Revealed: Place Ungoliant Spawn in the staging area. All orcs in the staging area are discarded.

name: Uninvited Guests
packName: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
encounterSet: Custom Set - Chasing the Orc Raiders
text: Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, as long as Ungliant's Spawn is in play, each player places the top card of his deck face-down in the staging area. These cards represent Ungoliant's Net and have 1 [willpower] and 1 Quest Point. These cards count as locations. Players cannot defeat this stage while Ungoliant Spawn is in play. If this stage is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: Trouble with Trolls
text: Remove the following cards from the encounter deck: 2 Hobbit-lands; 2 A Nice Pickle; More like a Grocer; Troll Cave; Troll Purse; and the 7 Sack cards. Add only the enemy cards from the Wilderlands and Seventh Level encounter sets to the encounter deck and shuffle it. Shuffle the 7 Sack cards face down to form a Sack deck.

name: Trouble with Trolls
text: Response: After a unqiue Troll enemy (Bert, Tom, William) is defeated or after a Troll Camp leaves play as an explored location, the first player chooses and discards a Sack card from play.  Forced: At the start of the refresh phase, remove all Troll enemies from the discard pile and add them to the staging area.  The players win if there at least 5 Troll enemies in the victory display and there are no Troll enemies in play

name: Abominable Goblin
text: Forced: If a shadow card with shadow effect has not been dealt to the first attacking Orc enemy engaged with a player during combat phase, deal that enemy an aditional shadow card until dealing him a shadow card with an effect.

name: Atrocious Beast
keywords: Surge. Immune to player card effects.
shadow: Shadow: Deal X shadow cards to this attacker. X is the number of Dark Forest locations in play.

name: Dark Wolves
text: If Dark Wolves is dealt a shadow card with effect, deal Dark Wolves an additional shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. Deal it another shadow card.

name: Dol Guldur Explorers
text: While there is an Orc enemy engaged with a player, event cards cost 1 additional matching resource to play from that player's hand.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].

name: Hunter
text: If there is an Orc enemy in the staging area, Hunter gets +2 [attack] and +2 [defense].
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].

name: Marauder of the Hills
keywords: Archery X. X is the number of allies in play.
text: Forced: Ir Marauder of the Hills damages a character, that character's controller must choose and discard an attachment he controls.

name: Orc Patrol
text: When revealed: Return each engaged Orc enemy in play to the staging area. Orc Patrol cannot leave the game while there is other Orc enemy in play that is not another copy of Orc Patrol.

name: Ranger Attacker
keywords: Archery X. X is the number of Orc enemies in the staging are.
text: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls for each Orc enemy engaged with him.

name: Rock Mercenaries
text: X is the number of players in the game. While there is a Mountain or Wasteland location in the staging area, Rock Mercenaries cannot engage or be engaged.

name: Seekers of Prey
text: While Seekers of Prey is in the staging area, each Wild enemy gets +1 [attack], +1 [defense] and +1 [willpower]

name: Skilled Fighter
keywords: Skilled Fighter gets -1 [defense] for each resource token on him.
text: Forced: After an attack against Skilled Fighter is resolved, place 1 resource token on him for each character that participated in that attack.

name: Swift Riders
text: If there is an Orc enemy engaged with the first player, Swift Riders engages that player.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack resolves, attacking enemy engages the next player, if able.

name: Abrupt Undergrowth
keywords: Hunt X. X is double of the number of players in the game.
text: Response: After traveling to Abrupt Undergrowth, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

name: Beorning Stream
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number the first player decides.
text: Response: After traveling to Beorning Stream, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

name: Cache
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: Response: After traveling to Cache, the first player may choose up 2 Creature enemies in play. Discard the chosen enemies.

name: Carrock Road
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: Response: After traveling to Carrock Road, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or draw 2 cards.

name: Dark Forest Peaks
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player must discard 1 ally card from his hand, if able.

name: East Path
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: Response: After traveling to East Path, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or add 1 resource to each of his heroes' resource pool.

name: Inhospitable Places
text: Response: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location. Forced: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, search encounter deck for 1 Creature enemy (2 Creature enemies if 3 or more players in the game), and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Mysterious Cave
text: Response: After Mysterious Cave leaves play as an explored location, each player may search the top 5 cards of his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Shuffle the rest of the searched cards back into their owners' decks.

name: Old Pathway
keywords: Hunt X. X is 1 (or 2 instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).
text: Response: After traveling to Old Pathway, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

name: Orc Camp
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.

name: Orc Camping
text: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 resource from one of his hero's resource pools, if able.

name: South Settling
text: When Revealed: Discard all allies in play. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: South Wilderlands
text: Each Orc enemy gains Archery 1. Forced: After traveling to South Wilderlands, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 2.

name: The Gorge
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to a character controlled by the defending player.

name: The Thicket
keywords: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.
text: When Revealed: Each Dark Forest location in the staging area gets +1 [threat] until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending player.

name: Archaic Find
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the most progress tokens. Search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for all copies of Archaic Find, and remove them from the game. Then shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled. Response: After a hero is damaged, cancel the damage and remove all progress tokens from attached hero. Limit once per game.

name: The Trial of the Dark Forest
text: Setup: Remove and shuffle the Wild enemies into a Orcs from Dark Forest deck and set it aside face down. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. Each player reveals 1 card from the top of the encounter deck and adds it to the staging area.

name: The Trial of the Dark Forest
text: After an Orc enemy is destroyed by an attack, place 1 progress token on any 1 character that participated in that attack. Forced: At the end of the round, each player discards from play all allies he controls. If one hero leaves play, the players have lost the game. If each hero in play has 2 or more progress tokens on him and the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Clarion Call
text: When Revealed: At the beginning of the next encounter phase, discard a card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area until there is X enemies in play. X is double or more of the number of players in game. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Confusing Guidance
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to any hero with the Ranged keyword without a copy of Confusing Guidance attached. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'The attached hero cannot attack enemies engaged with other players'. If Confusing Guidance has not been attached to any hero, it gains Surge.

name: Night Looms
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, players cannot declare more than 1 attacker agains one target enemy.
shadow: Shadow: Attacker enemy cannot be declared as target of any attack until the end of the phase.

name: Remain Hidden
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Camp location is discarded. Reveal and add the Camp location to the staging area. After reveal 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Rising Storm
text: When Revealed: Each player must remove 2 progress tokens from 1 hero he controls or exhaust 1 hero he controls. Then, remove 1 progress token from the quest card for each exhausted hero in play.
shadow: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token of any hero the defending player controls.

name: Terrifying Loneliness
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 attachment he controls and remove 1 progress token from any hero he controls, if able.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.

name: Unwelcome Allies
text: When Revealed: Return all Wild enemies in play to the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, then shuffle the Orcs of Dark Forest deck. Then, discard X cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of enemies moved by this effect. Any player may remove 1 progress token from one hero he controls to reduce the X number by 1.

name: Rules Card
text: Hunting X Keyword. After a location with the hunting keyword leaves play as an explored location, reveal X cards from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add them to the staging area. X is the specified value in that location. If a Wild enemy card would be discarded without being defeated, it is placed in the encounter deck discard pile. If a location with hunting leaves play as an explored location and there are no cards left in the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, then the hunting keyword has no effect.

name: Rule Card
text: Risk X Keyword. When a location with the risk keyword is in play at the end of the combat phase, discard cards from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck equal to the specified value. If the total of the discarded card's [attack] is higher than the total of all ready characters' [willpower] in play, the discarded cards engage the first player. If there are any risk locations in play, only the risk keyword with the highest value is considered to be active.

name: Beren
text: While Beren is committed to the quest, he gains: "Response: After an encounter card with at least 3 [threat] is revealed from the encounter deck, add 1 resource to Beren's resource pool."

name: Finrod Felagund
text: While Finrod Felagund is in play, each Edain character gets +1 [willpower].

name: Fingon
text: Action: Exhaust Fingon to remove 1 Corruption from a character in play. (Limit once per round.)

name: Lúthien
text: Action: Exhaust Luthien and pay 2 resources from her pool to place an enemy facedown (4 resources instead if the enemy is unique). That enemy is considered to be out of play for all purposes (except victory and advancement conditions) until the end of the phase.

name: Eärendil
text: Response: After Earendil commits to the quest, shuffle the encounter deck and discard the top card. If it is a treachery, deal 1 damage to Earendil. Otherwise, reduce your threat by 1 and draw 1 card.

name: Haleth
text: Haleth gets +1 [willpower] for each enemy engaged with you.  If Haleth did not commit to the quest this round, she may use [willpower] instead of [defense] when defending.

name: Fingolfin
text: Action: Raise your threat by 3 to choose an enemy in play. Engage the chosen enemy. Until the end of the round, Fingolfin does not exhaust to defend against the chosen enemy.

name: Húrin
text: Hurin gets +1 [attack] for each enemy engaged with you.

name: Ecthelion
text: When Ecthelion attacks alone, the defending enemy does not count its [defense].

name: Círdan
text: Cirdan gets +1 [defense] for each attached character.  Planning Action: Attach a character to Cirdan. This character is considered to be out of play. At the end of the round, heal 3 damage on that character and put it back into play. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Turgon
text: Response: After raising your threat, name an encounter card type. Look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it matches the type you named, draw 1 card. If not, shuffle the encounter deck. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Idril Celebrindal
text: Response: After the active location is explored, return 1 ally of X cost from your discard pile to your hand. X is the [threat] of the active location.

name: Melian
keywords: At the end of the round, discard Melian from play.  Melian cannot attack or defend.
text: Response: After you play Melian from hand, choose a player and (choose 1): enemies do not make engagement checks against the chosen player until the end of the round, enemies cannot attack the chosen player this round, or the chosen player may look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck.

name: Haladin Woodsman
text: Response: After a shadow effect resolves on an enemy engaged with you, Haladin Woodsman gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Eöl
text: Action: Place 1 Corruption on Eol to search the top 15 cards of your deck for an attachment and add it to your hand.

name: Mablung
text: Response: After Mablung commits to a quest, choose a character. That character gets +1 [willpower] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Orodreth
text: Response: After a unique character with the House of Finarfin trait leaves play, put Orodreth into play from your hand.

name: Chieftain of Men
text: Response: After your threat is raised by an encounter card effect, discard Chieftain of Men from play to cancel that effect.

name: Thorondor
text: Response: After you play Thorondor from hand, put a character from any player's discard pile into play under its owner's control.

name: Huan
text: Action: Huan gets +5 [attack] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase in which you trigger this effect, discard Huan. (Limit once per round.)  Action: Attach Huan to Beren or Luthien. (Counts as a Mount attachment with the text: "While attached hero is committed to the quest, deal 2 damage to each enemy revealed during staging."

name: Aredhel
text: Response: After the active location is explored, discard the top card of your deck. If it is an ally, take it into your hand.

name: Dwarf of the Blue Mountains
text: Dwarf of the Blue Mountains gets +1 hit point for each unique attachment you control.

name: Telchar the Smith
text: Action: Exhaust Telchar the Smith to choose an Armor or Weapon attachment in play. Until the end of the round, if the chosen attachment is Armor, it gains: "Attached character gets +1 [defense]." Until the end of the round, if the chosen attachment is a Weapon, it gains: "Attached character gets +1 [attack]."

name: Green-elf Ranger
text: Quest Action: Exhaust Green-elf Ranger to choose enemy or location. The next encounter card of the chosen type that is added to the staging area gets -3 [threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Daeron
text: Action: Exhaust Daeron to draw 2 cards. Then discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Elwing
text: While Earendil is in play, Elwing gains: "Response: After Elwing is destroyed, you may immediately put her back into play for 1 [spirit] resource. (Limit once per round.)"

name: Huor
text: Huor may be assigned damage from undefended attacks.

name: Bëor
text: Action: Attach Beor facedown to a character with the House of Finarfin trait. (Counts as a Vassal attachment with the text: "Attached character gets +2 [willpower].")

name: Hador
text: Action: Discard Hador to reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Put up to 2 revealed allies with the Edain trait into play, if able. Shuffle all other revealed cards back into your deck.

name: Barahir
text: Response: After a shadow card is revealed, exhaust Barahir to add his [defense] to the [defense] of the defending character until the end of the phase.

name: Morwen
text: Action: Raise your threat by 1 to give Morwen +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Tuor
text: Action: Exhaust Tuor to choose a player. That player looks at the top 3 cards of his deck. He may discard 1 to discard the top card of the encounter deck, returning the remaining cards to the top of his deck in any order.

name: Finduilas
text: Forced: Damage from undefended attacks must be assigned to Finduilas. After Finduilas leaves play, raise your threat by 2.

name: Azaghâl
text: Response: After Azaghal is destroyed as the result of an enemy attack, deal 3 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: High Kingship of the Noldor
text: Attach to a Noldor hero.  Action: Exhaust High Kingship of the Noldor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Elf-friend
text: Attach to an Edain hero.  Attached hero gains the Noldor trait.

name: Shadowy Cloak
text: Attach to Luthien.  Resources on Shadowy Cloak can only be used to pay for Luthien's ability.  Action: Exhaust Shadowy Cloak to either add 1 resource to Shadowy Cloak or ready Luthien.

name: Vingilot
text: Attach to a hero with the Half-elven trait.  Action: Exhaust Vingilot to use the attached hero's [willpower] instead of [defense] (or [attack], if attached hero is Earendil) until the end of the phase.

name: Harp of Fingon
text: Attach to a hero with the House of Fingolfin trait.  Action: After a Corruption token is removed from play, exhaust Harp of Fingon to add 1 resource to the attached hero's resource pool.

name: Oath of Friendship
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 2 in play.  Action: Move any number of resources from the attached hero's resource pool to the resource pool of another hero with Oath of Friendship attached.  Response: After you play Oath of Friendship, you may immediately search your deck for another copy of Oath of Friendship and add it to your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Oath of Vengeance
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero.  Response: After a character you control is destroyed, place 1 resource on Oath of Vengeance.  Action: Spend 1 resource from Oath of Vengeance to give attached hero +1 [willpower] or +1 [attack] until the end of the phase.

name: Oath of Silence
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per player.  Forced: Discard one card from your hand at the end of each round.  Response: After Oath of Silence is attached to a hero you control, search your deck for 2 cards and add them to your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Haudh-en-Ndengin
text: Attach to a location in play.  While Haudh-en-Ndengin has at least one facedown attachment, the [threat] of the attached location is reduced to 0.  Response: After a character is destroyed, attach that card facedown to Haudh-en-Ndengin.

name: Hidden House
text: Attach to a location in play.  While the attached location is the active location, enemies do not make engagement checks.

name: Solitary Outlaw
text: Setup: Attach to a hero. This hero must be the only hero you control.  Attached hero gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], +2 [defense], +2 hit points and does not exhaust to quest.

name: Ard-galen Horse
text: Attach to a Noldor hero. Limit 1 per hero.  Action: Exhaust Ard-galen Horse to place 1 progress token on each location in the staging area.

name: Ring of Barahir
text: Attach to an Edain hero.  Action: Discard Ring of Barahir to put a unique Noldor ally into play from your hand.

name: Ringil
text: Attach to a hero with the House of Fingolfin trait. Restricted.  Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] if Fingolfin). If the attached hero is Fingolfin, Ringil gains: "Response: After the attached character attacks alone, cancel all damage from the attack and reduce your threat by that amount instead."

name: Rochallor
text: Attach to Fingolfin.  Combat Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. Exhaust Rochallor and the attached hero to make an attack on that enemy. The attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] if the enemy is unique).

name: Blue Shield
text: Attach to a hero with the House of Fingolfin trait.  Attached hero gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] if the attached hero is Fingolfin).

name: Dragon-helm
text: Attach to a hero with the House of Hador trait. Restricted.  Response: After attached hero is damaged, exhaust Dragon-helm and raise your threat by 3 to cancel all damage from that attack.  If attached hero is Turin, Dragon-helm gains, "Response: After an enemy engages with you, it gets -1 [attack] and -1 [defense] until the end of the round."

name: Nimphelos
text: Attach to a hero.  Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. (Limit three times per phase.)

name: Aranrúth
keywords: Attach to a hero with a printed Mastery icon. Restricted.
text: Action: Exhaust Aranruth to give attached hero a [leadership], [lore], [tactics], or [spirit] icon until the end of the phase.  If attached hero is Thingol, Aranruth gains, "Attached hero gets +2 [attack]."

name: Strength of Men
text: Action: Exhaust an ally with the Edain trait. Add the [willpower], [attack], and [defense] of that ally to all characters with the Noldor trait you control until the end of the round.

name: Erchamion
text: Response: After a character is destroyed, put that character back into play under its owner's control. Attach Erchamion to that character. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "The attached character gets -1 [attack] and -1 [defense]."

name: The Day Has Come!
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all Noldor characters get +1 [willpower].

name: Song of Lúthien
text: Action: If you control Luthien or a unique Maia character, reduce each player's threat by 3.

name: Song of Staying
text: Response: After a treachery with doomed or surge is revealed, cancel the effects of all keywords on that treachery.

name: Arts of Felagund
text: Quest Action: Until the end of the phase, each enemy revealed during staging is discarded and replaced with the next encounter card instead. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Passed in Peace
text: Response: After a character with the Edain trait leaves play, play Passed in Peace to draw 2 cards.

name: Leaguer
text: Action: Exhaust characters with X points of total [defense] to choose enemies with up to X points of total [attack]. Those enemies cannot attack this round.

name: Hour of Need
text: Response: If at least X enemies are engaged with players (X being equal to twice the number of players), each player may put 1 ally into play from his hand, if able.

name: A Great Doom
text: Response: After a player card is drawn or an encounter card is revealed (including a shadow effect), shuffle that card back into its deck and draw a new card.

name: Undismayed
text: Response: After a character is destroyed by an enemy attack, put that character back into play. That character gets +3 [attack] and is discarded at the end of the phase.

name: Feast of Reuniting
text: Action: All characters gain ranged and sentinel until the end of the phase.

name: Banners and Horns
text: Response: After a unique ally you control enters play, choose any non-unique enemy in play. That enemy gets -X [attack] and -X [defense] until the end of the round. (X is equal to the cost of that ally.)

name: No Better Hope
text: Action: Exhaust a hero you control to discard a corrupted character from play.

name: Hold to the Oath
text: Action: Each character with an attached Oath gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Manwë's Pity
text: Response: After a unique Noldor ally you control is destroyed by an enemy attack, immediately put into play another copy of that ally from your hand.

name: Secrets of Craft
text: Action: Choose a player. That player draws 1 card for each Item attachment you control.

name: Dreams from Ulmo
text: If the active location is a River or Water location, reduce the cost to play Dreams from Ulmo by 1.  Action: Choose one character you control. Shuffle the encounter deck and look at its top card. Until the end of the phase, the chosen character gets +X [willpower]. X is equal to the revealed card's [threat].

name: Friendship of Ulmo
text: If the active location is a River or Water location, reduce the cost to play Friendship of Ulmo by 2.  Action: Reveal all shadow cards in play. Then, choose two shadow cards from different enemies and switch them.

name: Strengthen the Watch
text: Encounter Action: Exhaust a character. All enemies that engaged you this phase get -1 [attack] until the end of the round.

name: Secret Toil
text: Action: Exhaust 2 heroes you control to reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose one attachment or ally and put it into play for no cost. Shuffle all other revealed cards back into your deck.

name: ...And Yet A Warning
text: Response: After you attack and destroy an enemy, choose one: add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero you control, draw 1 card, or lower your threat by 1.

name: Song of Gladness
text: Play only if there are no enemies engaged with you.  Action: Reduce your threat by 3.

name: Flame Light! Flee Night!
text: Play only if you control a hero with the Edain trait.  Action: Search your deck for a character with the Edain trait and put it into play. That character does not exhaust to quest, attack, or defend until the end of the round. Discard that character at the end of the round.

name: Day Shall Come Again
text: Response: After a character you control destroys an enemy, ready that character. That character gets +1 [attack] until the end of the round. You may pay 1 [tactics] resource to return Day Shall Come Again to your hand.

name: Fëanor
text: Action: Place 1 Corruption on Feanor to place 3 progress tokens on the quest. (Limit once per round).  Action: Place 1 Corruption on Feanor to play an attachment from any sphere of influence for no cost.

name: Thingol
text: While at least 1 character with the House of Feanor trait is in play, Thingol's [willpower] is treated as 1 for the purposes of Corruption.  Setup: Choose 10 different cards from your deck and shuffle them into a separate Menegroth deck. After an enemy engages you, draw 1 card from the Menegroth deck.

name: Túrin Turambar
text: Action: Raise your threat by 1 to give Turin Turambar +1 [attack] until the end of the round.  Response: After Turin Turambar is dealt any amount of damage, discard a character you control to cancel that damage. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Celegorm
text: Celegorm gets +1 [attack] for each non-unique location in the staging area.  Action: Place 1 Corruption on Celegorm to search the top 10 cards of the encounter deck for a location and add it to the staging area.

name: Maglor
text: Response: When a Corruption token would be placed on a character you control by the encounter deck, exhaust Maglor to place that Corruption token on Maglor instead.

name: Caranthir
text: Response: After a treachery is revealed and resolved, attach that card facedown to Caranthir. That attachment gains the Fury trait.(Limit once per round.)  Action: Attach a Fury attachment to an enemy engaged with you. That enemy gets +1 [attack] and -1 [defense].

name: Maeglin
text: Response: After the active location is explored, add 1 resource to a hero's resource pool (2 resources instead if you place 1 Corruption on that hero).

name: Maedhros
text: While Maedhros has no Corruption on him, all Noldor characters get +1 [willpower].  While Maedhros has at least 1 Corruption on him, all characters with the House of Feanor trait get +1 [attack].  Action: Place 1 Corruption on Maedhros

name: Curufin
text: While Feanor is in play, Curufin gains: "Action: Place 1 Corruption on Curufin. Until the end of the round, Curufin's [willpower], [attack] and [defense] are equal to the printed [willpower], [attack], and [defense] of Feanor."

name: Oath of Fëanor
text: Attach to a character with the House of Feanor trait. Limit 1 per character.  Corruption on the attached character cannot be removed.  Planning Action: Exhaust Oath of Feanor to switch the printed [attack] and [willpower] of the attached character until the end of the round.

name: Nauglamír
text: Lower the cost to play Nauglamir by 1 for each Dwarf in play. Attach to a hero.  Each hero you control gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense].  Forced: At the start of the combat phase, discard a resource from the attached hero's resource pool for each Dwarf in play. Any Dwarf for which you did not discard a resource immediately becomes corrupted.

name: Galvorn Armor
text: Attach to a Mastery hero. Limit 1 per hero.  Attached hero gets +1 [defense]. Attached hero gets an additional +1 [defense] for each Corruption on the attached hero.

name: Poisoned Javelin
text: Attach to a Mastery character. Restricted.  Response: After attached character damages an enemy, attach Poisoned Javelin to that enemy.  Forced: At the end of each round, if Poisoned Javelin is attached to an enemy, deal 2 damage to that enemy. You may place 1 Corruption on a hero you control to increase this to 4 damage.

name: Gurthang
text: Attach to a hero with a printed Mastery resource icon. Restricted.  Attached hero gets +1 [attack].  Response: After attached hero damages an enemy, shuffle the encounter deck and discard the top card. If it is a treachery, cancel all damage from the attack and discard a hero. Otherwise, the enemy is destroyed.

name: Mormegil
text: Attach to Turin Turambar. Limit one Name in play.  Turin Turambar gains a [tactics] resource icon.  All enemies get -1 [threat] and -10 engagement cost.

name: Madness of Rage
text: Action: Choose a character you control. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 [attack] and must attack alone.

name: Fire of Life
text: Response: After a character with the House of Feanor trait is damaged, cancel 1 point of that damage and attach Fire of Life to that character. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 [attack].")

name: Defied and Mocked
text: Action: Choose an ally. That ally can be assigned damage from undefended attacks until the end of the phase.

name: Dreadful Death
text: Response: After a corrupted character destroys a hero or ally, remove all Corruption from that character and place it under your control.

name: Dark Heart of the Smith
text: Action: Place 1 Corruption on a character with a unique Weapon attached. All damage dealt by that character is doubled this round. Only 1 copy of Dark Heart of the Smith may be played on a character each round.

name: Open Battle
text: Action: Each player may search his deck for a Weapon or Armor attachment and add it to his hand.

name: Song of Wizardry
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard the top card of his deck and place Corruption among his characters equal to its cost.
shadow: Shadow: Place 1 Corruption on the defending character if it is an ally.

name: Weight of Horror
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the highest [willpower]. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "The attached hero must spend 1 resource from his pool to commit to the quest. Limit 1 per hero.")

name: Lord of Werewolves
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for one enemy with the Werewolf trait and add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy returns to the staging area after this attack.

name: Master of Shadows
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest stage. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Each enemy is dealt an additional shadow card at the beginning of the combat phase.")

name: No Living Creature
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose one: raise your threat by 1 for each character you control or place 1 Corruption on each character you control.

name: Foul Vapour
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Each character in play gets -X [attack] and -X [defense] until the end of the round. X is the number of enemies with the Werewolf trait engaged with the controlling player. If there are no engaged enemies with the Werewolf trait, Foul Vapour gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: The defending character gets -1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Deep Pit
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Response: After Deep Pit is explored, the first player chooses one: add 1 resource to Eyes in the Dark or move one hero to the pit area.

name: Gates of Tol-in-Gaurhoth
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: The first enemy with the Werewolf trait revealed each turn gains surge.

name: Walls of Stone
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: While Walls of Stone is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on the current quest stage.
shadow: Shadow: If a character is destroyed by this attack, remove 5 progress tokens from the quest.

name: High Tower
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: While High Tower is the active location, all enemies get -20 engagement cost.  Response: After High Tower is explored as the active location, remove one Condition attachment from play.

name: Dark Hills
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: While Dark Hills is in play, players cannot use player card effects that allow them to look at cards in the encounter deck or player decks.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each shadow card it has been dealt.

name: Vacant Pit
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: Remove 1 resource from Eyes in the Dark at the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 resource from Eyes in the Dark.

name: Bridge to the Isle
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: While Bridge to the Isle is the active location, enemies with the Werewolf trait get +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].  Forced: After Bridge to the Isle is explored, add Draugluin to the staging area.

name: Eyes in the Dark
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Place 8 resource tokens on Eyes in the Dark.  At the end of each round, discard 1 resource token from Eyes in the Dark.  If there are no resource tokens to discard, remove Eyes in the Dark from play and put Devouring Werewolf into play in the pit area, engaged with the prisoners.

name: Finrod Felagund
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Action: Discard Finrod Felagund to deal 5 points of damage to an engaged enemy.

name: Draugluin
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: After Draugluin is damaged by an attack, deal 1 damage to each character that participated in that attack.

name: Wolf-Sauron
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: After Wolf-Sauron attacks, place 1 Corruption on a random ally controlled by the engaged player.

name: Ravenous Werewolf
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Ravenous Werewolf gets +1 [attack] for each damage token on characters you control.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X [attack]. X is the number of damage tokens on the defending character.

name: Thuringwethil
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: After Thuringwethil damages a character, remove an equal amount of damage from Thuringwethil.
shadow: Shadow: Remove all damage from the attacking enemy.

name: Monstruous Bat
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: After Monstrous Bat deals damage to a character, raise its [defense] by X until the end of the round, where X equals the amount of damage dealt.

name: Guard Wolf
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Choose one character committed to the quest and remove him from the quest. If Guard Wolf is not destroyed by the end of the round, that character does not ready during the refresh phase.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if the enemy is a Werewolf.)

name: Hunting Wolf
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: After Hunting Wolf engages a player, raise that player's threat by 3.
shadow: Shadow: Raise the defending player's threat by 2.

name: Crazed Thrall
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Forced: Reveal 1 encounter card at the end of the round.  Forced: After Crazed Thrall is destroyed by an attack, place 1 Corruption on each participating character.  Response: After questing successfully, cancel all progress and instead remove Crazed Thrall from play.

name: Devouring Werewolf
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
keywords: Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the pit area.
text: Forced: Characters destroyed by Devouring Werewolf are removed from the game.

name: Morgoth
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Morgoth cannot leave the staging area and is considered to be engaged with each player.No Trap attachments can be attached to Morgoth.  Forced: At the end of the round, each player must place 2 Corruption among characters he controls.

name: Thrall Quarters
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
keywords: Immune to player card effects. This location does not contribute its threat while it is in the staging area.
text: Forced: While Thrall Quarters is the active location, add 1 to the [threat] of discarded encounter cards when resolving a Sneak test.  Response: After Thrall Quarters leaves play, add Dreadful Garments to the staging area.

name: Fire-drake
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to each character controlled by the engaged player.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to each character controlled by the engaged player.

name: Silmaril
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Action: If Morgoth has 0 hit points, exhaust a hero to claim Silmaril.  Action: Exhaust Silmaril and attached hero to either return an enemy to the staging area or reduce its [defense] to 0 until the end of the round.

name: Gothmog
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: After Gothmog attacks, discard 1 attachment controlled by the defending player.

name: Troll of Angband
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: After Troll of Angband attacks, raise the defending player's threat by 3.
shadow: Shadow: Raise the defending player's threat by 3.

name: Orc Captain
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: When Orc Captain attacks, add the shadow card to the staging area if it is an enemy (ignoring any shadow effect).

name: Angband Orc
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: While Angband Orc is engaged with a player, raise that player's threat by an additional 1 at the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Add Angband Orc to the staging area.

name: Balrog of Angband
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: After an event is played, lower the engagement cost of Balrog of Angband by 20 and increase its [threat] by 1 until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Discard all event cards from your hand.

name: Long-worm
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: When Long-worm engages a player, place 1 Corruption on the character with the lowest [willpower] that he controls.

name: Carcharoth
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: X is 5 times the number of players.  Forced: Players cannot reduce their threat while Carcharoth is in play.

name: Filth and Desolation
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: When Revealed: Each player must either deal 1 damage to each character he committed to the quest or reduce the [willpower] of each character he controls by 1 until the end of the round.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character that the defending player controls.

name: Subterranean Furnace
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: While Subterranean Furnace is the active location, each player must discard a random card from his hand at the end of the round.

name: Labyrinthine Stairs
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: After putting any amount of progress on Labyrinthine Stairs, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a location, add it to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, return the active location to the staging area.

name: Angband Sword
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Attached hero gains +5 [attack]. Attached hero gains an additional +1 [attack] for each resource on Angband Sword.  Action: Attach Angband Sword to a hero. Place 1 Corruption on that hero.  Response: After attached hero deals damage, add 1 resource to Angband Sword.

name: Echoing Corridor
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, players must raise their threat by the number of characters they committed to the quest while Echoing Corridor is the active location.
shadow: Shadow: Raise the threat of the defending player by the [threat] of the attacking enemy.

name: Trackless Cavern
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Response: After Trackless Cavern leaves play, each player reduces his threat by 5.

name: Tunnels of Shadow
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Immune to player card effects. This location does not contribute its threat while it is in the staging area.  Forced: While Tunnels of Shadow is the active location, the encounter deck is shuffled before discarding cards for a Sneak test.  Response: After Tunnels of Shadow leaves play, add Element of Surprise to the staging area.

name: Pits of Angband
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Immune to player card effects. This location does not contribute its threat while it is in the staging area.  Forced: The first enemy revealed each round gains surge.  Response: After Pits of Angband leaves play, add Angband Sword to the staging area.

name: Torturer's Dungeon
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: If there is no active location and you have the option to travel, you must either travel to Torturer's Dungeon or place 1 Corruption on each hero.  Travel: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and put it into play engaged with him.

name: Orc Armory
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: While Orc Armory is the active location, all enemies lose the Sneak keyword.  Response: After Orc Armory is explored as the active location, the first player attaches it to a hero. The attached hero gains +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].
shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Nethermost Hall
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: After Nethermost Hall is explored as the active location, advance to stage 3.  Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for Gothmog and add him to the staging area, if able.
shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Foolish Ruckus
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: When Revealed: Raise the [threat] of the active enemy by 3 until the end of the phase. If there is no active enemy, raise the [threat] of all enemies in the staging area by 1 until the end of the phase.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, raise the defending player's threat by 2.

name: Evil Lust
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "This hero must be declared as the defender against Morgoth (even if exhausted). Morgoth uses his [threat] to attack and the attached hero uses his [willpower] to defend. Limit 1 per hero.")

name: Heroic Diversion
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: When Revealed: Each player must either discard 1 character or raise his threat by 5.

name: Devouring Spirit
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: When Revealed: Attach to the enemy in play with the lowest [threat]. Attached enemy gets +1 [threat], +1 [attack], +1 [defense], and +3 hit points. If there are no enemies in play, Devouring Spirit gains surge.

name: Clumsy Step
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: When Revealed: Discard an additional encounter card when resolving Sneak tests this round. If there is no active enemy, Clumsy Step gains surge.

name: Dreadful Garments
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Action: Attach Dreadful Garments to a hero.  Action: Exhaust Dreadful Garments to place 5 progress tokens on the active enemy.

name: Element of Surprise
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Action: Attach Element of Surprise to a hero.  Combat Action: Exhaust Element of Surprise. Player attacks are made before enemy attacks during this phase.

name: Dark Elf
text: Action: Place X Corruption on heroes you control to draw X cards. (X cannot be greater than the number of heroes you control.)

name: Carcharoth the Red Maw
encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
keywords: Indestructible. Immune to player card effects.
text: Forced: While Carcharoth the Red Maw is in the staging area, he attacks a random location in play during the combat phase (the first player may declare a defender if it is the active location).  Forced: Caracharoth the Red Maw makes two attacks during the combat phase. (Deal a separate shadow card for each attack.)

encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf

encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
text: Forced: If Gates of Menegroth is destroyed, the players lose the game.

shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy cannot be damaged this turn unless the defending player discards one character.

shadow: Shadow: Allies cannot participate in an attack against the attacking enemy this round.

shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy gets +1 [attack]. (+3 [attack] instead if the attacking enemy has more than 5 damage on him.)

encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Add Bridge to the Isle to the staging area. Reveal X encounter cards where X equals the number of players in the game minus 1.  When this stage is completed, advance to stage 3A. This stage cannot be completed until Draugluin is in the victory display.

name: The Pits of Sauron
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for Finrod Felagund and Eyes in the Dark and add both to the pit area. Choose one hero to be placed in the pit area. That hero is captured. The controlling player may immediately replace the captured hero with another of his choice.

name: The Pits of Sauron
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves
text: Heroes at this stage do not collect resources or commit to the quest and are immune to player card effects. Players cannot play or put into play allies or attachments into the pit area.  Forced: If the players quest unsuccessfully, remove 1 resource from Eyes in the Dark, if able.  If the captured hero is destroyed, the players lose the game. If Devouring Werewolf is destroyed, discard this stage from play and return all characters to their owner's control.

name: Tol-in-Gaurhoth
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Isle of Werewolves

name: Tol-in-Gaurhoth

text: Forced: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, discard it instead of adding it to the staging area.  Planning Action: Exhaust a hero with X [willpower]. Wolf-Sauron gets -X [defense] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)  If the players destroy Wolf-Sauron, they have rescued the prisoners and won the game.

name: Doors of Angband
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth

Add the cost of each discarded card to the total [threat] in the staging area until the end of the phase.  If Carcharoth has 0 hit points, advance to stage 2 immediately.

encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth

name: Descent into Darkness
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth
text: Forced: After the first Path location is explored, add Nethermost Hall to the staging area.  Forced: After traveling to a unique location, players raise their threat by its [threat].  The players cannot advance unless Nethermost Hall is in the victory display.

encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth

Response: After questing successfully, you may place progress tokens on Morgoth as damage instead of placing them on the quest.  The players cannot advance to the next stage unless they control the Silmaril objective.

name: To See the Light
encounterSet: Custom Set - The Seat of Morgoth

name: Ride Forth in the Morning
encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
text: Forced: After a location is destroyed, place 1 damage on this quest stage. After the 10th damage is placed on this stage, advance to stage 3.  Forced: If there is no location in play at the end of the round, the first player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 location and add it to the staging area.  Players cannot advance to stage 2 unless Carcharoth has at least 10 damage on him.

name: At Last Upon the Wolf
encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
text: When Revealed: Remove Carcharoth from play and put the Carcharoth deck aside. Add Carcharoth the Tormented to the staging area. Remove half of the damage on Carcharoth (rounding up).

name: At Last Upon the Wolf
encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf
text: When Revealed: Discard all Hunt locations from the victory display.   Forced: If an ally is destroyed by Carcharoth, place 1 damage on this stage. After the 4th damage is placed on this stage, reset the quest deck to stage 1A and follow the setup instructions again.  If Carcharoth the Tormented is destroyed, you have recovered the Silmaril and won the game.

name: Ruin Upon the World
encounterSet: Custom Set - Hunting of the Wolf

name: Ruin Upon the World

name: To Edoras

name: To Edoras
text: After the 5th progress token is placed here, add Bounty Hunter to the staging area.  Unless Bounty Hunter is in the victory display, the players cannot defeat this stage.

name: Course to Anorien
text: When Revealed: Add The White Mountains to the staging area.

name: Course to Anorien
text: After the 5th progress token is placed here, add Junkorlg to the staging area.  Unless Junkorlg is in the victory display, the players cannot defeat this stage.

name: Reaching Minas Tirith
text: When Revealed: Add Mindolluin and Ghulat to the staging area.

name: Reaching Minas Tirith
text: Reaching Minas Tirich gets +1 quest point for each attachment and ally in play.  If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Bounty Hunter
text: X is the number of attachments in play.  Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Bounty Hunter engages the player with least attachments under his control.

name: Junkorlg
text: X is the number of allies in play.  Forced: After Junkorlg attacks, the defending player chooses and faces down an ally he controls, that ally becomes out of his control.

name: Ghulat
keywords: Alert 2.  Indestructible.  Immune to player card effects.
text: X is the specified alert value.  Response: Damage tokens on Ghulat count as a victory points when the players win the game.

name: Forest Assailant
text: Treat all the attachment cards of the attacking or defending characters against the Forest Assailant as if their printed text box were blank.
shadow: Choose and discard an attachment from the defending character.

text: X is the specified alert value.

name: Orc Troop
text: Alert 1.  Forced: After Orc Troop is defeated, attach it to a hero controlled by the first player. While attached, counts as a Condition attachment.

name: Monitoring Time
text: X is the specified alert value.  Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Monitoring Time engages the player who triggers the Alert keyword.

name: Edoras Hills
keywords: Immune to player card effects.  Players cannot travel here.
text: X is the number of attachments in play.  Forced: No more than 5 progress tokens can be placed on the current quest card each round. After players advance to stage 2, remove Edoras Hills from the game.

name: The White Mountains
keywords: Immune to player card effects.  Players cannot travel here.
text: X is the number of allies in play.  Forced: No more than 5 progress tokens can be placed on the current quest card each round. After players advance to stage 3, remove The White Mountains from the game.

name: Mindolluin
keywords: Alert 2.  Immune to player card effects.  Players cannot travel here.
text: X is the specified alert value.  Forced: After travelling to a Mountain location, each player may choose and ready a character he controls.

text: Sinister Caves gets +1 quest point for each victory point.
shadow: The attacking enemy gets +1 [defense] for each victory point.
