shadow: Chose a non unique enemy in the stagng area and engage him, then return the attachking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: High Peaks
shadow: The attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each Mountain location in the staging area.

name: Endless Mountain Ranges
text: X is the number of the attachments from the player who controls most.
shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack immediately after this one.

name: Discouraging Picture
text: When Revealed: Each player discards X cards from his hand. X is the number of allies under his control.
shadow: The defending player discards a random card from his hand.

name: Bitter Coldness
text: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to each ally in play. Each player can pay X resources to choose X allies and reduce their damage to 0.

name: Sinister Presence
text: When Revealed: Each player must deal X damage among the characters under his control. X is the total cost of the attachments he controls.
shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Rules Card
text: Alert Example.

name: Rule Card
text: To calculate the Alert Value, first determine the highest number of allies or attachments controlled by a single player. Then multiply that number by the Alert number to calculate the value of X.

name: Unscathed
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While Unscathed is in the victory display, reduce the first damage dealt by an enemy attack each round by 1.  Response: After the players complete the attached quest, add Unscathed to the victory display.  Forced: After a hero takes damage, remove Unscathed from play if it is not in the victory display.

name: Deeds of Daring
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While Deeds of Daring is in the victory display, heroes get +1 [attack] when attacking alone.  Response: After the players complete the attached quest, add Deeds of Daring to the victory display.  Forced: After an ally is declared as a defender or attacker, remove Deeds of Daring from play if it is not in the victory display.

name: Mighty in Arms
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While Mighty of Arms is in the victory display, each enemy gets -1 [defense].  Response: After a player deals more than 5 damage to an enemy in a single round, add Mighty in Arms to the victory display.  Forced: After the players complete the attached quest, remove Mighty in Arms from play if it is not in the victory display.

name: Orc Raiding Party
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
keywords: Raid. Cannot leave play unless destroyed.
text: While the current quest stage is Rescue the Settlement, Orc Raiding Party can only be engaged by quest card effects.

name: Orc Marauders
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While Orc Marauders is engaged with a player, that player cannot make optional engagements.
shadow: Shadow: Return a different enemy engaged with the defending player to the staging area.

name: Colossal Orc
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Colossal Orc gets +1 [threat] for each damage token on him.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1[attack] (+3[attack] instead if the attacking enemy has at least 1 damage token.)

name: Orc Archer
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Forced: When resolving the archery keyword on this card, discard the top 2 cards of the first player's deck.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack deals damage, discard the top 2 cards of the defending player's deck.

name: Orc Follower
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: X is twice the number of enemies engaged with you.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1[attack]. (+2[attack] instead if there is more than 1 enemy engaged with the defending player.)

name: Angband Assassin
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Forced: After Angband Assassin engages you, discard an ally you control, if able.
shadow: Shadow: If the defending character is an ally, discard it after the attack resolves.

name: Azrat
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Forced: When Azrat is damaged by an attack, discard the top card of the attacking player's deck. Reduce the damage by the cost of the discarded card and deal that damage to one attacking character instead.

name: Orc Burner
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Forced: After Orc Burner engages a player, discard the top card of that player's deck and deal X damage to characters controlled by that player. X is the cost of the discarded card.

name: Hidden Grove
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While Hidden Grove is the active location, the first player may declare one attack before enemy attacks are resolved.  Travel: Trigger all raid keywords on cards in play as if it were the end of the round.

name: March Outpost
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While March Outpost is the active location, engaged enemies do not trigger the raid keyword.  Travel: Each engaged enemy makes an immediate attack.

name: Raider Camp
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Travel: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until X Orc enemies are discarded. X is the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.  Response: After Raider Camp leaves play as the active location, each player may return 1 card from his discard pile to his hand.

name: Burning Abode
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Forced: At the end of the round, each player must discard the top card of his deck. If the discarded card is an ally, deal 1 corruption to a hero controlled by that player.

name: March Road
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: While March Road is in the staging area, enemies use their [attack] instead of [threat] when the raid keyword triggers.

name: Weapon of Morgoth
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the staging area.  Forced: Discard the top 2 cards of each player's deck at the start of the combat phase. (3 cards instead if there is at least 1 enemy in the staging area.) Each player must discard all cards in his hand or that he controls that match the title of a card discarded by this effect.

name: Crooked Blades
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to all characters with at least 1 damage.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1[attack]. (+3[attack] instead if the defending character has at least 1 damage.)

name: Renewed Grief
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Renewed Grief to a hero he controls. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, either deal 1 Corruption to the attached hero or the attached hero gets -2 [willpower], -2 [attack], and -2 [defense] until the end of the round."

name: An Ill Fate
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard an ally from his hand, if able, and discard X cards from the top of his deck. X is the cost of the discarded ally. If any player did not discard an ally, An Ill Fate gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys an ally, discard the top X cards of the defending player's deck. X is the cost of that ally.

name: Mirth of Morgoth
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Remove a hero from the quest and place that hero in the staging area. Each enemy in the staging area makes an attack against that hero during the combat phase. That hero can only declare attacks and defend against enemies in the staging area. This effect lasts until the end of the round.

name: Orcish Mischief
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Each player must discard an attachment from his hand. Orc enemies get +X[attack] until the end of the round. X is attachment with the highest cost discarded in this way. If any player did not discard an attachment, Orcish Mischief gains surge.

name: Orc Infiltration
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the enemy with the lowest [threat] into the first player's deck. When that enemy is revealed, discarded, or drawn, it engages the first player and makes an immediate attack.

name: Not So High Is Your Destiny
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Setup: Add Not So High Is Your Destiny to the staging area. Each player must place 1 Corruption on the hero with the lowest [willpower] that he controls. The player who controls the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached must place 1 Corruption on that hero instead.

name: Greatness Is In You
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Setup: Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached.  Action: Add Greatness Is In You to the victory display to ready the attached hero. That hero does not exhaust to attack or defend until the end of the round.

name: For Good Or For Ill
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Setup: Shuffle For Good or For Ill into the encounter deck.   When Revealed: If there are no corruption tokens on heroes controlled by the first player, cancel the effects of all keywords on this card. Otherwise, resolve keywords as normal.

name: Curse of Morgoth
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Setup: Attach to a hero.  Forced: After the attached hero takes Corruption, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a treachery card, the attached hero becomes corrupted until the end of the round.  If the attached hero leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Trial Upon the Marches
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: You are playing Campaign Mode.   Setup: Attach Curse of Morgoth and Greatness Is In You to a hero. Add Not So High Is Your Destiny to the staging area. Shuffle For Good or For Ill into the encounter deck.

name: Trial Upon the Marches
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Resolution: Add Curse of Morgoth to the campaign pool. If there are 3 or more victory points in the victory display, add Greatness Is In You to the campaign pool. If there are 0 victory points in the victory display, add Not So High Is Your Destiny to the campaign pool. If there are 1 or 2 victory points in the victory display, add For Good or For Ill to the campaign pool. Victory points from player cards do not count for this purpose.

name: Preparing for Battle
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches

name: Preparing for Battle
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Set the Unscathed, Deeds of Daring, and Mighty in Arms objectives aside, out of play. Set Azrat, Weapon of Morgoth, and all copies of Orc Raiding Party aside, out of play. Each player searches the top 10 cards of his deck for an attachment and places it faceup, if able. The first player chooses one faceup attachment and attaches it to an eligible hero. Shuffle all other faceup attachments back into their respective decks. Then, advance to a random stage 2A.

name: Repel the Incursion
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Choose one of the remaining set aside objectives and attach it to the quest. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until X enemies are discarded. X is equal to the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: Repel the Incursion
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: If there are no enemies in the staging area at the end of the quest phase, discard cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.  Forced: After the first player discards any number of cards from the raid keyword, place 1 damage on this stage. If there are 6 damage tokens on this stage, the players have lost the game.  While there is at least 1 enemy in play, the players cannot defeat this stage. When the players defeat this stage, remove it from play and advance to a random stage 2A. If only one stage 2 quest remains, advance to stage 3A, instead.

name: Rescue the Settlement
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Choose one of the remaining set aside objectives and attach it to the quest. Each player must add 1 copy of Orc Raiding Party to the staging area.

name: Rescue the Settlement
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Encounter Action: Discard 5 progress tokens from this stage to engage 1 copy of Orc Raiding Party in the staging area.   Forced: After a player discards at least 1 ally from the raid keyword, deal 1 Corruption to a hero controlled by that player.  While there is at least 1 Orc Raiding Party in play, the players cannot defeat this stage. If there are no copies of Orc Raiding Party in play, immediately remove this stage from play and advance to a random stage 2A. If only one stage 2 quest remains, advance to stage 3A, instead.

name: Destroy the War Engine
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Choose one of the remaining set aside objectives and attach it to the quest. Add Weapon of Morgoth to the staging area.

name: Hunting Foray
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Response: After the players quest successfully, Weapon of Morgoth gains the text: "The first player may declare attacks against Weapon of Morgoth during the combat phase as if it were an enemy. When making attacks this way, treat its [threat] as [defense]. Limit 5 damage per round. When Weapon of Morgoth takes damage equal to or greater than its quest points, it is destroyed and removed from the game." This effect lasts until the end of the round.  After Weapon of Morgoth is destroyed, advance to the next stage. When the players defeat this stage, remove it from play and advance to a random stage 2A. If only one stage 2 quest remains, advance to stage 3A, instead.

name: A Final Proving
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: When Revealed: Choose one of the remaining set aside objectives and attach it to the quest. Add Azrat to the staging area. If there are fewer than X enemies in play, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck, adding each enemy discarded this way to the staging area, until X enemies are in play. X is the number of players.

name: A Final Proving
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Trial Upon the Marches
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck. X is the number of players in the game. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.  While Azrat is in play, the players cannot defeat this stage. When the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Making of a Fellowship
encounterSet: Custom Set - Making of a Fellowship
text: This adventure arc follows the RPG campaign Rise of Orthanc found on the Play by Post website http://brennor.dyndns.org .   Making of a Fellowship is the introductory adventure in the RPG campaign. The elves Saelirneth and Celemir are exploring the Midgewater Marshes when Celemir is bitten by a strange creature and falls ill.  The young she-elf must seek out the aid of others to find a cure. She encounters the Noldor Faladril and Ranger Cadoran who have the skill and herbs to heal her mentor.  However the key to open the ranger cache has gone missing. Tracking the Hobbit burglar toward Bree the trio find Riv Lightfoot captured by Chetwood Bandits.  Among their ranks is a Rohirrim Outlaw, Athelstan, who has a change of heart and helps to free Riv and fights against their leader Traek.  Now with the key the small fellowship races to collect the herbs Dragon Lily in time before Celemir gives in to the illness or the denizens of the Marshes.

name: Making of a Fellowship
encounterSet: Custom Set - Making of a Fellowship
text: Swarm: The swarm trait is new to Making of a Fellowship. When an enemy with the Swarm trait engages a player that already is engaged with an enemy with the Swarm trait the two enemies combine into one larger foe.  Stack the cards atop one another and add the new cards [threat], [attack], [defense], and hit points together with any other cards in the  Swarm. The end result is one larger foe that has combined stats as well as actions and abilites.  It is treated as one foe for all other purposes and card effects until after it is placed in the discard pile.   Set Up and Celemir: During the set up stage players are instructed to place Celemir in the staging area engaged with the Neeker Breeker Swarm. Both cards are considered in the staging area and contribute [threat] during the quest phase. When the combat phase takes place players deal the Swarm one Shadow card and the Swarm attacks Celemir, and Celemir defends against it. Any Shadow effect that targets a player does not resolve and is discarded from play without effect. Shadow cards that affect the attacker or defender are still resolved. Beware the Swarm may eventually get strong enough to kill Celemir and then the players will lose the game.

name: Blood in Breeland
text: This adventure arc follows the RPG campaign "Rise of Orthanc" found on the Play by Post website http://brennor.dyndns.org. Blood in Breeland is the second adventure in the RPG campaign. After rescuing the elf Celemir and defeating bandits in the woods the Fellowship returns to Bree only to find it on fire. Bill Ferny and his Squity-Eyed Southern ally have been stiring up trouble in Bree. After the locals turn against him four now lie dead and Bree has been set on fire by arsonists. The heros rush to control the fires while battling against Ferny's allies in an attempt to find the man behind it all and put and end to his treachory. Will they be able to save Bree and uncover Ferny's conspiriacy in time?

name: Blood in Breeland
text: New Staging Rules: When playing the scenario, players reveal encounter cards individually in player order during the Staging step of the Quest phase. Beginning with the first player, each player reveals 1 encounter card and resolves its staging before the next player reveals a card. If an encounter card has an effect that uses the word "you" then the encounter card is referring to the player who revealed the card. If the revealed encounter has the Surge keyword, the player who revealed that card reveals an additional encounter card. Encounter cards with the Doomed X keyword still affecteach player. Burning X: Burning X is a new keyword used in Blood in Breland. When a card with Burning X is revealed from the encounter deck the player that revealed it must choose to either remove progress from the quest stage (but not the active location) or do damage to characters he controls equal to X. If there are no progress tokens on the quest stage the player must do damage to characters he controls instead. Peril: Peril is a new keyword found in The Lord of the Rings Saga Expansion and used here. When a player reveals an encounter card with the Peril keyword, he must resolve the staging of that card on his own without conferring with the other players. The other players cannot take any actions or trigger any responses during the resolution of that card's staging.

shadow: Shadow: If this attack is undefended remove 1 resource token from Breaking the Bandits' Back.

name: Chetwood Skirmisher
text: Forced: If Skirmisher is dealt a shadow card with no effect, return Skirmisher to the staging area after it attacks.
shadow: Shadow: Return this attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks.

name: Greenway Outlaw
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses to either remove 1 resource token from Breaking the Bandits' Back or Outlaw engages the first player and makes an immediate attack.
shadow: Shadow: This enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Pillagers
text: Forced: When Pillagers attack return the top most location from the discard pile to the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: This enemy gains +X[attack] , where X is the [threat] of the active location.

name: Squint Eyed Conspirator
text: X is the number of Bandits in the staging area.  Forced: When defeated in battle draw 1 card from the Stolen Goods Deck.
shadow: Shadow: Shuffle this card back into the Encounter Deck and deal the enemy 2 additional shadow cards.

name: South Road Barricade
text: While in the staging area Bandits get +1[defense].

name: Dunedain Ruins
text: While in the staging area all other locations gain +3 quest points.  Travel: Remove 1 resource token from Breaking the Bandits' Back.

name: Chetwood Grove
text: While in the staging area all Bandits get +1[attack].

name: Crumbling Farmhouse
text: Travel: Deal all enemies engaged with players an extra shadow card.
shadow: Shadow: Deal this enemy two additional shadow cards.

name: South Downs
text: While South Downs is the active location all Bandits get +1[threat].  Forced: When the South Downs leaves play after being the active location reveal 1 card from the Stolen Goods deck.

name: Grey Boar's Orders
text: When Revealed: All Captains in play engage the first player and make an immediate attack against him. If there are no Captains in play this card gains Surge. This card cannot be canceled.

name: Ambush on the Road
text: When Revealed: Return the active location to the staging area. If this returned no location remove 4 progress from the current quest stage.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gains +2 [attack] (+3 [attack] if the active location is a Road.)

name: Nighttime Raid
text: When Revealed: Each player must either discard 1 ally from play that they control or remove 1 resource token from Breaking the Bandits' Back. If there are not enough legal targets this card gains Surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attack enemy either gains +2 [attack] or remove 1 resource token from Breaking the Bandits' Back.

name: Arrows from the Woods
text: Archery X. X is the number of characters committed to the quest.

name: Rumours of Sharky
text: When Revealed: All objective cards in play are sent to the victory display. Remove 1 resource token from Breaking the Bandits' Back. Remove allprogress from the current quest stag. If this is stage 2 shuffle the current quest card back into the quest deck and reveal another random quest stage 2

name: Racketeering
text: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the most resources on him. It counts as a condition attachment with the text: 'This hero cannot gain resources from card effects. This hero looses all sphere icons.'

name: Aid from the Rangers
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses one: Draw 1 card from the Stolen Goods Deck, discard 1 non-unique location in play, or discard one non-unique enemy in play.
shadow: Shadow: Deal attacking enemy 3 damage.

name: Lowbank Estate
text: Set aside all Bandit Captain enemies, Bandit Refuge locations, The White Hand Captain and The Midgewater. Add Breaking the Bandits' Back to the staging area. Shuffle all Stolen Item objective cards into a Stolen Goods deck and set it to the side out of play.

name: Lowbank Estate
text: When Revealed: The first player draws a card from the Stolen Goods deck. Then chooses at random one of the Quest Stage 2A cards and advances to that stage.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text: Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Captain to the staging area. Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Refuge to the staging area.

name: Archet Lumber Camp
text: Battle. (Characters use [attack] instead of [willpower] when questing here.) Bandit enemies are dealt an additional Shadow Card.  When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Breaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.  Players cannot defeat this stage if any Bandits are engaged with players.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text: Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Captain to the staging area. Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Refuge to the staging area.

name: Andrath Ruins
text: Allies committed to this quest have -1 [willpower] during the Quest Phase. Players may not commit more than 1 hero each to the Quest Phase.  When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Breaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text: Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Captain to the staging area. Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Refuge to the staging area.

name: Forsaken Inn
text: Progress cannot be placed on the quest except through Quest effects.  Forced: After questing successfully the first player must spend X resources, where X is the number of players in the game, to add 1 progress to the quest. (Limit once per turn).  When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Beaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.  Players cannot defeat this stage if any Captains or Refuges are in play.

name: Hunting the Bandits
text: Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Captain to the staging area. Randomly reveal and add one Bandit Refuge to the staging area.

name: Shire Road Fort
text: Siege (Characters use [defense] instead of [willpower] when questing.) Enemies do not make engagement checks during this stage.  Archery X. X is the number of enemies in the staging area.  When this stage is defeated choose another random stage 2A quest. If all stage 2 quests have been defeated, or if Beaking the Bandits' Back has 10 or more resource tokens on it, advance to stage 3A instead.

name: Showdown
text: Add the White Hand Captain and the Midgewater to the staging area. Add Breaking the Bandits' Back to the victory display.

name: Showdown
text: Players cannot defeat this stage while the White Hand Captain and the Midgewater are in play.  If the players defeat this stage they have won the game.
