name: Fellowship With The Outlaws
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Forced: After the 3rd Dilemma objective is added to the victory display, advance to stage 2A and remove Fellowship With The Outlaws from the game.  Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, reveal the top card of the dilemma deck.  If there are 7 cards in the dilemma deck discard pile, the players lose the game.

name: Forweg
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: The first player gains control of Forweg.  Forced: Forweg declares and resolves an attack against a random Woodmen enemy engaged with the first player at the end of the combat phase.  If Forweg leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Forweg
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Allies cannot attack or defend against Forweg.  Forced: After Forweg makes his first attack each round, he engages the next player and makes an immediate attack (discard and deal a new shadow card for this attack).

name: Androg
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: The first player gains control of Androg.  Each Woodmen enemy gets -5 engagement cost for each Corruption on heroes the first player controls.  If Androg leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Forweg
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Androg gets +1 [attack] for each hero you control with at least 1 Corruption.

name: Larnach's Daughter
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Forweg declares an attack on Larnach's Daughter. The first player may declare an eligible defender against this attack. If no character is destroyed by this attack, add Larnach's Daughter to the victory display. If no defender is declared, each player deals 3 Corruption among characters he controls.

name: Cull the Weak
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Either each player must discard the character he controls with the fewest hit points to remove all damage from one character he controls, or add Cull the Weak to the victory display and each player must deal 3 damage to a hero he controls.

name: Punish The Trespassers
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Either each player must exhaust a character he controls to discard a Woodmen enemy from play, or add Punish The Trespassers to the victory display and each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Woodmen enemy and put it into play engaged with him. One of these must be Hound of the Woodmen, if able.

name: Raid The Homestead
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Either each player deals X Corruption to a hero he controls to add X resources to that hero's resource pool, or add Raid The Homestead to the victory display and discard all resources from play (any hero that does not discard a resource takes 2 damage).

name: Turn A Blind Eye
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Either each player must deal 1 Corruption to a hero he controls to reduce his threat by 3, or add Turn A Blind Eye to the victory display and exhaust all heroes in play.

name: Teiglin Hunter
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: While Teiglin Hunter is engaged with a player, all enemies engaged with that player get +1 [attack].
shadow: Shadow: All enemies engaged with the defending player get +1 [attack] until the end of the phase.

name: Hound of the Woodmen
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Forced: At the start of the encounter phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hound of the Woodmen.

name: Homestead Defender
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: While Homestead Defender is engaged with a player, Woodmen enemies engaged with that player not named Homestead Defender cannot be attacked by non-objective characters.
shadow: Shadow: All enemies engaged with the defending player get +2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Desperate Outlaw
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Forced: After an attack against Desperate Outlaw resolves, Desperate Outlaw makes an immediate attack against the defending player.
shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

name: Cruel Robber
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Forced: After Cruel Robber attacks, discard 1 attachment the defending player controls.
shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 attachment from the defending character.

name: Driven Outcast
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Forced: After Driven Outcast attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending character.
shadow: Shadow: After this attack resolves, deal 1 damage to the defending character.

name: Forest Clearing
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: (Stage 1B) Response: After Forest Clearing is explored, reduce each player's threat by 2.  While Forest Clearing is in play, the first Gaurwaith enemy revealed each round gains surge.

name: Scattered Homestead
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: While Scattered Homestead is in the staging area, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck at the end of the round until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.

name: Tilled Field
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: (Stage 1B) Response: After Tilled Field is explored, add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.  (Stage 2B) When Revealed: Each player must exhaust a hero he controls.

name: Hedge and Stockade
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: (Stage 1B): While Hedge and Stockade is the active location, all Woodmen enemies get +2 [defense] and 0 engagement cost.  (Stage 2B): While Hedge and Stockade is the active location, all Gaurwaith enemies get -1 [attack] and 0 engagement cost.

name: Woods of Teiglin
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: (Stage 1B) Response: After Woods of Teiglin is explored, each player draws 1 card.  (Stage 2B): While Woods of Teiglin is in the staging area, all Gaurwaith enemies get +1 [threat], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense].

name: Dogs and Fences
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either deal X damage among heroes he controls, where X is equal to the number of engaged Woodmen enemies plus 2, or treat the printed text box of each non-objective character he controls as if it were blank, except for keywords and Traits, until the end of the round.

name: Horn-calls
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Woodmen enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Then, each engaged Woodmen enemy makes an immediate attack.

name: No Law But Their Needs
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Either Either each player must immediately exhaust and commit 1 hero to the quest, or raise each player's threat by 4.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. If that enemy is destroyed, deal 1 Corruption to the defending character.

name: Wolf-men of the Winter
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Each player engaged with a Gaurwaith enemy must discard all resources he controls. If a player did not discard at least 3 resources, deal 1 damage to each character he controls.
shadow: Shadow: The defending player must pay 1 resource or the attacking enemy gets +3 [attack].

name: Banded Attack
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Each player deals X damage among characters he controls,  where X is the number of Gaurwaith enemies engaged with that player.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1[attack] for each enemy engaged with the defending player.

name: Blood Upon the Grass
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either raise his threat by 1 for each Corruption on characters he controls, or choose one character with at least 1 Corruption. That character is immediately corrupted.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust all characters the defending player controls with at least 1 Corruption.

name: Cruel of Heart
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After an ally enters play, exhaust attached hero to deal 1 damage to that ally.")

name: Bitterness of Exile
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Remove each character with at least 1 Corruption from the quest.
shadow: Shadow: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy or location, add it to the staging area.

name: Craft In Wood And Field
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Attach to the hero with Curse of Morgoth attached.  Response: After the players travel to a location, choose a player and exhaust attached hero to reduce that player's threat by the [threat] of the active location.

name: Hardship of the Wild
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Setup: Attach to a hero.  Attached hero gets +1 [defense] and +1 hit point.  Response: Add Hardship of the Wild to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool, to cancel 2 points of damage just dealt to attached hero.

name: An Evil and Dangerous Way
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Setup: Set all enemy and treachery cards with the Gaurwaith trait aside, out of play. Shuffle all Dilemma cards together into a dilemma deck. Add Fellowship with the Outlaws to the staging area. Put Forweg and Androg into play, ally side faceup. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area.

name: An Evil and Dangerous Way
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Forced: The players must travel to a location during the travel phase, if able.  Forced: After the active location is explored, deal X Corruption among characters the first player controls. X is the [threat] of that location.  Forced: After a Woodmen enemy is destroyed, add 1 progress to Fellowship Among the Outlaws and 1 Corruption to each character that participated in the attack. (If Forweg or Androg participated in the attack, deal 1 Corruption to each hero controlled by the engaged player.)

name: To Govern this Fellowship
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: When Revealed: Flip Forweg and Androg to their enemy sides, remove all tokens from them, and place them in the staging area. Discard all Woodmen enemies. Remove all enemy and treachery cards with the Woodmen trait from the encounter deck and discard pile and set them aside, out of play. Shuffle the set aside enemy and treachery cards with the Gaurwaith trait into the encounter deck. Reveal 1 encounter card per player.

name: To Govern this Fellowship
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Gaurwaith enemies may be attacked with [willpower] instead of [attack]. If an enemy would be damaged this way, place progress tokens on it instead of damage tokens. When an enemy has progress equal to its hit points, add it to the victory display and place those progress tokens on the quest.  When Revealed: Place 5 progress tokens on this quest stage for each card in the discard pile of the dilemma deck.  The players cannot defeat this stage while Forweg is in play. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Among The Outlaws
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: You are playing Campaign Mode.  Response: Discard the top card of the dilemma deck to cancel the "when revealed" effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck. (Limit once per game.)

name: Among The Outlaws
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Resolution: Add Bitterness of Exile to the campaign pool. If there is at least 1 card in the dilemma deck discard pile, add Cruel of Heart to the campaign pool. These burdens have been earned by the players. Each player may attach a copy of Hardship of the Wild to a hero he controls. If there are no cards in the dilemma deck discard pile, add Craft In Wood And Field to the campaign pool. These boons have been earned by the players.

name: Among The Outlaws rules
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws

name: Among The Outlaws rules
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws

name: Bór the Faithful
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Action: Discard 1 Corruption from Bor the Faithful to ready him. He gets +2 [attack] and +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Elder of the Realm
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Response: After a treachery card is revealed, discard a card from hand (spend 1 [lore] to discard the top card of your deck instead). If the first letter of the treachery card's title matches that of the discarded card, cancel the "when revealed" effects of the revealed card. (Limit once per game.)

name: Brethil Hound
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Response: After Brethil Hound participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Algund
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Response: When the discard pile is shuffled back into the encounter deck, deal X Corruption to Algund to choose X cards in the discard pile. These cards are not shuffled back into the encounter deck.

name: Fostered Son
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Action: Discard Fostered Son to reduce the cost of the next unique Edain character you play this phase by 2.

name: Wolf-man
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Action: Exhaust Wolf-man to immediately declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an engaged enemy with one hit point remaining.

name: Neithan
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Attach to Turin Turambar. Limit 1 Name in play.  Resources on Neithan can be discarded to satisfy the ransom keyword.  Response: When an enemy with the ransom keyword is defeated, add 2 resources to Neithan.

name: Forge of Belegost
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Attach to a Dwarf character.  Action: Exhaust Forge of Belegost and attached character to heal X damage on a character. X is the number of Item attachments on that character.

name: Angrist
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Attach to a Dwarf character.  Action: Exhaust Forge of Belegost and attached character to heal X damage on a character. X is the number of Item attachments on that character.

name: None Shall Break
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Action: Ready each character with an Oath attached. (Lower the cost of None Shall Break by 2 if each character that readies takes 1 Corruption.)

name: Song of Parting
packName: Custom Set - First Age - Among the Outlaws
text: Response: After an encounter card with at least 3 [threat] is revealed from the encounter deck, choose and ready a character. That character gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: The Siege of Erebor
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Create 4 staging areas from right (east) to left (west), and reveal quest stages 2A, 3A, 4A, and 5A, assigning them to the staging areas from east to west, in that order (so that The Eastern Defenses is assigned to the eastmost staging area). Resolve the 'When Revealed' effects on Stages 2, 3, 4, and 5, and turn them over. Then, turn this card over to stage 1B.

name: The Siege of Erebor
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Invade X, where X is the number of players in the game. Then, remove this card from the game.

name: The Eastern Defenses
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Set The Attack, The Defense, Gate of Erebor, one copy of The Desolation of Smaug, and each copy of Iron Hills Batallion aside, out of play.

name: The Eastern Defenses
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Response: After questing successfully at this stage, each player at this stage may choose: deal 1 damage to an enemy in this stage's staging area, or draw 1 card.  Forced: After The Eastern Defenses is added to the victory display, Invade 2.

name: The Riverlands
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Take the set aside copy of The Desolation of Smaug and make it this stage's active location. Shuffle the encounter deck. If there is only 1 player in the game, add 1 Iron Hills Battalion to this stage's staging area.

name: The Riverlands
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Characters at this stage get +1 [willpower].  Response: After questing successfully at this stage, the first player in turn order at this stage heals 1 damage from a quest stage in play.  Forced: After The Riverlands is added to the victory display, each player in the game discards the highest cost ally he controls.

name: Dale
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: If there are 2 or fewer players in the game, add 1 Iron Hills Battalion to this stage's staging area.

name: Dale
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Battle. Characters at this stage get +1 [attack].  Response: After questing successfully at this stage, the first player in turn order at this stage deals 4 damage to an enemy at this stage.  Forced: After Dale is added to the victory display, each player in the game discards a hero he controls. Until the end of the game, heroes cannot be healed or leave a player's discard pile.

name: Erebor
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Add The Defense and The Attack to this stage's staging area. If there are 3 or fewer players in the game, add 1 Iron Hills Battalion to this stage's staging area.

name: Erebor
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Siege. Characters at this stage get +1 [defense].  Response: After questing successfully at this stage, add Gate of Erebor to this stage's staging area.  ^Forced: After Erebor is added to the victory display, the players lose the game.*

name: The Defense
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 progress token here and deal 2 damage to the eastmost quest stage. ^Then, if there are at least 8 progress tokens here and no enemies in play at any stage, the players win the game.*

name: The Attack
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: If a quest stage has X+8 damage on it, add it to the victory display. X is the number of players in the game.  During the quest phase, instead of the staging step, Invade X+1.  Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to each quest stage for each enemy in that stage's staging area.

name: Gate of Erebor
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Response: After an enemy enters this stage's staging area, deal 1 damage to that enemy.  Response: When X damage would be dealt to Erebor, deal X damage to a hero you control instead. Any player at this stage may trigger this response.

name: Iron Hills Battalion
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Iron Hills Battalion is immune to player card effects and remains in the staging area under control of the first player.  Action: Exhaust Iron Hills Battalion to (choose 1): Reduce the next amount of damage dealt to the quest stage this phase by 1, place 2 progress on a location at this stage, or move Iron Hills Battalion east or west.

name: Easterling Supply Camp
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to the Eastern Defenses.  Response: After Easterling Supply Camp leaves play as an explored location, heal 2 damage from The Eastern Defenses.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the eastmost quest stage.

name: The Running River
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Either deal 1 damage to The Riverlands or The Running River gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to The Riverlands, if able.

name: Eaves of Mirkwood
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Travel: Deal 1 damage to a quest stage in play.  Forced: After Eaves of Mirkwood leaves play from the staging area, deal 2 damage among quest stages in play.
shadow: Shadow: Either deal 1 damage to the quest or the attacking enemy makes an additional attack.

name: The Desolation of Smaug
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Forced: After another location enters this stage's staging area, deal 1 damage to The Riverlands. A player at this stage may discard an ally he controls to cancel this effect.

name: Esgaroth
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: While Esgaroth is the active location it gains: "Response: When Esgaroth is explored, add it to the victory display. Then, The Riverlands cannot take damage until the beginning of the next round."

name: City Gates
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Response: After City Gates leaves play as an explored location, 1 player at this stage may spend 1 resource to place 1 resource token on Dale. The next time Dale would take damage, remove that resource token to decrease the damage dealt to Dale by 1.

name: City Streets
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to Dale.
shadow: Shadow: Defending character uses their [attack] instead of their [defense] for this attack.

name: City Walls
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Forced: After Dale takes any amount of damage, deal 1 damage to City Walls as well. Then, if City Walls has 3 damage on it, discard it from play and deal 1 damage to Dale.
shadow: Shadow: Either Deal 1 damage to the quest stage or the attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Ravenhill
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: While Ravenhill is the active location it gains: "Response: When Ravenhill is explored, add it to the victory display to remove 1 damage from each quest stage in play."
shadow: Shadow: Heal 1 damage from a quest stage in play.

name: Treasure Hoard
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: While Treasure Hoard is the active location, it gains: "Response: When Treasure Hoard is explored, add it to the victory display to add 1 resource to the resource pool of each hero at this stage."

name: Lonely Mountain Armoury
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: While Lonely Mountain Armoury is the active location, it gains: "Response: When Lonely Mountain Armoury is explored, add it to the victory display. Then, each player at this stage may put into play an attachment from his hand."
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Rhûn Vanguard
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: While in a staging area, Rhun Vanguard gains: "Forced: After an enemy with a name other than Rhun Vanguard enters this stage's staging area, Rhun Vanguard moves west."

name: Wainriders
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Forced: After Wainriders enters a staging area, deal 1 damage to the quest stage.  Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, if Wainriders is in a staging area, it moves west.

name: Rhûn Rearguard
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: X is the stage number of the quest.
shadow: Shadow: If there are no enemies in the eastmost staging area, add Rhun Rearguard to that staging area. The defending player may consider this attack undefended to cancel this effect.

name: War Machine
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Add to staging area 4B or 5B.  Damage dealt by War Machine beyond the remaining hit points of the character damaged by its attack must be assigned to the quest stage.

name: Balchoth Avenger
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Forced: After Balchoth Avenger attacks and damages a character, it either makes an additional attack or moves west, if able (defending player chooses).
shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to the quest stage, or this attack is considered undefended.

name: Easterling Archer
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: X is twice the number of players at this stage.

name: The North Burns
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each quest stage in play. Then, the first player deals X damage among quest stages in play, where X is the number of quest stages in the victory display. This effect cannot be cancelled.

name: Whips of Sauron
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Starting with the westmost quest stage, the enemy in each staging area with the lowest engagement cost moves west, if able. If no enemies were moved by this effect, Whips of Sauron gains Invade 1.
shadow: Shadow: Invade 1.

name: Fight or Flight
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Each player in the game chooses: Either deal 1 damage to each exhausted character you control, or deal 1 damage to your current quest stage.
shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to a quest stage in play.

name: Focused Assault
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: The first player attaches Focused Assault to a quest stage in play. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: at the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to the attached quest."
shadow: Shadow: Resolve the "When Revealed" effect on Focused Assault.

name: Flanked!
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to staging area 4B or 5B.

name: News from the South
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: When Revealed: If Erebor is the only quest stage in play, all enemies in play get -1 [attack] and -1 [defense] until the end of the round. Otherwise, Doomed 2 and Invade 1.

name: Rules 1
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: In The Siege of Erebor, multiple staging areas are in play at the same time, with a quest stage assigned to each. Player card effects at one stage cannot affect any other stage. When resolving text on a player card, consider only players at your quest stage as part of the game.  At the beginning of the round, each player, starting with the first, chooses a quest stage to be that player's main quest until the end of the round. Multiple players may choose the same quest stage. Enemies that are engages with a player remain engaged with that player when moving between stages.

name: Rules 2
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: At the beginning of the game, the quest stages form a line starting at 2B, The Eastern Defences, on the right (east), and ending at 5B, Erebor, on the left (west). The term "eastmost" thus refers to the stage furthest to the right that is still in play. Each phase of the game is resolved simultaneously, starting with the eastmost quest stage (i.e. 2B fully resolves the combat phase, then 3B, the 4B, then 5B, then 2B resolves the refresh phase, etc.). Within each stage, the phases are resolved in ascending player order.  The Moves West (East) keyword represents cards moving from one stage to another. If a card Moves West (East), it is moved to the nearest staging area that is still in play to the left (right) of its current location, towards (away from) Erebor. Cards at the leftmost (rightmost) stage area are immune to Moves West (East).

name: Rules 3
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: During the staging step, players will not reveal cards from the encounter deck in the normal way. Instead, the first player triggers Invade X, where X is the number of players in the game plus 1.  The invade keyword represents the invading forces coming from the east. When the Invade X keyword is triggered, reveal X cards from the encounter deck, one at a time. Any player at any stage can trigger responses (such as Test of Will (CORE 50) or Thalin (CORE 6)) to cards revealed by the Invade keyword.   After resolving any "When Revealed" effects on an encounter card, it is placed in an area depending on its card type: Treacheries are placed in the discard pile, enemies are placed in the eastmost staging area, and locations are placed in the staging area indicated in the bottom-right corner of the card. If the location's staging area is not in play, discard the location without resolving its "When Revealed" effects, and instead deal 2 damage to the eastmost quest stage in play.

name: Rules 4
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
keywords: Adding a Quest Stage to the Victory Display
text: When a quest stage is added to the victory display: 1) From lowest to highest engagement cost, each enemy in that stage's staging area moves west. 2) Discard each location at that quest stage from play. Then, raise the threat of each player in the game by the number of locations discarded. 3) Remove any other cards at that stage (such as objective allies or side quests) from the game. The staging area at that stage is no longer in play. 4) Each player at that stage immediately changes their main quest to the nearest quest stage to the west. Enemies engaged with a player remain engaged with that player (in contrast to changing quest stages at the beginning of the round). 5) Trigger the Forced effect on the quest stage that left play. 6) Play resumes.

name: Rules 5
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: Player side quests are played to the player's current staging area, and can still be chosen as the active quest by the first player in turn order at that stage during the quest phase.  The term "quest stage" refers only to the encounter quest cards 2B, 3B, 4B, or 5B, and does not refer to side quests.  There can be an active location at each quest stage, but in order to travel to a location a player must be at that quest stage during the travel phase.

name: Rules 6
packName: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor
text: ^Beginning of the round* Each player chooses a quest stage  ^Staging Step* Invade X+1, where X is the number of players.  ^Beginning of the combat phase* Wainriders (if in play)  ^End of the combat phase* Focused Assault (if in play) The Attack  ^End of the round* Easterling Supply Camp (if in play) The Defense

name: Passage Through Mirkwood
keywords: You are playing Campaign Mode. Setup: Put Mendor into play.
text: If Mendor leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Passage Through Mirkwood
text: Resolution: Each player earns 1 copy of the Mendor's Support boon card. Add the earned cards to the Campaign Pool. If stage 3B was Beorn's Path, add the Ungoliant's Swarm burden card to the Campaign Pool. If Stage 3B was Don't Leave the Path, add the Lingering Venom burden card to the Campaign Pool.

name: Journey Along the Anduin
keywords: You are playing Campaign Mode. Setup: Put Mendor into play. Set each copy of Valor and Scarred aside, out of play.
text: Response: After a Hill Troll is defeated, each player attaches 1 set-aside copy of Valor to a hero they control, if able. Forced: After a character is destroyed by a Hill Troll, each player attaches 1 set-aside copy of Scarred to a hero they control. (Limit once per game.) If Mendor leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: Journey Along the Anduin
text: Resolution: Add each copy of Valor and Scarred in play to the Campaign Pool. Record the names of heroes with Valor and/or Scarred attached in the notes section of the Campaign Log and attach them to those heroes when setting up each subsequent scenario in this campaign. The hero with the most damage will be taken prisoner at the beginning of Escape from Dol Goldur (in case of a tie, randomly select among the heroes with the most damage.). Record the name of the "prisoner" in the notes section of the Campaign Log.

name: Escape from Dol Goldur
keywords: You are playing Campaign Mode. Setup: Put Mendor into play. Attach Appointed by Fate to a hero of the first player's choice.
text: When a hero would be randomly selected to be a "prisoner," the "prisoner" from the Campaign Log is selected instead. Each card attached to that hero is turned facedown until that hero is "rescued." Mendor is captured as well. Place Mendor facedown next to the prisoner (this does not cause him to leave play). Flip this card over.

name: Escape from Dol Goldur
text: Response: After the first objective is claimed, flip Mendor face-up and place 1 damage token on him. Resolution: Determine one of the following: 1) If Mendor is still in play, add Mendor to the Campaign Pool. If you do, put Mendor into play at the start of each scenario during your next campaign. Each player may include 1 copy of Mendor's Support in their deck during that campaign. 2) If Mendor is not in play, do not adjust the Campaign Pool for your next campaign.

name: Mendor's Support
keywords: Only one copy of Mendor's Support can be played each round.
text: Action: Mendor gets +2[willpower], +2[attack], and +2[defense] until the end of the round.

name: Valor
text: Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker, exhaust Valor to heal 1 damage from attached hero and deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

name: Appointed by Fate
text: Attached hero collects 1 additional resource during each resource phase.

name: Mendor
text: The first player gains control of Mendor. Response: After a quest card is defeated, ready Mendor. Then, each player draws 1 card. If Mendor leaves play, remove him from the game.

name: Ungoliant's Swarm
text: Forced: After Ungoliant's Swarm engages a player, that player must choose and exhaust 2 characters they control.
shadow: Shadow: Put Ungoliant's Swarm into play engaged with you.

name: Lingering Venom
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either exhaust each damaged character you control, or deal 2 damage to the hero you control with the most damage on it.
shadow: Shadow: Exhaust each damaged character you control.

name: Scarred
text: Forced: After a character you control is destroyed, raise your threat by 1.

name: Boromir
text: While Boromir has at least 1 resource in his resource pool, Gondor allies get +1 [attack].

name: Prince Imrahil
text: Response: After a character leaves play, ready Prince Imrahil. (Limit once per round.)

name: Mablung
text: Response: After you engage an enemy, add 1 resource to Mablung's resource pool. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Angbor the Fearless
text: While your threat is 40 or higher, Angbor the Fearless gets +2 [attack] and does not exhaust to quest.

name: Soldier of Gondor
text: Response: After Soldier of ~Gondor enters play, seach the top 5 cards of your deck for a Gondor ally and add it to your hand (any number of Gondor allies instead if your threat is 40 or higher). Shuffle your deck.

name: Citadel Custodian
text: Lower the cost to play Citadel Custodian by 1 for each Gondor ally in play.

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Errand-rider
text: Action: Exhaust Errand-rider to move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Gondorian Spearman
text: Response: After Gondorian Spearman is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Envoy of Pelargir
text: Response: After Envoy of Pelargir enters play, add 1 resource to a Gondor or Noble hero's resource pool.

name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

name: Captain of Gondor
text: Attach to a Warrior hero. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust ~Captain of ~Gondor to give attached hero +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Gondorian Shield
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains +1 [defense]. (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)

name: Heir of Mardil
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Response: After attached hero gains any number of resources from a card effect, exhaust Heir of Mardil to ready attached hero.

name: Steward of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.

name: Valiant Sword
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Limit 1 per hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] if your threat is 40 or higher).

name: Visionary Leadership
text: Attach to a Gondor hero. While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 [willpower].

name: Behind Strong Walls
text: Action: Ready a defending Gondor character. That character gets +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

name: Need Drives Them
text: Action: Each player whose threat is 40 or higher readies all characters he controls.

name: Pillars of the Kings
text: While your threat is less than 40, reduce the cost to play Pillars of the Kings by 4. Action: Set your threat to 40. If this effect raised your threat, draw a card (draw 4 cards instead if it raised your threat by 10 or more).

name: Valiant Sacrifice
text: Response: After an ally card leaves play, that card's controller draws 2 cards.

name: Foe-hammer
text: Response: After a hero you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon card attached to that hero to draw 3 cards.

name: Beregond
text: Lower the cost to play Weapon and Armor attachments on Beregond by 2.

name: Faramir
text: Faramir gets +1 [attack] for each enemy in the staging area.

name: Emyn Arnen Ranger
text: Response: After Emyn Arnen ~Ranger commits to the quest, choose an enemy with a Trap attachment. Until the end of the phase, Emyn Arnen ~Ranger gets +X [willpower], where X is the chosen enemy's printed [threat].

name: Ranger Spikes
text: Play Ranger Spikes into the staging area unattached.If unattached, attach Ranger Spikes to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.Players do not make engagement checks against attached enemy. Attached enemy gets -2 [threat].

name: Ithilien Pit
text: Play ~Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached. If unattached, attach ~Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area. Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

name: Coney in a Trap
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Ranger trait and another unique character with the Warrior trait. Response: After you engage an enemy, that enemy cannot attack you until the end of the round.

name: Helm of Secrecy
text: Limit 1 per deck. Action: Choose a hero you control and discard all tokens from it. Select a different non-[fellowship], non-[baggins] hero from your collection with a threat cost less than or equal to the chosen hero. Swap those heroes, moving all eligible attachments to the hero from your collection.

name: Path of Need
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a location. Heroes do not exhaust to attack, defend, or commit to a quest while attached location is the active location.

name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dáin Ironfoot is ready, Dwarf characters get +1 [attack] and +1 [willpower].

name: Ori
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase.

name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)

name: Bombur
text: Action: Exhaust Bombur to choose a location. That location gets -1 [threat] until the end of the phase. (That location does not contribute its [threat] instead if it is an Underground location.)

name: Dori
text: Response: After a hero is assigned any amount of damage, exhaust Dori to place that damage on Dori instead.

name: Erebor Hammersmith
text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.

name: Erebor Record Keeper
text: Erebor ~Record Keeper cannot attack or defend. Action: Exhaust Erebor ~Record Keeper and pay 1 [lore] resource to choose and ready a Dwarf character.

name: Ered Luin Miner
text: Response: After Ered Luin Miner is discarded from your deck, put it into play under your control.

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Glóin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Glóin gains: 'Response: After you play Glóin from your hand, choose a hero. Add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool.'

name: Longbeard Elder
text: Response: After Longbeard Elder commits to a quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a location, place 1 progress token on the current quest. Otherwise, Longbeard Elder gets -1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Miner of the Iron Hills
text: Response: After Miner of the Iron ~Hills enters play, choose and discard 1 Condition attachment from play.

name: Cram
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Cram to ready attached hero.

name: Healing Herbs
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Action: Discard Healing Herbs and exhaust attached hero to heal all damage on 1 character.

name: King Under the Mountain
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust King Under the Mountain to look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and discard the other.

name: Legacy of Durin
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, exhaust Legacy of Durin to draw 1 card.

name: Narvi's Belt
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust Narvi's Belt to give attached hero a [leadership], [lore], [tactics], or [spirit] icon until the end of the phase.

name: Thrór's Map
text: Attach to a hero. Travel Action: Discard Thrór's Map to choose a location in the staging area. Make that location the active location. (If there is another active location, return it to the staging area.)

name: A Very Good Tale
text: Action: Exhaust 2 allies you control to shuffle your deck and discard the top 5 cards. Put up to 2 allies discarded by this effect into play under your control. The total cost of the allies put into play cannot exceed the total cost of the allies exhausted to pay for this effect.

name: Hidden Cache
text: Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control. Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.

name: Lure of Moria
text: Action: Ready all Dwarf characters.

name: We Are Not Idle
text: Action: Exhaust X Dwarf heroes to add X resources to a hero's resource pool and draw 1 card.

name: Durin's Song
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf hero. That hero gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.

name: Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Zigil Miner
text: Action: Exhaust Zigil Miner and name a number to discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If at least one of those cards has cost equal to the named number, choose a hero you control. For each card that matches the named number, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Erebor Guard
text: Response: When you play Erebor Guard from your hand, discard the top 2 cards of your deck to reduce its cost by 2.

name: Dwarf Pipe
text: Attach to a Dwarf character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After a card is discarded from your deck, exhaust ~Dwarf ~Pipe to place that card on the bottom of your deck.

name: Magic Ring
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero and 1 per deck. Action: Exhaust Magic ~Ring and raise your threat by 1 to (choose 1): heal 1 damage from attached hero, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool, or ready attached hero.

name: Celeborn
text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Galadriel
text: Galadriel cannot quest, attack, or defend. Allies you control do not exhaust to commit to the quest during the round they enter play. Action: Exhaust Galadriel to choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1 and draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Combat Action: If you have not engaged an enemy this round, exhaust Haldir of Lórien to declare him as an attacker (and resolve his attack) against an enemy not engaged with you. (Limit once per round.)

name: Defender of the Naith
text: Response: After a Silvan ally you control leaves play, ready Defender of the Naith.

name: Galadhrim Minstrel
text: Response: After Galadhrim Minstrel enters play, search the top five cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Galadriel’s Handmaiden
text: Response: After Galadriel's Handmaiden enters play, choose a player. That player reduces his threat by 1.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Greenwood Archer
text: Response: After Greenwood Archer enters play, ready a hero.

name: Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Mirkwood Runner
text: While Mirkwood Runner is attacking alone, the defending enemy does not count its [defense].

name: Naith Guide
text: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.

name: Orophin
text: Response: After Orophin enters play, return a Silvan ally from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.

name: Silvan Tracker
text: Response: After a Silvan character readies during the refresh phase, heal 1 damage from that character.

name: Lembas
text: Play only if you control a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Lembas to ready attached hero and heal 3 damage from it.

name: Nenya
text: Attach to Galadriel. She gains a [lore] resource icon. Quest Action: Exhaust Nenya and Galadriel to add her [willpower] to another character's [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: O Lórien!
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust O Lorien! to lower the cost of the next Silvan ally played this phase by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

name: Wingfoot
text: Attach to a Ranger hero. Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, name enemy, location or treachery. If a card of the named type is revealed during this quest phase, exhaust Wingfoot to ready attached hero.

name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the 'when revealed' effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.

name: Daeron’s Runes
text: Action: Draw 2 cards. Then, discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Elrond’s Counsel
text: Action: If you control a unique Noldor character, give another character +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase and lower your threat by 3.

name: Feigned Voices
text: Combat Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

name: Host of Galadhrim
text: Planning Action: Return each Silvan ally you control to your hand. Then, play each of those allies from your hand one at a time at no cost.

name: The Tree People
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.

name: Galadhon Archer
text: Response: After Galadhon Archer enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy not engaged with you.

name: Rúmil
text: Response: After you play Rúmil from your hand, choose an enemy engaged with a player. Deal X damage to that enemy where X is the number of ranged characters you control.

name: Bow of the Galadhrim
text: Attach to a Silvan character with the ranged keyword. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy not engaged with you.)

name: Hands Upon the Bow
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with ranged to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against an enemy in the staging area. It gets +1 [attack] during this attack.

name: Pursuing the Enemy
text: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.

name: Vilya
text: Attach to Elrond. He gains a [spirit] resource icon. Action: Exhaust Elrond and Vilya to reveal the top card of your deck. You can immediately play or put into play the revealed card for no cost, if able. Otherwise, move the revealed card to the bottom of your deck.

name: Elrond
text: You may spend resources from Elrond's resource pool to pay for [spirit], [leadership], and [tactics] allies. Response: After a character is healed by another card effect, heal 1 damage on it.

name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Éomer gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Hirgon
text: Response: After Hirgon quests successfully, play a [tactics] ally from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Then, you may raise your threat by 1 to give that ally +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Lothíriel
text: If Éomer is in play, Lothíriel gains the Rohan trait. Response: After Lothíriel commits to a quest, choose an ally in your hand. If that ally shares a Trait with her, put that ally into play exhausted and committed to the quest. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, shuffle it into your deck.

name: Éomund
text: Response: After Éomund leaves play, ready all Rohan characters in play.

name: Escort from Edoras
text: While committed to a quest, Escort from Edoras gets +2 [willpower]. Forced: After resolving a quest to which Escort from Edoras was committed, discard Escort from Edoras from play.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

name: Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

name: Riddermark Knight
text: Response: After Riddermark Knight is declared as an attacker, it gets +2 [attack] for this attack. At the end of this attack, discard Riddermark Knight.

name: West Road Traveller
text: Response: After you play West Road Traveller from your hand, switch the active location with any other location in the staging area.

name: Westfold Horse-Breaker
text: Action: Discard Westfold Horse-Breaker to choose and ready a hero.

name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

name: Westfold Lancer
text: Response: After Westfold Lancer quests successfully, discard it to choose a non-unique enemy in the staging area. Deal 2 damage to the chosen enemy.

name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.

name: Ancient Mathom
text: Attach to a location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.

name: Firefoot
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attached hero is Éomer). Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy.

name: Horn of the Mark
text: Attach to a Rohan hero or Merry. Restricted. Response: When a character leaves play, if that character shares at least one trait with the attached hero, exhaust Horn of the Mark to draw 1 card.

name: The Red Arrow
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a Gondor hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. Valour Response: After attached hero quests successfully, add The Red Arrow to the victory display to search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally and put it into play.

name: War Axe
text: Attach to a [tactics] character. Limit 1 per character. Restricted. Attached characters gets +1 [attack] for each attachment it has with the restricted keyword.

name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the 'when revealed' effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.

name: Astonishing Speed
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all Rohan characters get +2 [willpower].

name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

name: Forth Eorlingas!
text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.

name: Oath of Eorl
text: Play only if you control a unique character with the Rohan trait and another unique character with the Gondor trait. Response: At the beginning of the combat phase, you resolve the step in which you attack enemies before resolving enemy attacks this phase. (Each other player resolves the combat phase as normal after you resolve your attacks.)

name: The Muster of Rohan
text: While paying for The Muster of ~Rohan, each Rohan hero you control is considered to have a [spirit] icon. Planning Action: ~Search the top 10 cards of your deck for up to 4 Rohan allies and put them into play. Shuffle your deck. If any of those allies are still in play at the end of the round, discard them.

name: Wait no Longer
text: Response: At the beginning of the quest phase, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy and put it into play engaged with you. Then, reveal 1 less encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0). Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Fastred
text: Response: After Fastred defends an enemy attack, return that enemy to the staging area to reduce your threat by 2. (Limit once per phase.)

name: The Riddermark's Finest
text: Action: Exhaust and discard The Riddermark's Finest to place 2 progress tokens on any location.

name: Spear of the Mark
text: Attach to a Rohan character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 [attack]. (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area).

name: Steed of the Mark
text: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan hero. Response: after attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.

name: Rohan Warhorse
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.

name: Charge of the Rohirrim
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Rohan character with a Mount attachment gets +3 [attack].

name: The Oath
text: You are playing Campaign Mode. Setup: Each player chooses 1 Adaptation boon attachment and attaches it to one of their heroes. Shuffle the Stalking Goblin burden enemy into the encounter deck. Add Stalking Goblin and each attached Adaptation to the Campaign Pool. Response: At the end of each round, place 1 resource token here.

name: The Oath
text: Resolution: If there are 6 or more resource tokens here, the thought of the captured villagers suffering weighs heavily on you. Add the Guilty Conscience treachery burden to the Campaign Pool.

name: The Caves of Nibin-Dûm
text: You are playing Campaign Mode. Setup: Each player adds 1 copy of the 'No Time to Waste!' boon to their hand after drawing their starting hand (including taking a mulligan). Add each copy of 'No Time to Waste!' in a player's hand to the Campaign Pool. Shuffle the Shiny Distraction burden into the encounter deck and add it to the Campaign Pool.

name: The Caves of Nibin-Dûm
text: Resolution: Check the final threat of the player with the highest threat: If it is under 40, you have rescued a retired Ranger who shares his wisdom with you. Each player may add 1 copy of Ranger Sense to their deck and to the Campaign Pool. At the start of the next campaign, each player may also shuffle 1 copy of Ranger Sense into their deck and add it to the Campaign Pool.

name: The Fervor of Lore
text: Attached hero gains the [lore] resource icon. Action: Choose and discard 3 cards from your hand to heal all damage from a hero. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: The Might of Tactics
text: Attached hero gains the [tactics] resource icon. Action: Deal 1 damage to the attached hero to deal 3 damage to an enemy engaged with you. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: The Power of Spirit
text: Attached hero gains the [spirit] resource icon. Action: Exhaust the attached hero to place 3 progress on a location. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: The Secret of Leadership
text: Attached hero gains the [leadership] resource icon. Action: Spend 1 resource from the attached hero's resource pool to ready a hero. (Limit once per campaign. Record in Campaign Log when used.)

name: No Time to Waste!
text: When playing this card, choose one: Quest Action: Remove "No Time to Waste!" from the game and from the Campaign Pool to reduce each player's threat by 3. Reveal the top card of the encounter deck. Quest Action: Draw 1 card.

name: Ranger Sense
text: When playing this card, choose one: Quest Action: Remove Ranger Sense from the game and from the Campaign Pool to look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and put the rest back in any order. Quest Action: Draw 1 card.

name: Stalking Golbin
text: Forced: After Stalking Goblin engages you, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and your collection (in that order) for a Goblin Sniper and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.
shadow: Shadow: Add Stalking Goblin to the staging area.

name: Shiny Distraction
text: When Revealed: Each player may add 1 resource to each of their heroes' pools. Each player that does raises their threat by 5.

name: Guilty Conscience
text: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the highest threat cost. (Counts as an Adaptation attachment with the text: "Forced: Raise your threat by 2 at the end of each roun. Action: Spend 2 resources from attached hero's pool to discard this card.")
